finding: The SNP rs13254191 was discovered to be a causal SNP, with a noted effect size of β=0.03.
title: A High-resolution Haplotype-resolved Reference Panel Constructed from the China Kadoorie Biobank Study

finding: The sentinel variant rs78597169 showed association with short-term varenicline effectiveness (SVE) and was among variants implying significant biological mechanisms during varenicline treatment.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The T allele of rs881299 in FGFR1 was linked to lower FEV1/FVC but higher testosterone and SHBG levels, indicating possible connections between lung function and hormone regulation.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The locus at 8p21.2 (rs117325001) was identified as a significant finding in SCZ analysis, linked to the BNIP3L gene and associated with neurodevelopmental aspects.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs1396186 was associated with hospitalized COVID, specifically with obesity among Veterans of African ancestry, showing an OR of 1.13 (p=8.79 × 10^-6), supporting its relevance in specific populations.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: rs1106634 was associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and bipolar disorder in previous genome-wide association studies, indicating a significant role in psychiatric conditions.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: The SNP rs79407615 was identified as a sentinel variant located at chromosome 8, significantly associated with lower \\u0394THR (\\u03B2=-0.4123; p=1.58e-9), indicating a protective role against insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes.
title: Novel Loci (EIF4A2, ADIPOQ, TPRG1) for Triglyceride / High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol Ratio Longitudinal Change (ΔTHR) among Subjects without Type 2 Diabetes: Evidence from the Long Life Family Study (LLFS) and the Framingham Heart Study (FHS) Offspring Cohort (OS)

finding: The SNP was significant for CRF-slope in females, demonstrating evidence of effect size difference between sexes. It was located in an intron of the gene XKR6.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The SNP rs10096633 was found to be significant for triglyceride levels on chromosome 8, with a p-value of 3.24 x 10^-9, indicating a relevant association.
title: Two-phase sample selection strategies for design and analysis in post-genome wide association fine-mapping studies

finding: The SNP rs2678333 was identified as a GR-meQTL located on chromosome 12, exhibiting a post-dexamethasone-specific effect with a false discovery rate (FDR) of 8.24×10^-15. This finding highlighted its significant impact on DNA methylation in response to glucocorticoid activation.
title: Multi-omics analysis of the molecular response to glucocorticoids - insights into shared genetic risk from psychiatric to medical disorders

finding: The SNP rs6992333 located at 8q13.1 was linked to bipolar disorder and was also associated with brain structure, cortical surface measures, and white matter microstructure.
title: Isolating the genetic component of mania in bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs10503253 was associated with schizophrenia risk and was validated to affect both general cognitive ability and executive function in healthy males. This finding was reported in the context of the CSMD1 gene, which was previously implicated in neuropsychological outcomes.
title: Exome Sequencing of 963 Chinese Families Identifies Novel Epilepsy Candidate Genes

finding: The SNP rs11778922 displayed female-specific effects on BMI change, with an odds ratio of 0.984 for high-gain BMI cluster membership.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The SNP rs13281992 was genome-wide significantly associated with heel BMD, marking it as an important finding in relation to bone mineral density.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs10958404 was reported to have moderate inverse genetic correlation between head BMD and IA, highlighting its potential role in both traits.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: Located in <italic>NKX3-1</italic> at 8p21.2, this variant exhibited high statistical significance in relation to PSA variation, with <italic>P</italic>=6.3 10<sup>−83</sup>.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs11136000 SNP, associated with the CLU gene, was identified as the third strongest genetic risk factor for late-onset Alzheimer's disease after the APOE ε4 allele and the variant in TREM2. The studies described a combined effect of APOE ε4 and CLU on ventricular volume expansion and its surface morphology, indicating that carrying more alleles influenced the overall changes in brain ventricular volume.
title: Association of MRI-measured cerebral ventricular volume with APOE ε4 genotype, cerebrospinal fluid biomarkers (Aβ42 and Tau) and neuropsychological measures in Alzheimer’s disease: A Systematic Review

finding: SNP rs6395 was related to CYP11B1 at the 8q24.3 locus and was implicated in its splicing. The pathways linked to this SNP also indicated connections with elevated testosterone levels in women, suggesting another layer of involvement in endometrial cancer susceptibility.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study identifies novel endometrial cancer risk loci that are associated with obesity or female testosterone levels

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with BFP within female cohorts, demonstrating sex-specific effects.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2912062, related to genes ANGPT2 and AGPAT5, was associated with carotid intima-media thickness (IMT), a phenotype previously undocumented in any PheWAS platform, building on earlier findings by Strawbridge et al. (2020). The DeepPheWAS approach was successful in replicating known GWAS findings related to this SNP.
title: DeepPheWAS: an R package for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs9644568, located in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene, was significantly associated with high LDL-C levels among Filipinos. The G allele was identified as the risk allele, demonstrating a 2.44-fold increased risk in heterozygous individuals and a 10.66-fold increased risk in homozygous individuals. This finding was notable as it was the only variant to retain significance after adjustments for hypertension. It suggested a unique genetic risk marker for high LDL-C in the Filipino population.
title: Variant rs9644568 in the intergenic region downstream of the LPL gene is associated with high LDL cholesterol levels among Filipinos

finding: The rs28513081 variant located near the DEPTOR gene on chromosome 8 exhibited significant associations with brain imaging-derived phenotypes (IDPs). There were 19 brain IDPs that met the Bonferroni-corrected threshold for statistical significance (P-value<2.36×10−6). Notably, this variant was linked to reduced cortical thickness in specific brain regions and alterations in white matter microstructure, indicating a direct impact on brain structure that may be related to IPF risk.
title: Mapping brain endophenotypes associated with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis genetic risk

finding: At the CSGALNACT1 locus, the rs2958593 variant was associated exclusively with increased risk of ASXL1-associated CH (OR = 1.63 [1.38-1.91], P = 3.63 x 10^-8).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: mapped to previously identified regions for CUD near CHRNA2 and EPHX2, contributing to genetic insights for cannabis use.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The study found that rs372262693 of the TG,SLA gene interacted significantly with LTST for PP (P_GxE=2.3×10^-9) in Hispanic populations.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: This SNP was part of the findings from the GWAS on MDD PA-FGRS, with a reported beta of 0.026 and a p-value of 4.4 × 10^-8, indicating its relevance in the genetic understanding of MDD.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: The SNP rs591323, found at LOC105379297, was part of the top 20 associated SNPs for 'fast' PD progression, where the non-reference allele raised the risk for faster progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The rs34674752 variant in the SHARPIN gene was noted for its significant effect size in the longevity analysis despite different results in GWAS studies.
title: The effect of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants on longevity

finding: This SNP was associated with MMSE measurements with a P value of 1.89E-08 and located near TNKS, suggesting involvement in brain function.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease brain imaging biomarkers and neuropsychological phenotypes in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs10090297 was associated with the p53 pathway in glioblastoma, which is critical for tumor response to navtemadlin. The absence of TP53-inactivating mutations in recurrent tumors suggests that alternative mechanisms of resistance may involve this SNP. The findings underscored the significance of the p53 pathway in the context of treatment with navtemadlin, which produced pharmacodynamic effects that could enhance therapeutic strategies for recurrent glioblastoma.
title: Surgical window of opportunity trial reveals mechanisms of response and resistance to navtemadlin (KRT-232) in patients with recurrent glioblastoma

finding: This SNP played a role in the shared genetic architecture of hypothyroidism and TSH levels.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The SNP rs12542037, associated with endometriosis, exhibited strong linkage disequilibrium with lead SNPs for osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis, affecting genes involved in immune system regulation.
title: The Association between Endometriosis and Immunological diseases

finding: The ADRA1A rs1048101 variant was linked to increased chronic kidney disease risk (HR 1.18, p=0.01). The results suggested that if AA homozygotes received treatments considering this genotype, 86 CKD diagnoses could have been avoided.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The SNP rs3802177 in SLC30A8 was associated exclusively with early T2D diagnosis, contributing significantly to the development of T2D, especially in males.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6577691 in KHDRBS3 was also associated exclusively with early T2D diagnosis, suggesting an important connection to the timing of T2D onset.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs819185 SNP at STC1 exhibited a significant interaction with thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) levels, specifically showing larger effect sizes on eGFRcrea at lower TSH levels with a P-value of 0.00177.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The rs819196 SNP at STC1 was similarly found to interact with TSH levels, exhibiting larger effects on eGFRcrea at lower TSH levels with a P-value of 0.00154.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses of kidney function genetic loci in a general population study

finding: The SNP rs2950922 was associated with the occurrence of very rare functional variants in the EBV gene BALF5, linked to viral DNA replication during the late phase of lytic infection. It showed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.31 with a p-value of 4.2×10^-12, indicating a significant association. This SNP served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for UNC5D in esophageal tissue.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The SNP rs1801280 was included in the analysis of the NAT2 gene, which was related to isoniazid metabolism. It was found that individuals with the variant allele at this locus were categorized as slow acetylators, which was associated with a higher risk of tuberculosis treatment-related adverse drug reactions (TB-ADR).
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: SNP rs1799930 was also examined within the NAT2 gene context and contributed to the slow acetylator classification. This genotype profile was associated with increased susceptibility to TB-ADR due to its influence on isoniazid metabolism.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: The analysis of SNP rs1799931, as part of the NAT2 gene, identified it as a contributor to slow acetylator status, thus correlating with the elevated risk of TB-ADR when using isoniazid.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: Similarly, SNP rs1801279 was considered in the evaluation of the NAT2 gene and was linked to slow acetylation. This finding further supported the relationship between genotype and the risk for TB-ADR.
title: Prediction models for adverse drug reactions during tuberculosis treatment in Brazil

finding: The SNP rs7000397 was identified as a lead variant associated with thyroid volume in the conventional imputation GWAS. It had significant results after adjusting for multiple testing, confirming known associations on thyroid traits.
title: Removing array-specific batch effects in GWAS mega-analyses by applying a two-step imputation workflow reveals new associations for thyroid volume and goiter

finding: This SNP exhibited a genome-wide significant association (P=3.51×10^-8) with tau deposition after adjustment for APOE-ε4 status, highlighting its relevance in tau pathology.
title: Genome-wide scan of Flortaucipir PET levels finds JARID2 associated with cerebral tau deposition

finding: The minor C-allele of SNP rs13273708 was associated with a decrease in DNA methylation levels at the LY6E gene only in SS patients, suggesting a disease-specific epigenetic change that could contribute to SS pathology.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The minor A-allele of SNP rs902834 decreased the DNA methylation level at the STAT1 gene only in SS patients, emphasizing a specific genetic influence on the expression of this gene in the SS population.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The non-coding variant rs183373024, located near the POU5F1B gene, was found to contribute 0.54 attributable DALYs, primarily through its association with prostate cancer, noted with a 95% confidence interval of 0.48-0.60 and a very significant P-value of 1.1×10^-74.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: This SNP was associated with left ventricular function traits including increased ejection fraction and decreased LV end-systolic and end-diastolic volumes. It overlapped an enhancer predicted to regulate MTSS1 in ventricular cardiomyocytes, connecting its genetic influence to cardiac development.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: In strong linkage disequilibrium with rs35006907, this variant was also linked to traits related to left ventricular functionality, implicating a shared regulatory influence on MTSS1.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: Also in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs35006907, this SNP was tied to the same cardiac traits related to MTSS1, underscoring the cumulative genetic effect on left ventricular dimensions and functionality.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The rs12334416 variant mapped to the PINX1 gene, which is associated with 8p23.1 duplication syndrome linked to developmental delay. This locus was part of the significant findings for sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The rs35847492 credible set overlapped the TNKS gene, which is also associated with 8p23.1 duplication syndrome. This finding contributed to the loci identified for sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The rs2920991 variant overlapped the PRAG1 gene, known for encoding an enzyme in the tyrosine kinase family. It replicated at Bonferroni-corrected significance in the context of sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: At a locus near MSRA, rs117344298 was linked to decreased mutation count in males, with no association found in females, emphasizing the sex-specific nature of genetic contributions to mutation burden.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The SNP rs2912062, known to be associated with carotid intima-media thickness (IMT), was analyzed using Deep-PheWAS, which confirmed the original findings and explored the relationship with phenotypes not available in prior PheWAS platforms.
title: Deep-PheWAS: a pipeline for phenotype generation and association analysis for phenome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs4841132 in PPP1R3B was also previously associated with an increased risk of liver disease, underlining its role in glycogen metabolism.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The rs2978977 variant was also designated as genome-wide significant for gastric cancer through TAPE and TAPE-LTFH in the analysis of Korean samples. Its prior associations with gastric cancer in Chinese and Japanese populations highlight its potential importance across different ethnic groups.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: The SNP rs17776622 was significantly associated with the expression of SOX7e eRNA, suggesting it affects SOX7 gene expression by altering YY1 binding motifs.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The SNP rs56687477 was correlated with the increased expression of ZNF703e, an oncogene significantly associated with breast cancer.
title: Enhancer RNA transcriptome-wide association study reveals an atlas of pan-cancer susceptibility eRNAs

finding: The T allele associated with this SNP was linked to lower FEV1/FVC, presenting associations with higher testosterone and other hormonal factors.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: Variant rs530542541, located in gene ANK1, was identified in conjunction with increasing severity of SB and AUD at a p-value indicating strong significance below 10^-6, reinforcing the relationship among these complex traits.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Suicidal Behaviors and Alcohol Use Disorders in an American Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs9643846 was included among the intronic SNPs in the ZMAT4 gene, identified as significant with a p-value of 6.57E-07. ZMAT4 has potential implications in Kawasaki disease and related pathologies through its unspecified biological role.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The rs6998061 variant in POU5F1B was replicated as a risk variant for multiple cancer types, with an odds ratio of 1.23 in prostate cancer and 1.25 in colorectal cancer, indicating its association with increased risk.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The rs191064896 variant in ADGRB1 had a notable link to both lymphoid neoplasms and breast cancer, with an odds ratio of 108.36, suggesting its role in multiple cancer pathologies.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The SNP rs2721939 in the TRPS1 gene at locus 8q23.3 was noted for its association with brain age gap traits, indicating a potential role in neurodevelopmental processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The proxy SNP rs2279590 was included in the combined genetic risk score analysis for Alzheimer’s disease. The study indicated that the GRS including the APOE4 isoform demonstrated the strongest positive associations for cholesterol-related traits per doubling of genetic liability to Alzheimer's, highlighting its importance.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The SNP rs73293634, located in an intergenic region near the gene SLCO5A1, achieved a genome-wide significant association with impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME) with a p-value of 7.5 × 10^-9. This SNP explained 10.1% of the phenotypic variance (PVE) in impulsivity scores among European individuals. Additionally, colocalization analysis indicated that the minor allele (T) was associated with decreased expression of SLCO5A1 in the cerebral cortex.
title: SLCO5A1 and synaptic assembly genes contribute to impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy

finding: Funmap uniquely identified rs2928617 as the causal SNP for the region, achieving a PIP of 1.0 which indicated a highly significant association with trait TC. This was a positive original finding that demonstrated the ability of Funmap to prioritize a single causal SNP amidst strong linkage disequilibrium with neighboring SNPs.
title: Funmap: integrating high-dimensional functional annotations to improve fine-mapping

finding: Identified as an eQTL in subcutaneous adipose tissue and an sQTL in the left atrial appendage for the <italic>DPY19L4</italic> gene, indicating its role in gene expression regulation relevant to cardiac function.
title: Genome-wide analysis of heart failure yields insights into disease heterogeneity and enables prognostic prediction in the Japanese population

finding: The SNP rs920590 in INTS10 was associated with an increased risk of insulin resistance (IR), specifically under the recessive model. Individuals carrying the T/T genotype had an odds ratio (OR) of 4.01 (95% CI 1.55-10.34; p < 0.0014), indicating a significant association with IR.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs61740399 located in the YTHDF3 gene was identified as one of the novel loci for anxiety (ANX), signifying its involvement in the genetic architecture of anxiety disorders.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: This SNP was found in the CHRNA2 gene on chromosome 8 with a p-value of 2.86E-20. Its association with TUD emphasized the genetic underpinnings related to nicotinic receptors in smoking behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This rare missense variant in ADCK5 was associated with glycocholenate sulfate levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The PYCR3 variant was linked to S-1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate, significant for proline metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This SNP was significantly associated (p=1.60E-09) with the XKR6 gene, known for its role in externalizing behaviors.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: This SNP resulted in a significant finding (p=5.00E-09), linked to SGK223 and CLDN23, with previous associations to mental health traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs62516550, in the RP1 gene, exhibited a p-value of 2.94×10^-11 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.20, contributing to the genetic landscape of rIA risk.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: The SNP rs17057051 was located in an intron of the PTK2B gene, which is known to be associated with both inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and Alzheimer's disease (AD). This SNP, along with others, implicated PTK2B in pathways relevant to the immune response, particularly in monocyte migration and neutrophil degranulation.
title: Genetic insights into the association between inflammatory bowel disease and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs73223431 was identified within the same intron of PTK2B as rs17057051. It was associated with susceptibility to Alzheimer's disease, reinforcing the role of PTK2B in immune responses and signaling pathways relevant to both IBD and AD.
title: Genetic insights into the association between inflammatory bowel disease and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Similar to the other two SNPs, rs28834970 resided in an intron of the PTK2B gene. It was included in the findings indicating the significance of PTK2B in relation to both AD and IBD, highlighting its role in important signaling and immune response mechanisms.
title: Genetic insights into the association between inflammatory bowel disease and Alzheimer’s disease

finding: SNP rs35246381 near NAT2 was identified to have similar metabolic profiles associated with lipid traits, indicating a role in insulin resistance and lipid management.
title: Lipo-proteomic and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: The rs16872808 SNP in the ZFPM2 locus was significantly associated with reduced difficulty awakening after conditioning on chronotype (β Conditional = -0.01, SE = 0.002, p = 5.44×10^-9) and significantly associated with evening chronotype after conditioning on difficulty awakening (β Conditional = 0.04, SE = 0.006, p = 1.12×10^-8). This highlighted its important role in both traits and their interconnection with sleep patterns.
title: Sleep inertia drives the association of evening chronotype with psychiatric disorders: epidemiological and genetic evidence

finding: The rs685985 SNP interacted with the CHD7 gene in CD4+ T cells. CHD7 is known for its role in chromatin remodeling and was linked to immune cell counts, pointing to its importance in SSc.
title: Functional genomics in primary T cells and monocytes identifies mechanisms by which genetic susceptibility loci influence systemic sclerosis risk

finding: SNP rs2976562, associated with SLA expression, was identified in eQTL analyses. It showed a significant association with lower SLA expression following MTB stimulation (p=0.03) and was linked to increased TB severity, especially among T/T homozygotes, suggesting a potential mechanistic link concerning TB severity.
title: Tuberculosis severity associates with variants and eQTLs related to vascular biology and infection-induced inflammation

finding: The SNP rs2044899 at the NDUFAF6 locus was found to provide consistent evidence as a risk factor for AD, aligning with findings from earlier GWAS meta-analyses.
title: First GWAS on Alzheimer’s Disease in Argentina and Chile populations

finding: The SNP rs13281992 was previously reported to be genome-wide significant associated with heel bone mineral density (BMD). In this study, it was identified within a fracture-associated locus, demonstrating its relevance to fracture risk.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs13266634, a missense variant in the SLC30A8 gene, was significantly associated with GDM, registering an OR of 1.29 (95% CI 1.19, 1.40) and a p-value of 1.83×10-10, demonstrating the genetic contribution of this locus to GDM risk.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: The SNP rs9643199 demonstrated consistent associations with time to irreversible EDSS milestones in females, with aHR of 1.35 (p=0.006) for irEDSS3 and 1.46 (p=7.09×10-4) for irEDSS6.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The AD protective allele of rs1532278 was linked to elevated CLU expression and enhanced neuronal excitability in iPSC-derived neurons. This SNP had a significant impact on neuron-glia interactions, particularly in promoting lipid transfer from neurons to astrocytes, correlated with lower glutamate uptake in the latter, thereby effectively supporting neuronal excitability. The T allele was less frequently observed in AD patients, indicating its protective nature.
title: Alzheimer’s disease protective allele of Clusterin modulates neuronal excitability through lipid-droplet-mediated neuron-glia communication

finding: The SNP rs11992444, an intronic variant in CDCA2, was associated with VAT adjusted for BMI (VATadjBMI) with a very strong significance (P = 1.3 x 10^-29), and was previously connected to waist circumference adjusted for BMI (WCadjBMI) and serum triglycerides.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The risk (ALT) allele of rs612558 was linked to a 25% reduction in chromatin accessibility, correlating with increased expression of nearby RAB2A, demonstrating its functional significance within the locus.
title: Multi-omics analysis in primary T cells elucidates mechanisms behind disease associated genetic loci

finding: Rs2979256 was related to fractional anisotropy in the inferior fronto-occipital fasciculus, indicating genetic overlap with sleep characteristics.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs11992186 was identified relating to cardiac MRI traits and sleep conditions that presented genetic overlaps.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At the MSRA locus, rs117344298 was significantly associated with decreased mutation count in males, revealing sex-specific genetic influences in hematopoiesis.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The variant rs2942194 in the SLC25A37 gene was associated with PAU as identified in the cross-ancestry analyses, showcasing its potential role in addiction genetics.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The study found that SNP IKBKB rs2272736 was associated with the survival rates of gastric cancer patients. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic factors influencing prognosis in gastric cancer.
title: Loss of heterozygosity in gastric cancers in a set of Mexican patients

finding: This SNP, a cis-eQTL for ZBTB10, was noted for its role in regulating B-cell development and asthma pathogenesis.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The rs147261056 SNP found in the ASPH gene interacted with long total sleep time (LTST) in relation to TG levels, indicating a significant association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The SNP rs114083565, located in the RUNX1 gene, displayed an interaction with STST relative to TG levels, indicating significant associations.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: TRIB1 contained this SNP and was recognized as shared between multiple FA traits in both model analyses.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: Characterized as a missense mutation within the DOK2 gene associated with atopic dermatitis, showing potential links to immune pathways.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP showed a p-value of 6.3×10^-83 and was noted as a relevant genetic variant related to variations in PSA levels, linking it to prostate cancer.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs11787077 located in the CLU gene demonstrated nominal significance (P=0.023) in the analysis. This variant is previously established as a major genetic risk factor for Alzheimer Disease, reinforcing its significance in diverse populations including the Peruvian sample studied.
title: A genome-wide association study in Peruvians suggests new risk loci for Alzheimer Disease

finding: The SNP rs2736345 at locus 8p23.1 was reported to have a significant P-value of 1.5×10⁻²⁵ for its association with SLE, marking it as one of the notable non-HLA susceptibility genes shared between the two ethnicities.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene PTK2B and showed significant correlation with AD risk, linking it to important pathways involved in neurodegeneration.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: This SNP served as a significant eSNP for PTK2B and indicated a connection with Alzheimer's disease, being moderately correlated with known AD-associated GWAS SNPs.
title: Cell-type Specific Expression Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Alzheimer Disease in Blood and Brain Tissue

finding: The study indicated that the T allele of BIN3 rs2280104 was significantly associated with excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) and altered network topology in Parkinson's disease (PD). Specifically, it was found that the degree centrality (DC) of the left calcarine in the structural network was negatively associated with ESS scores, and this DC also mediated the effects of rs2280104 on both ESS and EDS.
title: Structural network topology mediated cognitive impairment in Parkinson’s disease

finding: rs2738058 was associated with periodontal disease and showed a significant positive correlation with colorectal cancer risk (p=0.026); it was among the five SNPs with very strong evidence for association with periodontal disease.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: Similar to rs4284742, it was noted for its strong association with periodontal disease; however, specific cancer associations were not detailed.
title: Two-sample Mendelian randomization analysis of associations between periodontal disease and risk of colorectal, lung, and pancreatic cancers

finding: The SNP rs60103302 was identified as the top signal associated with hip BMD, showing a minor allele frequency of 0.0092 and a strong association (P=1.67×10−7). This finding was observed only using the SEAD panel, which highlighted the importance of an Asian-specific reference for detecting rare variants.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The intronic SNP rs111829635 was noted for significantly increasing luciferase activity, indicating it likely alters SNTG1 gene expression. This suggests that it plays a functional role in the context of BMD traits.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: The SNP rs56372821, located near the gene CHRNA2, was associated with cannabis use disorder (CUD). It was highlighted as related to the cholinergic system and nicotinic receptors, suggesting a potential role in the underlying aetiology of CUD. This association remained significant in analyses controlling for smoking traits, indicating a robust genetic link.
title: Examining the independent roles of cannabis use and tobacco use in depression risk: a multivariable Mendelian randomisation study

finding: SNP rs11992999 on chromosome 8 was linked to HAS2, which encodes a hyaluronic synthetase. This variant was associated with modulation of VSMC proliferation and contributed to changes in aortic distensibility.
title: The Genetic Determinants of Aortic Distension

finding: The SNP rs6983263 was found at locus 8q22.1, with an OR of 0.92 (95% CI = 0.90, 0.95) and a P-value of 4.47×10−8. This variant is an intronic variant in LAPTM4B and represents one of the identified significant associations in the context of IPF.
title: Common and rare variant analyses reveal novel genetic factors underlying Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis and shared aetiology with COVID-19

finding: The rare, AA-specific variant of the non-coding SNP rs72725854 at the 8q24 locus was associated with approximately a 2-fold increased risk of prostate cancer (PrCa). The alternate allele 'T' introduced a binding site for the transcription factor SPDEF, which substantially increased the activity of the enhancer harboring the SNP. In response to androgen stimulation, the expression of the enhancer's target genes PCAT1, PVT1, and c-Myc in prostate tumors was significantly increased. The reference allele 'A' remained non-responsive to androgen, underscoring the importance of germline non-coding regulatory variants in mediating cancer risk.
title: Non-coding genetic variants underlying higher prostate cancer risk in men of African ancestry

finding: The common SNP rs10095018 was identified as a lost activity eSNP. The alternate allele 'C' substantially reduced enhancer activity according to the model (EWN=10), resulting in decreased expression of the tumor suppressor gene NDRG1, which is known for its role in PrCa suppression. This reduction was linked to poorer survival outcomes in PrCa patients and higher Gleason scores, indicating worse prognosis. The data also indicated that the alternate allele 'C' disrupted FOXA1 binding, further implicating it in the adverse outcomes seen in PrCa.
title: Non-coding genetic variants underlying higher prostate cancer risk in men of African ancestry

finding: Detected significant association with Negative Urgency, with established connections to several traits including BMI.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: Also linked to Negative Urgency, showing significant genetic correlations with multiple psychiatric traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs4732724 was the second genome-wide significant independent SNP identified within the GWAS for cannabis use disorder. Similar to rs7783012, it was part of a large-scale study involving 363,884 individuals that supported its association with cannabis use disorder.
title: Association between cannabis use and brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank: an observational and Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs13281992 was previously reported to be genome-wide significantly associated with heel BMD.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The rs1041983 polymorphism in the NAT2 gene was associated with severe adverse drug reactions (ADRs) in a cohort from Taiwan, where 22.8% of participants were identified as slow metabolizers of isoniazid. This finding suggested that variations in the NAT2 gene contributed to the variability in isoniazid concentrations and the occurrence of ADRs.
title: Clinical Predictors of 3-Months Isoniazid Rifapentine (3HP) - Related Adverse Drug Reactions (ADR) During Tuberculosis Preventive Therapy. (PAnDoRA-3HP study): An Observational Study Protocol

finding: The rs1532423 variant from the CA1 gene showed low frequency linked to decreased zinc levels, potentially reducing COVID-19 susceptibility in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs4523233 variant was determined to be the likely causal variant for 11-deoxycortisol, suggesting reduced enzymatic activity or expression of CYP11B1, which catalyzes the conversion to cortisol. This indicated a genetic influence on steroidogenesis comparative to health status.
title: Steroid hormone levels vary with sex, aging, lifestyle, and genetics

finding: The rs6987313 variant was noted to be associated with phosphate and triglyceride levels.
title: New insights into the genetic etiology of 57 essential and non-essential trace elements in humans

finding: Variant rs3802177 in the SLC30A8 gene showed a significant association in the context of diabetes modifying colorectal cancer risk, with a p-value of 5.46×10−11 in joint tests. Although it was not directly associated with colorectal cancer, it was strongly associated with diabetes (p-value: 4.90×10−10) and had an interaction with diabetes for colorectal cancer risk (p-value: 7.49×10−04). The odds ratios (OR) for diabetes vs. colorectal cancer among those with AA genotype exhibited the greatest effect (OR: 1.62, p-value: 7.5×10−07).
title: Probing the diabetes and colorectal cancer relationship using gene – environment interaction analyses

finding: A second genome-wide significant association was found at rs7834393 near UBE2W for Duane retraction syndrome (p=3.1e-08, MAF=0.00374, OR=47.331), although likely a technical artifact.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The SNP rs4841132 located in the PPP1R3B gene was documented in literature to play a role in the regulation of glucose metabolism and was relevant to the analysis of glucagon sensitivity.
title: Studies to develop a glucagon sensitivity test in humans: The GLUSENTIC study protocol

finding: The lead SNP rs6473226 was observed to lie between genes MIR5708 and RNU6-1213P and its association with asthma was reported in several European-ancestry studies.
title: A powerful replicability analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The variant rs2976397 at the PSCA locus showed significant association with gastric ulcer, gastric cancer, and gastric polyp, achieving an Odds Ratio (OR) of 0.86 and a p-value of 6.1×10−24 for gastric ulcer.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs4733781 replicated in the multi-ancestry analysis with a significant p-value of 3.22e-05, being located in the ASAP1 gene region, which has been previously linked to TB susceptibility.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: Like rs4733781, the variant rs10956514 also demonstrated a significant replication (p-value = 0.000118) in the multi-ancestry meta-analysis and is located in the ASAP1 gene region, reinforcing its association with TB susceptibility.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: SNP rs58379124 was another variant mapping onto nicotinic receptor genes related to cigarette smoking, highlighting its relevance in nicotine pathways.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs73229090 was also confirmed as a cis-eQTL linked to nicotinic receptor expression, contributing to the genetics of nicotine use.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: Rs10283100 was associated with the size or shape features of subcortical structures and concordant with previous findings related to brain volume.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This SNP was linked with educational attainment, affirming its importance in understanding genetically influenced traits.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The intronic SNP rs4607615 showed associations with the expression of MSRA, RP1L1, and especially PRSS51 (p=6.11x10^-7), with implications for neurotransmitter signaling in AD.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study of Alzheimer disease reveals many differentially expressed genes and multiple biological pathways in brain tissue from African American donors

finding: Significant association was confirmed for rs16892766 located at 8q23.3, which presented an OR of 1.52 (95% CI: 1.082-2.142, P=0.01), matching previously acknowledged risk trends.
title: Colorectal Cancer Risk and Ancestry in Colombian admixed Populations

finding: Associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), contributing to the understanding of gentler disease trajectories.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs2920287 was identified as a genome-wide significant hit for reaction time with a p-value of 1.907e-08, indicating a strong association with this cognitive phenotype. The minor allele frequency (MAF) was reported as 0.04. However, follow-up analyses using the GWAS Catalog did not find associations between rs2920287 and any other traits, suggesting that its significance may be specific to reaction time rather than a broader set of cognitive or affective traits.
title: Positive and negative affect, related mental health traits, and cognitive performance: shared genetic architecture and potential causality

finding: The genetic variant rs12541595 in the MTSS1 enhancer demonstrated significant associations with left ventricular (LV) MTSS1 expression and showed interaction with biological sex regarding its effects on cardiac magnetic resonance (CMR) traits, particularly in women.
title: Sex-Specific Effect of MTSS1 Downregulation on Dilated Cardiomyopathy

finding: The genetic variant rs35006907 was associated with LV MTSS1 expression and exhibited a notable sex dimorphism, influencing CMR traits primarily in females more than males.
title: Sex-Specific Effect of MTSS1 Downregulation on Dilated Cardiomyopathy

finding: This SNP affected NCALD, a calcium sensor with documented interactions involving muscle signaling pathways. Genetic variations in this locus were connected to reduced NCALD expression impacting endocytosis, emphasizing its role as a modulator in disease progression.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The SNP rs11136000 was found to be significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in Caucasian populations, as confirmed by a study that analyzed 74,248 samples, but this association was not observed in the Chinese population. This indicates a genetic link between the CLU polymorphism and the susceptibility to AD.
title: Multi-transcriptomic analysis points to early organelle dysfunction in human astrocytes in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Tagged the <italic>CLU</italic> locus with a strong association (p=5.5×10<sup>−8</sup>), this rare variant replicated in three studies and was linked to clusterin, suggesting its potential involvement in AD onset.
title: Genetic Associations with Age at Dementia Onset in the PSEN1 E280A Colombian Kindred

finding: The genetic variant rs66886237 at 8p21.3 was found to be significantly associated with the composite cardiovascular endpoint of death or hospitalization for heart failure in patients with preserved ejection fraction in the CHARM-Preserved study. This was evidenced by a hazard ratio of 1.91, with a 95% confidence interval of 1.55-2.35 and a P-value of 1.7×10^-9. The findings indicated that the minor allele (A) had a frequency of 14% in the population studied.
title: Pharmacogenomic study of heart failure and candesartan response from the CHARM programme

finding: The rs184889639 variant, associated with an increased odds for T2D (OR = 1.9, 95% CI: 1.5-2.3, p = 1.06 x 10^-9), showed enrichment in African American ancestry and was related to higher HbA1c and fasting glucose levels.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The SNP rs113343238 was identified as having a higher association with prostate cancer (PrCa) diagnosis in the African ancestry group, despite being protective in the European ancestry group. This contrasts its originally identified role, highlighting its specific significance in African ancestry individuals.
title: PRState: Incorporating Genetic Ancestry in Prostate Cancer Risk scores for African American Men

finding: Similar to rs113343238, rs943270004 was found to be protective in the European ancestry group while demonstrating a higher association with PrCa diagnosis in the African ancestry group. This indicated the necessity for a nuanced understanding of PrCa risk based on ancestry.
title: PRState: Incorporating Genetic Ancestry in Prostate Cancer Risk scores for African American Men

finding: The SNP rs7018178 was highlighted for its high allele frequency, making it a pivotal candidate in the study for assessing copy number alterations and aiding the effectiveness of SNP-based methodologies.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: As a heterozygous SNP, rs7843014 was assessed in both classic and SNP-based approaches, reinforcing its significance in evaluating copy number alterations particularly within chromosome 8q.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: The variant rs4733781 replicated in the multi-ancestry analysis with a p-value of 3.22e-05, showing consistent direction of effects with previous GWAS results linking ASAP1 variants to TB susceptibility.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: The variant rs10956514 also replicated with a p-value of 0.000118, and similar to rs4733781, it was associated with TB susceptibility in the ASAP1 gene region.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of host genetic susceptibility to tuberculosis identifies shared genetic architecture

finding: The rs2919408 SNP at chromosome 8q13.3 was validated in the context of left-sided bone metastasis. Its significance increased in conjunction with the specific subtype analyses, reinforcing its association with bone metastasis in CRC.
title: Functional annotation with expression validation identifies novel metastasis-relevant genes from post-GWAS risk loci in sporadic colorectal carcinomas

finding: The SNP rs1466526 was associated with sex-biased expression of the gene ZC2HC1A, exhibiting a greater effect in females. This variant was implicated in multiple sclerosis risk, with significant enrichments identified in MS susceptibility loci, and it played a role in the female-biased expression pattern of ZC2HC1A.
title: Biological sex affects functional variation across the human genome

finding: The SNP rs601558 was significantly associated with the LBS of the left cerebellum cortex (p=8.0E-11). This exonic missense variant is located within RSPO2 and was also seen as a brain eQTL, despite being classified as benign by ClinVar and AlphaMissense.
title: Beyond Volume: Unraveling the Genetics of Human Brain Geometry

finding: In the study, rs755857 was found to be significant in the GWAS of all CC subregions except for mid-posterior. Although previously unassociated with any other traits, this SNP is linked to the gene PINX1. Alterations in PINX1 have been connected to levels of gamma glutamyl transferase and serum alkaline phosphatase, which are clinical markers of liver function.
title: Distributed Genetic Effects of the Corpus Callosum Subregions Suggest Links to Neuropsychiatric Disorders and Related Traits

finding: As a proxy for absent SNPs identified in the analysis, it was still considered relevant despite not having direct birthweight association data.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs11779558 at the 8p21.3 locus showed significant association with eQTL functionality in artery tibial tissue, implicating its role in the regulation of the exportin 7 (XPO7) gene, which may be related to cardiovascular disease processes.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: Tagged by rs72711165, this locus was found to be associated with increased risk of severe COVID-19 symptoms, particularly in East Asian populations, similar to rs1886814.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was found to significantly correlate with NAFLD, being one of the novel missense variants discovered.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The study identified the FOG2 S657G variant (rs28374544) as significantly associated with coronary microvascular disease (CMVD) through Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS). This association was evident in a cohort where carriers of the S657G variant exhibited increased chest pain, altered coronary blood flow, and a smaller burden of obstructive coronary artery disease. Further analysis indicated that this variant led to increased angiogenic gene expression and was considered a gain-of-function mutation affecting angiogenesis, while also regulating the hypoxia-inducible factor (HIF) pathway.
title: FOG2 coding variant Ser657Gly is associated with Coronary Microvascular Disease through altered hypoxia-mediated gene transcription

finding: The variant rs11985201 was associated with the deletion of <italic>ADAM3A/ADAM5P</italic> and showed an adjusted hazard ratio (HR) of 1.483 for acute rejection (AR) time, indicating an increased risk of AR. Additionally, it was linked to decreased expression of the IDO1 gene, which is crucial for immunomodulation.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The SNP rs1045547 showed opposing effects on stomach cancer and duodenal ulcer, indicating its involvement in a conflict of risk factors under balancing selection.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: The SNP rs819185 at STC1 exhibited significantly larger effects on eGFRcrea at lower TSH levels, with a P-value of 0.00177, establishing a notable interaction.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses in an individual population study help characterize kidney function genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs819196 at STC1 was also identified to have a stronger effect on eGFRcrea at lower TSH levels, with a P-value of 0.00154, and the interaction reached significance illustrating its role as an effect modifier.
title: Systematic mediation and interaction analyses in an individual population study help characterize kidney function genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs4607615 in MSRA was nearly genome-wide significant with p=7.37×10^-8, representing suggestive evidence.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs61732533 was associated with two genes, MAF1 and BOP1, found in excitatory neurons, where MAF1 was identified as a stress responsive transcription factor and mTOR effector. Aberrant mTOR signaling has been implicated in Alzheimer's Disease (AD), mainly through oxidative stress.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP rs1065712 was linked to the hub gene CTSB, prioritized in excitatory neurons, suggesting its potential role in AD pathology.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: For SNP rs1532278, the hub gene CLU was prioritized, emphasizing its potential role in AD pathology.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: In a gene aggregate approach, the variant rs779805849 within ANK1 showed weak evidence of replication for stroke (p-value of 0.01) in T1D.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: This variant replicated for hemorrhagic stroke in T1D with a p-value of less than 0.05.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: Similar to rs146416859, this variant also replicated for hemorrhagic stroke in T1D with a p-value of less than 0.05.
title: Whole-genome sequencing identifies variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs16906115 near IL7 was associated with increased lymphocyte stability after immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) initiation, which correlated with downstream immune related adverse events (irAEs) and improved survival. It had a combined p-value of 1.6×10^-11 and a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.1, replicating significantly in three independent cohorts.
title: Germline variants associated with immunotherapy-related adverse events

finding: The intergenic SNP rs112875651 was found near the TRIB1 gene, associated with lipid metabolism and circulating triglyceride levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs721399 near NAT2, responsible for detoxifying drugs and carcinogens, was anticipated in association with liver-related traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs8192330 variant overlapping with SFTPC isoforms was found to significantly decrease in COVID-19 patients with higher viral loads, indicating a potential role in pulmonary functions.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The SNP rs2980871 was found associated with NLR (Beta = 0.04, p = 4.64 x 10^-8) and is mapped to the gene Tribbles homolog 1 (TRIB1), which is involved in hepatic lipid synthesis and glycogenesis.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study of neutrophil-lymphocyte ratio and polygenic risk score development to explore causal association with diabetic retinopathy

finding: The SNP rs7013955 on chromosome 8 demonstrated a suggestive association with MSA, with a P-value of 3.7 × 10^-6 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.80 (95% CI = 1.40-2.31). This locus maps to the gene LOXL2, indicating potential relevance in the neurodegenerative pathway of MSA.
title: Genome-wide association study of autopsy-confirmed Multiple System Atrophy identifies common variants near ZIC1 and ZIC4

finding: The rs7982 SNP in the CLU locus showed significant association with AD in large meta-analysis with a P-value of 7.81e-11, indicating its role in amyloid pathology.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: Carriers of this variant showed higher fasting glucose (FG) levels in non-diabetic individuals, highlighting its role in metabolic dysregulation.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: This SNP located in the NKX3-1 gene showed a strong association with PSA levels and was implicated in prostate cancer risk.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs35863913, associated with the LACTB2-AS1 gene, demonstrated association with pelvic organ prolapse and was identified in linkage disequilibrium with significant lead signals, with a p-value of 3.05 × 10^-7.
title: Advancing our understanding of genetic risk factors and potential personalized strategies in pelvic organ prolapse: largest GWAS to date reveals 19 novel associated loci

finding: The SNP rs541421523 was located within neuron, oligodendrocyte, and astrocyte-specific regulatory elements, indicating its potential relationship with cognitive processes, although specific functional implications were less directly specified compared to the other found SNPs.
title: Rare genetic coding variants associated with age-related episodic memory decline implicate distinct memory pathologies in the hippocampus

finding: The variant has a high MAF in the Khoesan population and can indicate potential adaptive significance reflective of population history.
title: Impact of natural selection on global patterns of genetic variation, and association with clinical phenotypes, at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The BIN3 rs2280104 T allele was found to be associated with excessive daytime sleepiness and alterations in network topology in Parkinson's disease, suggesting that this SNP may influence non-motor symptoms.
title: Striatal dopamine depletion drives disease progression and network topology aberrations specifically by impairing left M1 network

finding: The SNP rs7821914 was associated with neuroticism and demonstrated a unique pattern where the effect allele increased risk for ASD while decreasing risk for ADHD. This highlights the differing genetic associations of traits linked to the disorders.
title: Identification of shared and differentiating genetic risk for autism spectrum disorder, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and case subgroups

finding: The SNP MYOM2-rs2294066 was found to precisely predict the response to anti-TNF therapy in patients with ankylosing spondylitis. This finding indicated a significant association between the genetic variation at that locus and treatment effectiveness, highlighting the potential for personalized medicine approaches in rheumatology.
title: Understanding the role and adoption of artificial intelligence techniques in rheumatology research: an in-depth review of the literature

finding: Utilized as a proxy SNP, it demonstrated a significant association with usual walking pace and related implications for migraine risk.
title: Potential Causal Relationship between Faster Walking Pace and Reduced Migraine Risk: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: This SNP located near CDCA2 showed a large association with HGSOC with a relative risk of 25.60, indicating potentially significant implications for cell cycle regulation in ovarian cancer.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The variant rs10094888 was nearest to SLURP2 and showed strong association effects in dermatophytosis, indicating its possible involvement in skin immune responses.
title: The genetic basis of dermatophytosis skin infection susceptibility

finding: The low-frequency missense variant rs204781 within the IMPA1 gene was linked to a decreased risk state across 48 diseases, notably iron deficiency anemia (beta=-0.16, p<7.2×10^-16). This connection underscored the importance of the gene product for myo-inositol production, suggesting a role in iron homeostasis and broader health implications.
title: A predictive atlas of disease onset from retinal fundus photographs

finding: The GGH locus (lead SNP rs117494536) showed a novel association with vitamin E.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP11B2-LOC100133669 locus (lead SNP rs143728108) was newly linked to 11-Deoxycortisol levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The GGH locus (lead SNP rs72658350) underscored complex interrelations among metabolites.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs505460 was related to the calcium-binding gene neurocalcin delta (NCALD), where only one exon out of 13 showed significant differential expression in a variant-dependent manner (FDR = 4×10^-45). This finding illustrated the importance of examining gene expression at the exon level.
title: Variant-risk-exon interplay impacts circadian rhythm and dopamine signaling pathway in severe psychiatric disorders

finding: Detected as significantly associated with negative urgency, located in the XKR6 gene, which has implications in multiple traits including body mass index and neuroticism.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: Detected as significantly associated with negative urgency, located near SGK223 and CLDN23, with similar pleiotropic traits as rs4840542.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans, with further support from studies of Cadm2 mutant mice

finding: The SNP rs73229090 was identified as the strongest locus on chromosome 8 and was located in an intron of the non-coding gene GULOP. It replicated previous associations with schizophrenia (Scz), cannabis use disorder (CanUD), and ever-regular tobacco smoking (Smk). This SNP also served as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for multiple genes in various tissues.
title: Cross-ancestry genetic investigation of schizophrenia, cannabis use disorder, and tobacco smoking

finding: An intronic variant in HAS2, this SNP was linked to ascending aortic distensibility, demonstrating its potential relevance in extracellular matrix production.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The SNP rs75772194 was recognized as a positive outlier in the context of non-dense area (NDA) measurements, and it was also noted for its association with breast size, indicating its potential role in mammographic density phenotypes.
title: The mediating role of mammographic density in the protective effect of early-life adiposity on breast cancer risk: a multivariable Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs2678333 was identified as a GR-meQTL located on chromosome 12 with a post-dexamethasone-specific effect, showing a false discovery rate (FDR) of 8.24x10^-15. This finding indicated a significant association between this SNP and DNA methylation levels in response to glucocorticoid activation.
title: Multi-omics analysis of the molecular response to glucocorticoids - insights into shared genetic risk from psychiatric to medical disorders

finding: The SNP rs72725854 in the 8q24.21 region was associated with a decreased risk of multiple cancers (OR=0.28, P=4.7x10^-8), consistent in invasive cancer analyses (OR=0.26, P=1.3x10^-7).
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: The SNP rs283732 revealed a significant association with a decreased risk of multiple invasive cancers (OR=0.90, P=1.1x10^-8).
title: Unraveling the genetic landscape of susceptibility to multiple primary cancers

finding: It was associated as a cis-SNP for NTAQ1 with an effect size of -0.62 (p=1.7x10^-11) and was shown to influence testosterone levels with a MR effect size of 0.026.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: rs79670367, found at 8q24.22 in LINC01591, was identified as significantly associated with V. This locus did not have prior associations with MD or breast cancer risk, indicating a unique genetic link to mammographic texture.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: At 8p21.2, rs13256025 exhibited a significant association with V and was previously reported to be linked to breast cancer risk, providing evidence of a shared genetic basis between these traits.
title: A genome-wide association study of mammographic texture variation

finding: SNP rs34173062 associated with SHARPIN was identified in stage 2 with a p-value of 1.56×10^-9, indicating its role in the genetic landscape of Alzheimer’s disease risk.
The SNP rs7341557 in EPHX2 demonstrated significant association with a p-value of 5.33×10^-11 in stage 3, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors.
The minor allele of rs678347 in the GRHL2 gene was linked to an increased risk of developing rheumatoid arthritis.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: The SNP rs752993, nearest to the gene CHRNA2, was associated with COPD, and this association was previously reported using diagnosis codes rather than spirometry, emphasizing its relevance in the COPD context.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: Associated with the gene FZD3, rs117746305 contributed to the solidification of the role of Wnt/β-catenin signaling pathways in COPD.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs10092045, linked to SFRP1, further implicated Wnt/β-catenin pathways in COPD, enhancing the understanding of this signaling's role in disease mechanisms.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: The SNP rs10503253 was identified as a genome-wide associated schizophrenia risk variant affecting the CSMD1 gene, which was implicated in developmental processes critical for nervous system function. This SNP showed involvement in the mechanisms underlying intellectual disability (ID) due to its association with enhancer activity in fetal brain-specific regions.
title: Regulatory de novo mutations underlying intellectual disability

finding: This SNP was connected to various cancers as well as reproductive health issues, indicating potential significance to FGT polyp pathology.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study to determine the genetic underpinnings of female genital tract polyps

finding: This intergenic variant had a genome-wide significant association with otosclerosis and had prior links to skeletal ossification, showcasing its relevance in bone remodeling mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: The SNP rs62523863 was implicated in a potentially positive association with PhenoAgeAccel, with a reported effect of 0.038 years for each 1-mmHg increase in genetically predicted higher systolic blood pressure (SBP). This finding related to the context of epigenetic aging and further highlighted the role of blood pressure in the aging process.
title: Causal associations of education, lifestyle behaviors, and cardiometabolic traits with epigenetic age acceleration: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The DLC1 SNP, rs139904273, showed a strong association with squamous cell carcinoma risk specifically in African-Americans.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Associated with lung cancer and specifically squamous cell carcinoma, this SNP in VPS13B showed significant genetic signals in African-ancestry populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This intergenic variant near CSMD3 presented significant genetic association signals in European-ancestry populations.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: A strong protective effect associated with lung cancer was identified linked to EPHX2.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs6995270 was part of a previously unreported association near the ST3GAL1 gene, which is implicated in the synthesis of sialic acids related to various glycans. This finding underscored the role of ST3GAL1-mediated sialylation in cancer, linking it to immune evasion and suggesting potential therapeutic targets.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: Similar to rs6995270, rs17721179 was also found near ST3GAL1 and related to the synthesis of sialic acids. Its finding was part of the network linking several genetic variants to an increased understanding of glycans in associated pathologies.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The SNP rs2945738 was associated with ST3GAL1 and highlighted the gene's role in sialic acid and glycan metabolism, crucial for understanding its link to complex diseases including cancer.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: rs13264936 was identified near ST3GAL1 and was integral to the previously unreported associations with sialic acid and multiple glycans, suggesting its significance in cancer biology regarding immune evasion.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The variant rs10504255 was associated with COVID-19+ diarrhea with an odds ratio of 0.94 (95% CI [0.92, 0.95]), and was implicated in high cholesterol and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS-D) among other phenotypes. It played a significant role in bile acid synthesis, potentially linking it to gastrointestinal symptoms during SARS-CoV2 infection.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP rs72725854 was associated with prostate cancer and was enriched in African populations. It had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.06 in AFR, 0.0068 in AMR, and 0.0006 in EUR. The SNP was previously reported to increase prostate cancer risk two-fold.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs505460 was associated with the calcium-binding gene neurocalcin delta (NCALD), where only one exon out of 13 (ENSE00001231633) was differentially expressed in a variant-dependent manner. This finding highlighted the importance of examining gene expression at a single-exon resolution for understanding cortical dysregulation related to psychiatric disorders.
title: Variant-risk-exon interplay impacts on cortical cell-cell interactions in severe psychiatric disorders
