finding: The SNP rs67172995 was also classified as a significant lead SNV through GWAS methodologies and was consistently prioritized as an epistatic interactor variant alongside rs3045696, contributing to the analysis of cardiac hypertrophy.
title: Epistasis regulates genetic control of cardiac hypertrophy

finding: The SNP rs2741339 was identified as a risk variant for TUD with a p-value of 5.21E-17, associated with the CHRNA2 gene, stressing its importance in smoking behavior.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs13258747 acted as a cis-pQTL for NTAQ1 and was linked to testosterone levels, indicating a specific role in hormonal regulation.
title: Efficient candidate drug target discovery through proteogenomics in a Scottish cohort

finding: The SNP rs1961102 was found to be associated with QTc duration, suggesting its role in genetic predispositions that affect QT prolongation and, by extension, potential cardiovascular risk.
title: Genetic QT Score and Sleep Apnea as Predictors of Sudden Cardiac Death in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs34173062 in the SHARPIN gene was identified as a known risk locus for late-onset AD. This missense variant influenced postsynaptic function and exhibited a genetic modifying effect on atrophy within the medial temporal circuit.
title: Identification of novel associations of candidate loci with Alzheimer’s disease by leveraging the shared genetic basis with hippocampal volume

finding: This SNP was identified as a shared signal across various FA traits and is situated in the TRIB1 gene, indicating its significance in lipid metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The variant rs72711165 is associated with COVID-19 disease severity at the 8:124836564-125836564 locus, displaying ethnicity-specific significance, being genome-wide significant only in East Asian populations.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The BIN3 rs2280104 T allele was linked to excessive daytime sleepiness and altered network topology in Parkinson's disease. This finding highlighted the potential impact of this SNP on both sleep patterns and brain network configuration in affected individuals.
title: High-level anxiety is associated with worse clinical symptoms and aberrant brain networks in Parkinson’s disease

finding: Associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), indicating that it may play a role in less rapid PD symptom progression.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: The deletion mismatch tagged by rs11985201 was associated with an increased risk of acute rejection (AR) in liver transplant (LT) recipients, with a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.483 (95% confidence interval [CI]: 1.066–2.062, P-value 0.019). Additionally, this variant was linked to decreased expression levels of the indoleamine 2,3-dioxygenase 1 (IDO1) gene in blood cells.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: A strong linkage disequilibrium was observed between rs1801280 and rs1799931 in the NAT2 gene, with a D' value of 0.82 identified, indicating a significant association in terms of risk phenotypes related to anti-tuberculosis drug-induced liver injury (AT-DILI).
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: This SNP showed high linkage disequilibrium with rs1801280, contributing to the characterization of the NAT2 gene related to acetylator phenotypes, particularly among TB patients, which further correlated with the risk of AT-DILI.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: Although this SNP did not show a specific block in linkage with others, it was part of a broader investigation of the NAT2 gene's polymorphisms, which are significant for understanding acetylator status in relation to AT-DILI risk in the studied population.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: Similar to rs3045696, the SNV rs67172995 was highlighted for its significance in GWAS for LVMi and prioritized as an epistatic interactor variant alongside rs3045696 via lo-siRF analysis.
title: Epistasis regulates genetic control of cardiac hypertrophy

finding: The SNP rs117296832 showed a nearly genome-wide significant association (P=1.1×10−7) with Alzheimer's Disease (AD) specifically among APOE ε2 carriers. This association was critical in understanding the genetic underpinnings of the ε2 allele's protective effect against AD.
title: Protein phosphatase 2A, complement component 4, and APOE genotype linked to Alzheimer’s disease using a systems biology approach

finding: SNP rs16928927 displayed significant associations with CELF-R (p=9.7×10⁻⁵) and WIAT-RC (p=4×10⁻⁴), indicating its relevance in language and reading development.
title: Association between genes regulating neural pathways for quantitative traits of speech and language disorders

finding: This SNP was a part of the verified super-variant chr8_99, indicating associations with genetic variants pertinent to the risk of COVID-19 mortality.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: Identified as a high-risk variant through LSS, rs2943549 showed the strongest association with urate-related phenotypes, indicating its functional role in regulating urate levels within specific kidney cell types.
title: Locus-specific stratification and prioritization unveil high risk genes underlying hyperuricemia

finding: The SNP rs7840270 was located just 0.3 kb upstream of the ADAM9 gene and showed higher expression associated with the critical COVID-19 patient population. The higher expressing allele C was significantly more frequent in critical patients compared to noncritical patients (71.3% vs. 50%, OR=2.48, P=0.017). This finding indicated a potential role of rs7840270 in the upregulation of ADAM9, supporting its classification as a key driver gene in the pathology of severe COVID-19 among otherwise healthy individuals.
title: Identification of driver genes for severe forms of COVID-19 in a deeply phenotyped young patient cohort

finding: This variant was significantly linked to impulsivity and pleiotropic traits including BMI, depression, and alcohol consumption.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: This variant was found to be significantly associated near SGK223 and CLDN23, with previous links to BMI and other traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: Amongst TMZ-treated IDH-mutant 1p/19q-codeleted gliomas, rs7840433-A near NEIL2 was associated with significantly decreased survival time, showing a median reduction of 81 months. The variant had no significant impact on survival for cases without TMZ treatment.
title: Functional germline variants in DNA damage repair pathways are associated with altered survival in adults with glioma treated with temozolomide

finding: Suggestive association was seen with this SNP at 8p11.21 (p=6.46×10^-7, OR=3.44) and was noted for its proximity to KAT6A.
title: Genome-wide association studies of Down syndrome associated congenital heart defects

finding: The lead SNP rs4737010 was located in the first intron of the ANK1 gene and demonstrated a significant association with spleen iron (beta=-0.077, p=1.0e-17). The study suggested regulation of ANK1 expression that may impact erythrocyte morphology and iron metabolism.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The SNP rs11136000 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in a study that analyzed a large cohort, comprising 74,248 samples, with confirmed findings in the Caucasian population but not in the Chinese population. This highlighted the potential genetic risk factors for AD linked to this polymorphism.
title: Multi-transcriptomic analysis points to early organelle dysfunction in human astrocytes in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs34866937 was linked to left ventricular end-systolic volume (LVESV) and identified as a shared index variant in both the UK Biobank and Biobank Japan studies, showcasing its connection to cardiovascular traits.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: The SNP rs10093774 was pointed out in brain eQTL models, connecting it with cognitive function and cardiovascular relationships.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with chest pain following COVID-19 mRNA vaccination, suggesting it may influence susceptibility to this adverse event.
title: Identification of susceptibility loci for adverse events following COVID-19 vaccination in the Japanese population: A web-based genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs60528951 was identified as part of a novel locus linked to complete blood count (CBC) setpoints, contributing to the understanding of genetic determinants influencing hematologic regulation.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The SNP rs2047265 was found to be associated with a novel locus in the context of CBC setpoints, reflecting its role in patient-specific hematologic phenotypes.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The SNP rs6997857 was identified as part of a novel locus associated with stable and patient-specific blood count setpoints in healthy adults.
title: Hematologic setpoints are a stable and patient-specific deep phenotype

finding: The rs73293634 SNP, located at 8q13.3, was found to have a genome-wide significant association with impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME) with a p-value of 7.5 × 10^-9. This SNP explained 10.1% of the phenotypic variation and colocalized with expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) for the SLCO5A1 gene in the cerebral cortex, resulting in hypothesis regarding its influence on synaptic assembly.
title: SLCO5A1 and synaptic assembly genes contribute to impulsivity in juvenile myoclonic epilepsy

finding: This SNP was classified as a LOE-specific risk factor, mapped to the PTK2B gene, thus contributing uniquely to the genetic understanding of late-onset epilepsy.
title: Multi-class Modeling Identifies Shared Genetic Risk for Late-onset Epilepsy and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2553268 was found to be proximal to the gene WRN, which is associated with Werner Syndrome. This association related to phenotypes such as short stature and abnormal fat distribution, contributing to the leading factor for BMI characterized by body weight and body fat.
title: A scalable variational approach to characterize pleiotropic components across thousands of human diseases and complex traits using GWAS summary statistics

finding: This variant was linked to prostate cancer and located in the well-known 8q24 gene desert.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant was associated with prostate cancer and was also found in the 8q24 locus.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: This variant also in SLC25A37 was identified amongst the risk variants associated with PAU, expanding the genetic landscape of alcohol-related behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs10503253 at the CSMD1 gene was associated with schizophrenia in an Asian population, as reported in a study by Liu et al. (2017). This finding is relevant in the context of the current research, which indicated that methylation of the CSMD1 gene might be involved in the neurodevelopmental outcomes related to maternal PCB exposure, suggesting a potential link between the genetic locus and neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Networks of placental DNA methylation correlate with maternal serum PCB concentrations and child neurodevelopment

finding: The rs10282765 SNP was also noted for maternal inheritance in relation to preeclampsia, indicating another genetic factor that may influence this condition.
title: Clotting factor genes are associated with preeclampsia in high altitude pregnant women in the Peruvian Andes

finding: The variant rs35006907 was associated with left ventricular function traits, including increased ejection fraction and decreased end-systolic and end-diastolic volumes. It overlapped an enhancer predicted to regulate MTSS1, with predictions that it reduced chromatin accessibility in cardiac myocyte populations.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The variant rs34866937 was analyzed along with rs35006907 due to their strong linkage, both being associated with cardiac function traits related to left ventricular dynamics.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The variant rs12541595 was analyzed for its association with left ventricular function traits in linkage with rs35006907, contributing to understanding the genetic basis of cardiac function.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The SNP rs11778664 located at 8:17893510 was highlighted as the lead variant associated with FGL1 in the pQTL analysis, supporting its potential role in the development of type 2 diabetes.
title: Circulating proteomic profiles are associated with the onset of type 2 diabetes in a multi-ethnic Asian population – a longitudinal study

finding: This SNP mapped to the ribosomal protein L10a pseudogene 3 locus (RPL10AP3), revealing shared genetic connections between BDI and BDII, and exhibited a significant p-value of 7.54×10^-3 in the pleioFDR analysis.
title: Patterns of convergence and divergence between bipolar disorder type I and type II: evidence from integrative genomic analyses

finding: The genetic variant rs804279 located in GATA4/NEIL2 showed a significant association with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 (95% CI: 1.10-1.18) and a P-value of 3.76x10^−12. This association was also linked to polycystic ovarian morphology and ovulatory dysfunction.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified potential genes pleiotropically associated with polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The genetic variant rs8191514 in NEIL2 was predicted to generate a binding site for twenty transcription factors and was in linkage disequilibrium with the PCOS-identified variant rs804279, exhibiting R^2 of 0.4. This variant was significant in the context of its potential role in the pathogenesis of PCOS.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified potential genes pleiotropically associated with polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: The SNP rs2279590 served as a proxy for rs9331896 in the analysis of genetic liability to Alzheimer's disease (AD) and was part of the genetic risk score that included 'APOE4'. It positively influenced cholesterol-related traits, aligning with findings involving AD risk.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: SNP rs77668120 was replicated with significance (p=6.3E-05) and was part of the previously reported risk variants for tuberculosis.
title: Large Registry Based Analysis of Genetic Predisposition to Tuberculosis Identifies Genetic Risk Factors at HLA

finding: The SNP rs6998061, a missense variant in the POU5F1B gene, was associated with prostate and colorectal cancers. It was predicted as a possibly damaging single nucleotide variant (SNV) and linked to tumorigenicity and angiogenesis.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: rs112585366 was identified as another independent locus in the PA-FGRS analysis, showing a beta of 0.026 and a p-value of 4.4 × 10^-8, highlighting its relevance to genetic susceptibility to MDD. The variant's association was confirmed in the independent study by Howard et al.
title: PA-FGRS is a novel estimator of pedigree-based genetic liability that complements genotype-based inferences into the genetic architecture of major depressive disorder

finding: The rs7814941 SNP, associated with the GSDMC gene, was linked to the accumulation of diagnoses for lumbar disc herniation before the age of 30, indicating its potential role as a risk factor for early onset of LDH.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis conducted in three large biobanks expands the genetic landscape of lumbar disc herniations

finding: The SNP rs10099100 was found to have significant associations in the GenomicSEM ASD GWAS, achieving genome-wide significance. This marker was also identified in univariate ASD GWAS, indicating its relevance to Autism Spectrum Disorder.
title: Enhancing the Discriminatory Power of ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Polygenic Scores in Clinical and Non-Clinical Samples

finding: The SNP rs7830752 reached significance in the Neurodevelopmental GenomicSEM GWAS and is in proximity to the CSMD1 gene, which has been linked to neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Enhancing the Discriminatory Power of ADHD and Autism Spectrum Disorder Polygenic Scores in Clinical and Non-Clinical Samples

finding: The SNP rs1160267, located in NKX3-1, was significantly associated with PSA levels, signalling its potential relevance in prostate cancer diagnostics.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rs2279590 variant was found to have a significant effect on delirium, with an odds ratio of 0.992 [0.989 – 0.995] and a p-value of 4.2×10^-8 in the context of multi-trait analysis.
title: Dissecting the genetic and proteomic risk factors for delirium

finding: Colocalization with this SNP was present in the deCODE pQTL dataset, where it linked to various T2D index variants related to phosphatidylcholine metabolism.
title: Multi-omics characterization of type 2 diabetes associated genetic variation

finding: The study by Liu et al. (2020) revealed that the TRIB1 rs17321515 Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP) interacted with coffee drinking to influence the risk of Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) in a Taiwanese population. This finding highlighted the significance of genetic factors in lifestyle interactions, particularly how common dietary habits such as coffee consumption could modify genetic risk associated with coronary heart disease.
title: Core outcome set for clinical trials of stent implantation in coronary heart disease -- a systematic review and mixed-method consensus study

finding: The SNP rs2042528 was involved in the interaction analysis for dementia outcomes, contributing to distinct interaction patterns with fish oil supplementation beyond the effects of APOE ε4.
title: Gene-diet interaction analysis in UK Biobank identified genetic loci that modify the association between fish oil supplementation and the incidence of dementia

finding: The SNP rs6992534, linked to the gene ERI1, was also found to be a novel variant associated with sVEGFR2 levels. The study highlighted that increased sVEGFR2 levels, as indicated by this SNP, corresponded to a reduced risk of MP, with an OR of 0.86.
title: Genetic Evidence for Soluble VEGFR2 as a Protective Factor Against Macular Pucker

finding: The SNP rs10504255 was associated with COVID-19 related diarrhea with an odds ratio of 0.94 indicating a decreased relative risk. This finding was significant (p=2.6x10-16) and primarily driven by individuals of European ancestry, and it was also linked to high cholesterol and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) symptom subtypes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The SNP rs1106634, located within the gene ATP6V1B2, exhibited a suggestive p-value of 3.97×10^-6 in a meta-analysis related to schizophrenia and bipolar disorder. Additionally, this SNP was significantly associated with lifetime risk of depression (p<0.001) in a recent study. These findings indicated a potential link between this SNP and mental health conditions, particularly in understanding the effects of antidepressants.
title: Methylome-wide association study of antidepressant use in Generation Scotland and the Netherlands Twin Register implicates the innate immune system

finding: The SNP rs6599528 was significantly associated with the RSTR phenotype, indicating that each copy of the minor allele increased the odds of clinical resistance to Mtb conversion by 1.63 times (p = 0.04).
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: Detected as one of only two SNPs from 98 known CRC risk loci that was recognized in the DEPTH datasets, demonstrating its relevance in the context of prior GWAS findings.
title: Using DEPendency of association on the number of Top Hits (DEPTH) as a complementary tool to identify novel risk loci in colorectal cancer

finding: Found to have associations related to AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Similar to rs3824662, rs75777619 was directly associated with ALL susceptibility, exhibiting significant allelic effects in at least three ALL cell lines, reinforcing its contribution to patient outcomes in this disease.
title: Functional investigation of inherited noncoding genetic variation impacting the pharmacogenomics of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatment

finding: Included in the SNPs associated with the AFR population exclusively, this variant had a significant association (p=2.6×10^-9).
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: It emerged as a novel lead SNP within the AFR cohort with associations to cardiovascular traits.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The proxy SNP rs2279590, linked with the CLU gene and used in genetic risk scores for Alzheimer's disease, was included when analyzing the genetic association with lipid-related traits and AD liability. This finding was part of the context that emphasized the influence of genetic factors on lipid profiles relevant to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Effects of genetic liability to Alzheimer’s disease on circulating metabolites across the life course

finding: The rs117157809 variant in the Tankyrase (TNKS) gene was significantly associated with RT-induced oral mucositis in nasopharyngeal cancer (NPC) patients, highlighting the importance of telomere maintenance and capping in the response to RT.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs34173062 near SHARPIN demonstrated significant association across diverse ancestry groups, reaching P=1.81×10^-9 and reflecting a notable increase in statistical power given its discovery in a much smaller sample size compared to previous findings.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis of 56,241 individuals identifies LRRC4C, LHX5-AS1 and nominates ancestry-specific loci PTPRK, GRB14, and KIAA0825 as novel risk loci for Alzheimer’s disease: the Alzheimer’s Disease Genetics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs10957712 at the GDAP1 locus (8q21.11) demonstrated significance at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 4.19x10^-7 in the context of endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: This SNP is a missense mutation within the DOK2 gene, previously unreported in relation to AD and suggesting immune pathway involvement.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The SNP rs10956488 was precision-mapped at locus 8q24.21 with a high certainty of 96.2%, and linked to eQTL for the gene GSDMC, expressed in enlarged hemorrhoidal tissue. The exact role of GSDMC in HEM remains to be clarified.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: The SNP rs115849089 showed a positive association with IHD, with an OR<sub>IVW</sub> of 1.004, 95% CI of 1.001 to 1.007, and p=0.005, confirming its potential genetic contribution to IHD risk.
title: Causality of Genetically Determined Monounsaturated Fatty Acids on Risk of Cardiovascular Disease: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The SNP rs6990375 was significantly associated with fetal failure in IVF techniques, indicating its potential impact on reproductive health and outcomes.
title: Variability in proteoglycan biosynthetic genes reveals new facets of heparan sulfates diversity. A systematic review and analysis

finding: The SNP rs2978977 was identified as a genome-wide significant clumped variant associated with gastric cancer in this study. Similar to the other SNPs, it had been previously associated with gastric cancer in Chinese and Japanese populations, but it was noted that there were no prior significant associations with this SNP in Korean samples.
title: Incorporating family disease history and controlling case-control imbalance for population based genetic association studies

finding: Located in the CTSB gene, this SNP was identified in the largest PD GWAS. It was associated with the methylation probe cg14458991 nearby, which correlated with striatal DAT binding, indicating its relevance in dopaminergic function.
title: Epigenetic and cognitive signatures of striatal DAT binding among healthy elderly individuals

finding: The SNP rs13281615, located in the PCAT1 gene, showed a strong association with breast cancer in both AI-based and combined approaches. Although it was not identified in the conventional case-control analysis, it was previously reported in other breast cancer studies, highlighting its significance in cancer research.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs15285, linked to LPL, was identified as associated with hypercholesterolemia using the CC-liability method. It was also significant in multiple GWAS studies, reinforcing its importance in cholesterol levels.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs13266634, a missense variant in the SLC30A8 gene, showed significant association with GDM, with an odds ratio of 1.29 and a p-value of 1.83×10^-10. This suggests the importance of SLC30A8 in the genetic landscape of GDM.
title: Genome-wide association and Mendelian randomisation analysis among 30,699 Chinese pregnant women identifies novel genetic and molecular risk factors for gestational diabetes and glycaemic traits

finding: This SNP, mapped to the ASPH gene, interacted with long total sleep time (LTST) in its association with triglycerides (TG), showing a significant P-int value of 2.78e-13, marking it as a novel finding in lipid studies.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: Mapped to RUNX1, this SNP was found to interact with TG levels in STST, supporting its relevance in lipid research linked to sleep duration.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The SNP rs79574881 was discovered in the meta-analysis of TWBB and BBJ as a novel locus linked to smoking initiation. It is located at 8p22 within the DLC1 gene, which encodes a tumor suppressor protein. The association was strong with a beta value of -0.02 (SE = 0.004) and genome-wide significance (P = 2.84 × 10^-8). This suggests it plays a role in the likelihood of starting smoking.
title: Evaluation of the Causal Relationship Between Smoking and Schizophrenia in Asia

finding: The SNP rs1801279, also known as 191G>A, was part of a study that demonstrated its significant role in explaining pharmacokinetic variability of isoniazid in tuberculosis treatment. This SNP contributed to the classification of individuals as slow, intermediate, or rapid acetylators of isoniazid.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The SNP rs1041983, designated 282C>T, was included in the analysis, which showed that it was one of the five SNPs used to accurately predict acetylation ratios and drug clearance levels in patients with tuberculosis, impacting the effectiveness of isoniazid dosing.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The SNP rs1801280, referred to as 341T>C, was identified as a key mutation affecting NAT2 activity. Its presence in the genotype classification model contributed to the complete accuracy achieved in predicting individual responses to isoniazid treatment.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: SNP rs1799929, also known as 481C>T, was among the SNPs analyzed that accounted for pharmacokinetic variability, helping to differentiate patients' acetylation profiles, which is crucial for optimizing isoniazid therapy in tuberculosis.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The SNP rs1799930, noted as 590G>A, played a significant role in the pharmacogenomic prediction model developed from extensive genomic data, enhancing accurate dosing strategies for isoniazid in diverse populations.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: RS1208, or 803A>G, was one of the SNPs that showed importance in distinguishing between acetylator phenotypes in the study, thus influencing treatment outcomes for tuberculosis patients undergoing isoniazid therapy.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The SNP rs1799931, labeled 857G>A, was analyzed in conjunction with other SNPs to improve understanding of NAT2 functionality, aiding in the classification of acetylator types and ensuring better isoniazid dosing in clinical settings.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The SNP rs2950922 in the UNC5D region on chromosome 8 showed strong associations with rare functional variants in the EBV BALF5 gene. This SNP was identified as an eQTL for UNC5D in esophageal tissue, indicating its role in regulating gene expression relevant to the immune response against EBV.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The rs139944315 variant was found to be associated with tumor mutational burden (TMB) in glioma, indicating its regulatory impact on the WRN gene.
title: Germline cancer gene expression quantitative trait loci influence local and global tumor mutations

finding: rs75547282 was identified as a risk variant for Autism Spectrum Disorder through comprehensive analyses. The study highlighted its importance in evaluating genetic risk factors related to autism.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: SNP rs6469450, an intronic variant in CSMD3, was recognized for its association with substance use traits through this analysis.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs10104815 was nominally significant associated with SNRI non-response. This locus was previously reported in the GWAS, linked to the gene KHDRBS3, indicating its repetitive emergence in non-response to antidepressant treatment.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The rs9642880 SNP was significantly associated with bladder cancer risk, highlighted among the most influential SNPs connecting to the disease within several major studies.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs2294008 SNP, a missense mutation in the PSCA gene, consistently correlated with bladder cancer risk in populations across the US and Europe.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs55705857 (A>G) was established as the causal variant associated with a 6-fold increased risk of IDH-mutant low-grade glioma (LGG). It resided within a brain-specific enhancer that disrupted OCT2/4 binding, subsequently increasing MYC expression.
title: A non-coding single nucleotide polymorphism at 8q24 drives IDH1-mutant glioma formation

finding: The rs35006907-C allele was associated with a higher risk of dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) and increased MTSS1 expression in European and Han Chinese populations, indicating a genomic mechanism linking MTSS1 to cardiac phenotypes. This finding corresponded with earlier discoveries showing that individuals with TTN P/LP variants carrying the T allele of rs12541595 and this variant exhibited significantly improved event-free survival from cardiovascular death or heart transplant (HR 0.29, p=0.0016).
title: Reduced Expression of MTSS1 Increases Sarcomere Number and Improves Contractility in Select Forms of Monogenic DCM

finding: The T allele of rs12541595 was strongly associated with lower left ventricular expression of MTSS1. This allele conferred significantly improved event-free survival from cardiovascular death or heart transplant among individuals with TTN P/LP variants who developed DCM (HR 0.29, p=0.0016), highlighting its protective effect against contractile dysfunction associated with TTN DCM.
title: Reduced Expression of MTSS1 Increases Sarcomere Number and Improves Contractility in Select Forms of Monogenic DCM

finding: The SNP rs11780471 was identified in a variant-CpG pair with nominal evidence for interaction with smoking phenotypes. The major allele (A) was associated with increased risk for smoking initiation, lower age at initiation, and decreased methylation level in CHRNA2, reflecting its influence on smoking-related traits.
title: Smoking-informed methylation and expression QTLs in human brain and colocalization with smoking-associated genetic loci

finding: Significant association was established (p=1.60E-09) within the XKR6 gene, which had prior links to traits such as BMI and externalizing behavior.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: Near SGK223 and CLDN23, a significant result was reported (p=5.00E-09), relevant to various traits.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: This SNP showed significant association with Subtype I, reinforcing its role in the mild progression of symptoms.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The rs16906115 SNP, located near the IL7 gene, was significantly associated with the all-grade incidence of immune related adverse events (irAEs) in a large GWAS conducted among 1,751 patients on immune checkpoint inhibitors. It had a combined p-value of 1.6×10^-11 and a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.1, indicating that carriers of this variant had more than twice the risk of developing irAEs compared to non-carriers. Replication studies confirmed this finding, with an HR of 3.6 in a cohort of patients who required hospitalization for severe irAEs.
title: Germline variants associated with immunotherapy-related adverse events

finding: The SNP rs7816685 was implicated as the likely causal variant due to its strong association with IL7 exon junction usage and was closely related to the effects observed with rs16906115. It was positioned in the splice region of a novel cryptic exon of IL7, which was activated in carriers of the risk allele, providing biological context to the observed immune response.
title: Germline variants associated with immunotherapy-related adverse events

finding: The rs1037699 variant was identified in the RRM2B locus and was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with a missense variant of RRM2B. Conditioning on this variant canceled the association of the lead variant, indicating its significant association with somatic hypermutation (SHM) processes.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: In the RRM2B locus, rs892503 demonstrated an associated condition in the context of SHM. Although it was not in LD with any missense variant, residual association showed significant co-localization with expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effects for the long non-coding RNA AP002852.2, which is primarily expressed in memory B cells and plasmablasts.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: Variants including rs2305453 were plotted in the regional association analysis of the NUGGC locus, demonstrating substantial genome-wide significance with SHM patterns in B cell subsets.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: Similar to rs2305453, rs13279787 was part of the genetic analysis performed in the NUGGC locus which showed significant associations with specific SHM patterns, suggesting its role in B cell biology.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: In a regional association plot of the NUGGC locus, rs4732620 was identified alongside other significant variants contributing to the variance seen in somatic hypermutation patterns.
title: Multimodal repertoire analysis unveils B cell biology in health and immune-mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs4737010[A] at the <italic>ANK1</italic> locus was associated with reduced spleen volume and decreased mRNA expression, indicating potential roles in erythropoiesis and iron homeostasis.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron recycling and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The intergenic variant rs35859536 was identified near the SLC30A8 locus, showing strong associations with both fasting glucose (FG) and type 2 diabetes (T2D). It was located in an active enhancer region relevant to islet function.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: Located within the SLC30A8 locus, rs11558471 was previously recognized as associated with fasting glucose (FG) and type 2 diabetes (T2D), being in close linkage with rs35859536.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: At the SLC30A8 locus, rs3802177 was indicated as a lead variant associated with fasting glucose (FG) and was in strong linkage with rs35859536, which demonstrated a significant role in glycemic traits.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The rare intergenic variant rs542965166 was associated with fasting insulin (FI) and observed in the Asian population. This indicates its potential race/ethnicity-specific effects.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The rs189796944 variant, found in the DPYSL2 gene, reached genome-wide significance through its interaction with TRS, showing a beta coefficient greater than 0.060 (p<9.04x10^-9) and even more significant with physical survival TSLEs (beta > 0.127, p<4x10^-8). This variant's involvement relates to its role in neuronal growth and development, linking it to PTSD risk.
title: Disentangling the roles of trauma and genetics in psychiatric disorders using an Electronic Health Records-based approach

finding: This variant was located in the PINX1 gene, which is associated with 8p23.1 duplication syndrome linked to developmental delay, and was part of the findings for sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs2920991 replicated the findings at Bonferroni-corrected significance, implicating the PRAG1 gene, which encodes an enzyme in the tyrosine kinase family and was linked to sporadic miscarriage.
title: Trans-ancestral Genome Wide Association Study of Sporadic and Recurrent Miscarriage

finding: The index variant rs144958026 was identified as an intronic variant of the LPL gene, which encodes lipoprotein lipase. It was located in the significant risk locus at region 8p21.3, with a very high association (P = 5.51×10^-65) to heart failure, highlighting its role in the genetic architecture of the disease.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The SNP rs2950922 was associated with very rare functional variants in the EBV BALF5 gene, which is implicated in viral DNA replication during the lytic infection phase. This SNP had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.31, a confidence interval (CI) of 1.21-1.41, and a p-value of 4.2×10^-12, indicating a strong association. Moreover, it was identified as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the UNC5D gene in esophageal tissue.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The deletion mismatch tagged by rs11985201 was associated with acute rejection (AR) time with a hazard ratio (HR) of 1.483 (95% CI: 1.066–2.062, P = 0.019). Additionally, rs11985201 showed a downregulation of the expression of IDO1, an important immunomodulatory enzyme, and reduced the binding of INSM1 and NF-Y_known2 transcription factors.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: Identified as common in specific African populations and had significant implications with respect to disease associations.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: Showed significant association particularly with severe health conditions among specific populations.
title: Global patterns of genetic variation and association with clinical phenotypes at genes involved in SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs7821592, associated with XPO7, was initially identified in a prior study for MaxAlc and fell just below GWS in this new GWAS analysis (p=1.21×10^-06), yet was significant in the MTAG analysis.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs6991078 was found to mediate 28.6% of the effect of cg25926804, located near the TMEM75 and GSDMC genes, on IFN-γ production. The GSDMC gene was previously associated with the defense response to bacterial infections, indicating the potential link between this genetic variant and enhanced immune responses post-BCG vaccination.
title: Epigenetic Reprogramming Mediates Monocyte and Heterologous T Cell-derived Cytokine Responses after BCG Vaccination

finding: The intronic single nucleotide variant rs1905014-T in the gene DLC1 was significantly associated with optic disc size. This finding related to the genetic analysis within the context of PHACE, suggesting that variations in DLC1 may influence eye abnormalities observed in the syndrome.
title: Analysis of Whole Genome Sequencing in a Cohort of Individuals with PHACE Syndrome Suggests Dysregulation of RAS/PI3K Signaling

finding: The SNP rs1801280 was associated with the NAT2 haplotypes, particularly between haplotypes *1 (absence of actionable variation) and *5 (presence of rs1801280-C). The presence of the rs1801280-C variant was linked to adverse events due to disrupted hydrophobic interactions, indicating its role in affecting simvastatin metabolism and adverse effects, thereby establishing its significance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Biobank scale pharmacogenomics informs the genetic underpinnings of simvastatin use

finding: The T allele of <italic>BIN3</italic> rs2280104 was found to be negatively associated with the Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) scores in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients, indicating that T-carriers exhibited lower ESS scores compared to CC carriers. Additionally, T-carriers had a significantly lower prevalence of Excessive Daytime Sleepiness (EDS) at 6.45% versus 20.75% in CC carriers. The findings suggested that <italic>BIN3</italic> rs2280104 was a key genetic variant influencing EDS in PD, impacting both clinical symptoms and brain network topology.
title: BIN3 rs2280104 T allele is associated with excessive daytime sleepiness and altered network topology in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs2976397 at the PSCA locus was found to influence the risk of gastric ulcer, gastric cancer, and gastric polyp. It had an odds ratio of 0.86 with a P-value of 6.1 × 10^-24, suggesting a protective effect against these gastric conditions.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7461129, associated with the gene MTSS1, showed a significant association with increased mRNA expression in left ventricular (LV) tissue, correlating with an increased risk of heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF). This finding supported the use of MTSS1 as a therapeutic target for HFrEF.
title: Large-scale Mendelian randomization identifies novel pathways as therapeutic targets for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction and with preserved ejection fraction

finding: The SNP rs1106634 was associated with lifetime risk of depression and hippocampal neurocognitive deficits according to findings reported by Gonda et al. This association provided insights into possible novel mechanisms in the etiopathology of depression, indicating the potential relevance of this SNP in the context of neurodegenerative diseases, such as sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) due to its connection with neurocognitive processes.
title: Identification of potential key genes and pathway linked with sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease based on integrated bioinformatics analyses

finding: The rare variant rs60103302, located near the SNTG1 gene, was associated with hip bone mineral density (BMD) with a P-value of 4.79 × 10⁻⁸. This finding was part of a genome-wide association study (GWAS) involving samples from the Westlake BioBank for Chinese, demonstrating that it could significantly influence BMD.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: Alongside rs60103302, this variant was identified among the 70 variants linked to the SNTG1 gene for Hip BMD, suggesting its role in the genetic architecture of BMD although specific metrics for its association were not disclosed.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: Similar to rs61260287 and rs60103302, this variant was categorized as being in complete linkage disequilibrium and implicated in the association with Hip BMD, marking it as a potential contributor to bone density variations.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: Identified as one of the rare variants in complete linkage disequilibrium affecting Hip BMD, this SNP was included in the suggestive variants but lacked detailed context on its individual association strength.
title: SEAD: an augmented reference panel with 22,134 haplotypes boosts the rare variants imputation and GWAS analysis in Asian population

finding: This SNP, located at 8q11.21 within the SNTG1 gene, was associated with elevated odds of type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2D) in both European (EUR) and African (AFR) survivors. Specifically, in the EUR cohort, the odds ratio was reported as 1.99 (95% CI: 1.56-2.55; P=4.4x10^-8) and replicated in CCSS EUR survivors with an odds ratio of 1.56 (95% CI: 1.12-2.17; P=8.1x10^-3), indicating a significant genetic risk factor for DM.
title: Trans-ancestral genetic study of diabetes mellitus risk in survivors of childhood cancer: a report from the St. Jude Lifetime Cohort and the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

finding: The SNP rs117296832 showed nearly genome-wide significance (P=1.1×10<sup>−7</sup>) for Alzheimer's disease (AD) association among APOE ε2 carriers, highlighting its potential role in the pathology related to this allele.
title: Protein phosphatase 2A, complement component 4, and APOE genotype linked to Alzheimer’s disease using a systems biology approach

finding: The SNP rs12679242 was identified within the intron of the gene CYP11B2 and was exclusively associated with the ICD-10 diagnosis of hypertension (I10) in the East Asian population. This variant exhibited a protective role with a risk odds ratio of 0.87, highlighting its significance in hypertension across different ethnic groups.
title: Recessive and sex-dependent genetic effects in primary hypertension

finding: An eQTL acting on ANGPT1 located in the brain colocalized with this secondary IOP signal, indicating increased expression reduces IOP levels.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP's eQTL was determined to be involved in the strongest IOP signal, with significant impact on the gene ANGPT1.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP's eQTL significantly correlated with secondary IOP signals, showcasing its influence on ANGPT1 expression levels.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP had significant eQTL associations, suggesting its impact on the vascular-related ANGPT1 signaling pathway.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The A-allele of rs11785337 was associated with a moderate increase in plasma OT levels (β = 0.29). This SNP is located in the DLGAP2 gene, which has been both implicated in ASD and shown to have a role in glutamatergic signaling.
title: Genetic and epigenetic signatures associated with plasma oxytocin levels in children and adolescents with autism spectrum disorder

finding: The intronic variant rs1964514 in PKHD1L1 showed a significant association with multiple subtypes of female infertility, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.13 for F-ALL, suggesting that individuals carrying this variant were at a higher risk for infertility.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs111597692, associated with idiopathic infertility, was linked to the TRHR gene with an odds ratio of 1.16 for F-EXCL, suggesting possible implications for fertility through its role in hormone signaling.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs779805849 located in ANK1 showed a replication finding for stroke (p-value=0.01) in T1D and was involved in the associations of variants with significant PAVs.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies rare variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and gene regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs146416859 was found to replicate for hemorrhagic stroke (p-value<0.05) in T1D and was one of two additional variants with significant association with T1D related hemorrhagic stroke.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies rare variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and gene regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs61753679 variant in ANK1 also replicated for hemorrhagic stroke (p-value<0.05), contributing additional evidence towards the involvement of ANK1 variants in stroke among T1D patients.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies rare variants in ANK1, LRRN1, HAS1, and other genes and gene regulatory regions for stroke in type 1 diabetes

finding: This SNP was identified as a top-5 IBI SNP and was also among the top GWAS SNPs, having significance in relation to hypertension (HTN). Its identification highlighted the robustness of the findings in both the IBI and GWAS analyses.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: Identified as the top-ranked SNP by IBI for 425 HTN patients, it was not recognized by GWAS, which ranked it much lower. This SNP's association with hypertension reflects the capability of IBI to uncover significant variants overlooked by traditional GWAS.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The lead variant rs72711165 displayed higher allele frequencies in East Asian populations and was implicated in severe COVID-19 infection risk.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs6990375 was significantly associated with fetal failure in IVF techniques, highlighting its potential impact on reproductive health.
title: Genetic variability in proteoglycan biosynthetic genes reveals new facets of heparan sulfates diversity. A systematic review and analysis

finding: In the ALSPAC cohort, the T allele of the intronic variant rs146099921 was associated with -0.12 log Hg (p = 8.21×10−6). This variant is located in the gene SLC39A14, a metal transporter linked to multiple metal uptakes, including cadmium and iron. It was also associated with reduced DNA methylation and exon expression in SLC39A14.
title: Genome-wide association study of blood mercury in European pregnant women and children

finding: The rare homozygous intronic variant rs11337717 (chr12:89643729, T>C) in the ATP2B1 locus was associated positively with the severity of COVID-19, distinguishing symptomatic from asymptomatic patients. The minor allele 'C' was significantly more frequent in severe COVID-19 cases (p=0.0004), indicating its role as a genetic risk factor for severe disease.
title: Targeting ATP2B1 impairs PI3K/Akt/Fox-O3 signaling and reduces SARS-COV-2 replication in vivo

finding: The rs1801279 SNP demonstrated strong association with acetylation phenotype and INH clearance in the prediction algorithm; cases classified as slow and intermediate acetylators showed significant variations in INH clearance rates.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The rs1041983 SNP was included in the developed 5-SNP model used for predicting INH acetylation, which accurately reflected the acetylator phenotype, correlating with INH clearance rates.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The rs1801280 SNP was part of the successful 5-SNP predictive model; predictions of acetylator types showed significant correspondence with INH clearance levels.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The rs1799929 SNP contributed to acetylator classification accuracy, demonstrating a clear relationship with the phenotype of INH metabolism and clearance.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The rs1208 SNP was identified as part of the influential 5-SNP model, aligning well with predicted acetylator status and associated INH pharmacokinetics.
title: A rapid pharmacogenomic assay to detect NAT2 polymorphisms and guide isoniazid dosing for tuberculosis treatment

finding: The rs2980218 SNP close to the HNF4G gene exhibited a significant p-value of 2.19×10⁻⁹ in association with AF, marking it as a novel finding that could relate to metabolic pathways in AF.
title: Identification of two new genetic loci associated with atrial fibrillation in the Taiwanese population-implication of metabolism and fibrosis in atrial fibrillation mechanism

finding: The SNP rs2954029 within the TRIB1 gene located at 8q24.13 was found to be significantly associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) and stroke. Individuals carrying the A allele at this SNP exhibited a higher risk of these conditions, supporting the complex genetic mechanisms linking MAFLD and cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genome-wide insights into the shared genetic landscape between metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs11780471, located in the 8p21.2 region associated with the CHRNA2 gene, showed higher frequencies and greater effect sizes in the white population, indicating a significant genetic risk factor for lung cancer in smokers.
title: Ethnic differences of genetic risk and smoking in lung cancer: two prospective cohort studies

finding: This SNP corresponds to the neuregulin 1 gene (NRG1) and was highlighted as a risk locus associated with Hirschsprung disease, thereby influencing the overall genetic risk profile for the condition.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: The missense variant rs771722367 in ADRA1A was associated with the volume of the left ventral diencephalon, with an effect of 683.56 mm³ and effect size of 1.28 s.d. units (P = 6.5 × 10^-11), relating it to schizophrenia and brain volume alterations.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The SNP rs4645543 was identified as having a strong association with circulating phylloquinone and was linked to lower stroke risk via Mendelian randomisation, reinforcing the therapeutic importance of warfarin.
title: An Informatics Consult approach for generating clinical evidence for treatment decisions

finding: The variant rs10113238 was associated with heart failure and is located upstream of the <italic>FBXO32</italic> gene, which codes for a muscle-specific F-box protein involved in muscle atrophy. This gene had prior implications in familial dilated cardiomyopathy.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The variant rs12541595 showed significant associations with heart failure traits in candidate-variant studies and knockout experiments in mice were related to changes in echocardiographic measures, pointing to its role in heart failure.
title: Multi-ancestry Multivariate Genome-Wide Analysis Highlights the Role of Common Genetic Variation in Cardiac Structure, Function, and Heart Failure-related Traits

finding: The SNP rs9987289 was associated with lower plasma lipids and higher fasting glucose levels in various genome-wide association studies (GWAS) related to the PPP1R3B locus. The minor allele of this SNP was linked to increased hepatic expression of PPP1R3B, contributing to traits such as elevated alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels.
title: PPP1R3B is a metabolic switch that shifts hepatic energy storage from lipid to glycogen

finding: Carriers of the SNP rs4240624 exhibited elevated ALT levels but showed decreased hepatic fat estimated by CT scans. This observation aligned with previous findings indicating that alterations in PPP1R3B expression were associated with metabolic dysregulations.
title: PPP1R3B is a metabolic switch that shifts hepatic energy storage from lipid to glycogen

finding: The SNP rs4841132 was found to correlate with elevated plasma glucose and significantly reduced plasma lipids when compared to noncarriers. This finding was consistent with other genetic associations and metabolic traits determined from mouse models, indicating its role in mediating effects on energy storage as glycogen instead of triglycerides.
title: PPP1R3B is a metabolic switch that shifts hepatic energy storage from lipid to glycogen

finding: The SNP rs7815797 was associated with the abundance of the genus Akkermansia and was found in both V1-V2-V3 and V4-V5-V6 sequencing datasets, reflecting its significant role in the modulation of gut microbiota.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: This variant, rs72691617, demonstrated an association with microbiota profiles, particularly impacting the abundance of beneficial bacterial populations.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: The SNP rs7817574 was linked with the presence of beneficial gut bacteria and was among variants studied across multiple sequencing datasets for their influence on microbial diversity.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: Association with rs79744701 was noted in relation to the gut microbiota and its effect on increasing microbial diversity, contributing to colorectal cancer risk modulation.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: The SNP rs4527077 showed the strongest significance (P = 1.23 x 10^-9) associated with Akkermansia abundance, suggesting its crucial role in microbiota regulation and potentially in colorectal cancer predisposition.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: Similar to rs4527077, SNP rs4736470 was directly correlated with the abundance of Akkermansia, illustrating its significant impact on gut health.
title: Gut microbiota composition in colorectal cancer patients is genetically regulated

finding: The missense variant Val452Leu in GPT was reported to strongly associate with ALT levels, demonstrating significant direct genetic influence (p < 10^-300).
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: The SNP rs7830986 was the most significantly associated TWAS SNP in induced CD14+ monocytes, linking it to the expression regulation of the LACTB2 gene. It is a synonymous variant located in the LACTB2 protein-coding gene, within the lncRNA LACTB2-AS1 and an enhancer region, suggesting its involvement in gene expression regulation relevant to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Monocyte-specific changes in gene expression implicate LACTB2 and PLIN2 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was linked to a long-range interaction with the MYC gene in colorectal cancer, suggesting its role as a significant enhancer variant influencing cancer susceptibility.
title: Rapid and Quantitative Functional Interrogation of Human Enhancer Variant Activity in Live Mice

finding: The alternative G allele of rs34866937 was linked to reduced H3K27ac peak height and reduced expression of MTSS1. This SNP also had collocation with GWAS signals for dilated cardiomyopathy.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: Although detailed findings were not fully stated, rs12541595 was suggested to have a role in enhancer-interacting with MTSS1, as highlighted by its overlapping significance in multiple GWAS.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs6983267, associated with colorectal cancer, was identified as a common predisposition factor located at chromosome 8q24. This SNP was found to enhance Wnt signaling, which is crucial for cell growth and proliferation, thus linking it to the malignant phenotype in colorectal cancer.
title: Lineage-specific oncogenes drive growth of major forms of human cancer using common downstream mechanisms

finding: The SNP rs10101615 was highlighted in the study by Helman et al. (2018), where high-resolution satellite imagery was employed to monitor grapevine stem water potential. The research indicated that genetic variations could be monitored effectively using advanced imaging techniques to optimize irrigation practices.
title: Assessing the capacity of high-resolution commercial satellite imagery for grapevine downy mildew detection and surveillance in New York state

finding: The SNP rs10090292 was associated with the study of breast cancer metastasis to bone. It was found that tumor spheroid growth within co-culture models was regulated by the interaction between tumor cells and osteoclast activity, influenced by microenvironment stiffness. This study provided insights into the role of genetic variations like rs10090292 in breast cancer cell-driven bone interactions, particularly in the context of osteolytic metastasis.
title: A novel mechanobiological model of bone metastasis reveals that mechanical stimulation inhibits the pro-osteoclastogenic effects of breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs4875048 was associated with schizophrenia and was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with the top association signal at the locus, rs10552126. This SNP acted as an eQTL that modulated the expression of the HERV ERVLE_8q24.3h, where the risk (A-) allele was associated with increased expression of this HERV, despite it being significantly downregulated in cases.
title: Schizophrenia risk from locus-specific human endogenous retroviruses

finding: This SNP was notably associated with the 'never smoked' phenotype in the Russian cohort, showing a strong association (p=3.74×10-8) and was confirmed through eQTL analysis impacting the PTK2 gene.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: The rs11781072 SNP displayed a highly significant association (p=1.45×10-6) when examining variants directly related to smoking initiation, reinforcing its potential relevance.
title: Understanding Complex Trait Susceptibilities and Ethnical Diversity in a Sample of 4,145 Russians Through Analysis of Clinical and Genetic Data

finding: SNP rs983309 was established for several glycaemic traits including fasting insulin and was linked to the new findings in this context.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs2126259 was also established for various glycaemic traits including fasting insulin and presented as part of the new findings for the study.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: SNP rs11782386 was found to have significant correlations with the 2-hour postprandial glucose, adding new support for its role in glycaemic traits.
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The rs28655823 SNP was recognized as significant in relation to tumor biology, particularly with studies connecting it to breast cancer risk factors.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The rs404337 SNP was noted for its significant relationship with gene expression variations among targeted cancer types.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The SNP rs13276086 was associated with 17 phenotypic traits in a PheWAS, demonstrating a significant link to hypertension with an odds ratio of 0.97, highlighting its role in metabolic traits and increased TNKS expression.
title: Genome-wide Selection Scan in an Arabian Peninsula Population Identifies a TNKS haplotype Linked to Metabolic Traits and Hypertension

finding: The rs1804182 variant, linked to PLAT, was found to display allelic enhancer activity. It was categorized as one of the variants that potentially contribute to SLE risk through its function as an allelic enVar.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with cancer risk, specifically indicated through its long-range interaction with the MYC oncogene in colorectal cancer, highlighting a relationship between genetic variants near MYC and cancer progression.
title: MYC drives aggressive prostate cancer by disrupting transcriptional pause release at androgen receptor targets

finding: Associated positively with weight and negatively with body fat percentage, this variant in WASHC5 was identified as a novel association with body composition traits in this cohort. Prior studies had not associated variants in WASHC5 with these traits, highlighting the unique genetic variation present in populations of African ancestry.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: An exonic variant, rs10283100 in the gene ENPP2 at 8q24.12, was found to be associated with cortical volume of the insula, thus pointing to genetic factors affecting brain regions involved in a variety of sensory and visceral functions.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: The SNP rs1293298 in the CTSB locus was reported to have a significant association with GBA penetrance after correction for multiple testing, with a meta-P-value of 6.34E-6 and an odds ratio (OR) of 0.725 (95% CI: 0.629-0.836), indicating a potential protective effect against PD.
title: Genetic modifiers of risk and age at onset in GBA associated Parkinson’s disease and Lewy body dementia

finding: The missense mutation rs74942016 in Nrg1, which resulted in a Val to Leu substitution at position 321, was previously associated with schizophrenia and more strongly with psychosis in a Costa Rican population. This mutation disrupted nuclear back signaling while minimally affecting forward signaling or local back-signaling, leading to significant changes in neuronal development in the dentate gyrus, including reduced stem cell proliferation and altered expression of schizophrenia-susceptibility genes.
title: Neuregulin1 nuclear signaling influences adult neurogenesis and regulates a schizophrenia susceptibility gene network within the mouse dentate gyrus

finding: Recognized as a significant tag in the context of linkage with other major SNPs in the analyses.
title: Genetic modifiers of somatic expansion and clinical phenotypes in Huntington’s disease reveal shared and tissue-specific effects

finding: The SNP rs112875651, near TRIB1, was associated with hyperlipidemia and colocalised with lipid levels, aligning with previous research linking it to liver disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs17321515 was noted to increase risk for coronary heart disease, particularly in the context of NAFLD within general populations.
title: Genetic architecture of 11 abdominal organ traits derived from abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs117871919 was found in SLC30A8, a gene encoding a zinc transporter primarily expressed in pancreatic beta cells. It also has known associations with glycemic control and risk factors such as Type 2 Diabetes (T2D) and Body Mass Index (BMI), which are significant risk factors for CVD, indicating that Delta ECG shares a genetic signal with both CVD and its risk factors.
title: Genetic underpinnings of predicted changes in cardiovascular function using self supervised learning

finding: SNP rs4262322 correlated with SGCZ, linked to cancer development and progression.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs10625280 was significantly associated with pain intensity in the GWAS conducted on chronic pain within the UK Biobank. It mapped to the SLC45A4 gene, identified as a key player in pain perception. This finding was corroborated across multiple studies, including the Million Veteran Program, where it was replicated and showed consistency in the direction of effect.
title: Identification of SLC45A4 as a pain gene encoding a neuronal polyamine transporter

finding: The missense variant rs3739238, located within the SLC45A4 gene, was significantly associated with pain intensity (p = 7.24 x 10^-9) in the GWAS. It was also identified as eQTL for SLC45A4 and DENND3, with roles in various health domains. This SNP exhibited significant associations with a broad range of traits, supporting its involvement in pain mechanisms.
title: Identification of SLC45A4 as a pain gene encoding a neuronal polyamine transporter

finding: The SNP rs10090292 was associated with the regulation of tumor spheroid growth in the context of breast cancer metastasis to bone. In the study referenced, it was found that signaling from bone cells and the mechanical properties of the microenvironment played a synergistic role in influencing tumor cell behavior. The study indicated that the effects of mechanical compression on pro-osteoclastogenic signaling from breast cancer cells could hinder metastasis, providing insights into the genetic factors influencing this interaction.
title: A novel mechanobiological model of bone metastasis reveals that mechanical stimulation inhibits the pro-osteoclastogenic effects of breast cancer cells

finding: The A alleles of the rs10505025 polymorphism were strongly linked with UBR5 gene expression and were associated with greater cross-sectional area (CSA) of fast-twitch muscle fibres in physically active men. Carriers of the AA genotype had significantly higher mean CSA (5796 ± 1526 µm²) compared to G allele carriers (GA: 5260 ± 1350 µm²; GG: 4011 ± 983 µm²). Furthermore, the A allele was over-represented in strength athletes (OR = 2.13, P = 0.05) and sprinters (OR = 2.93, P = 0.03) compared to endurance athletes.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The A allele of the rs4734621 SNP was strongly associated (P = 0.000013) with increased expression of the UBR5 gene, consequently hypothesized to favour strength and power-related sports. The AA genotype was linked to high competition results in elite weightlifters (P = 0.016) and the A allele was over-represented in elite strength athletes compared to controls (OR = 1.94, P = 0.04). The A allele was also over-represented in elite power athletes compared to elite endurance athletes (OR = 2.2, P = 0.04).
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The SNP rs139799338, located in the intronic region of the PKHD1L1 gene, was identified as the strongest association with the genus Acinetobacter, showing a significant negative correlation with its relative abundance (p=4.82x10^-12). This SNP was also implicated in various metabolic traits. Notably, it exhibited an association with serum testosterone levels and was influenced by gender, where males with higher testosterone had increased Acinetobacter abundance.
title: Unraveling the impact of host genetics and factors on the urinary microbiome in a young population

finding: This SNP was associated with white matter microstructure variations and influenced several FA measures across different white matter tracts.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs7818560 was associated with the distribution of miR-30d-5p expression levels across individuals, as well as the expression of the GLIS3 gene (ENSG00000107249). This was observed in the context of both miRNA and trans-eQTL analyses, where the genotype differences revealed significant associations indicated by beta slope and p-values, highlighting its role as a potential genetic determinant of miRNA-mediated gene regulation.
title: Noncanonical targeting contributes significantly to miRNA-mediated regulation

finding: The SNP rs7005905 was identified in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with other variants in the SOX7 gene, indicating a strong genetic association with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Its connection was supported through the adaptive test method applied in gene-based GWAS.
title: SOX7: Novel Autistic Gene Identified by Analysis of Multi-Omics Data

finding: The SNP rs7836366 showed strong positive linkage disequilibrium with other variants linked to the SOX7 gene. This relationship contributed to the identification of SOX7 as an autism-associated gene, further affirmed by replication data.
title: SOX7: Novel Autistic Gene Identified by Analysis of Multi-Omics Data
