finding: The SNP rs10100209 was in strong positive linkage disequilibrium with rs7005905 and rs7836366, reinforcing its association with the SOX7 gene linked to ASD. This finding was bolstered by the results from adaptive gene-based GWAS.
title: SOX7: Novel Autistic Gene Identified by Analysis of Multi-Omics Data

finding: This SNP was found to cause significant structural modifications in the lncRNA secondary structure, which may influence binding and functional interactions with RBPs.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The study reported that SNP rs10092491 was successfully analyzed using a TaqMan genotyping assay with two probes, yielding three types of positive droplet patterns corresponding to different genotypes. CLEAR-dPCR demonstrated a higher accuracy with a mean count ratio of 99.6%, compared to 104.9% for QX200-ddPCR, indicating its effectiveness in detecting the alleles at this SNP.
title: Lossless and Contamination-Free Digital PCR

finding: This SNP was associated with variability in the levels of oxylipins, particularly 12,13-EpOME, indicating its role in metabolic pathways related to lipids.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: This SNP was located in the intron of the SLC30A8 gene, which encodes a zinc transporter protein predominantly expressed in pancreatic beta cells. It played a crucial role in insulin secretion and glucose homeostasis and had a strong association with the risk of developing type 2 diabetes (T2D), making it a significant marker in T2D research.
title: Causal network perturbation analysis identifies known and novel type-2 diabetes driver genes

finding: The CLU-rs9331896-TT genotype was identified as a risk factor for Parkinson's disease (PD). In the context of spinal cord injury (SCI) treatment, spatial transcriptomics (ST) analysis showed activated astrocytes exhibited high expression levels of CLU at acute and subacute stages, which decreased at the intermediate stage. This finding suggested the potential therapeutic role of CLU-loaded biodegradable materials in managing glial scars, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in neuroinflammation and CNS injury.
title: Spatiotemporal dynamics of molecular expression pattern and intercellular interactions in glial scar responding to spinal cord injury

finding: The association between rs34591516 (p.Gly313Ser) in GPR20 and diastolic blood pressure (p=1.8×10^-6, beta=0.028) aligns with previous findings linking it to blood pressure regulation.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP was associated with a haplotype block containing novel splicing events in the RIMS2 gene linked to cocaine dependence. This discovery included three novel, highly conserved exons in the first intron, adding 56 amino acids to the protein.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The SNP rs41475248 was identified as being synergistic in relation to type II diabetes, as was demonstrated through various methods measured by Kendall’s tau. This finding highlighted the relevance of rs41475248 in understanding the genetic interactions associated with the phenotype of type II diabetes.
title: Novel Methods for Epistasis Detection in Genome-Wide Association Studies

finding: The findings for SNP rs10111784 indicated its relevance to phenological metrics derived from MODIS data across Pan-Arctic regions, based on the research conducted by Wang et al. (2018). The study dealt with the limitations and challenges in assessing these metrics, indicating the SNP's significance in relation to environmental changes.
title: A general model for the seasonal to decadal dynamics of leaf area

finding: The rs13263296 (C>T) variant was found to be associated with early ANM, with a beta value less than zero. It was located in the enhancer region of the DEPTOR gene, implicated in mTOR signaling. The analysis suggested that this SNP may enhance transcription factor binding activity, impacting DEPTOR expression. Notably, although it was linked to early ANM, the specific eQTL effects were not observed in the ovary, possibly due to bulk tissue usage in the analysis.
title: The regulatory landscapes of human ovarian ageing

finding: The SNP rs4240624 was found to have the strongest association with liver volume, exhibiting a p-value of 9.10e-27 and a beta of -0.13. It was located 175kb from the nearest gene, PPP1R3B, which is involved in glycogen biosynthesis in the liver and skeletal muscle.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: SNP rs112875651 associated with liver fat showed a p-value of 8.1e-11 and a beta of -0.05. It was related to hyperlipidemia and lipid levels, indicating a role in metabolic disease.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: This SNP was connected with lower SA in ADHD, showcasing its involvement in psychiatric vulnerability.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with lower SA in ADHD, rs7014426 highlights the genetic basis of morphological brain changes.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to greater CT in ANX, rs13263075's role underlines the relationship between anxiety and brain morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to higher SA in BD, rs6997571 demonstrated its contributing role in brain morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to genetic variants impacting primary cortical structure in BD and SCZ, showcasing significant overlap.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs892844 was associated with three potential CTCF occurrences identified by GRAFIMO. These occurrences were found in the genomic region chr8:142,782,661-142,782,680 and overlapped with a dbSNP annotated variant. This finding highlighted how genetic variation at this specific SNP could potentially affect transcription factor binding and, consequently, gene expression.
title: GRAFIMO: variant and haplotype aware motif scanning on pangenome graphs

finding: The rs147998249 SNP, a missense variant Val452Leu in the GPT gene encodes ALT, strongly associated with ALT levels, showing a genome-wide significant p-value below 10^-300.
title: Genome-wide association study of circulating liver enzymes reveals an expanded role for manganese transporter SLC30A10 in liver health

finding: This SNP was strongly associated with T-follicular helper cells, linking it to immune function within the tumor microenvironment.
title: Germline genetic contribution to the immune landscape of cancer

finding: Variant rs11136478 showed significant effect as a caQTL for a CD4+ T cell-specific site with π=0.65 and q=0.013.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: This SNP demonstrated similar strengths in associations with triglycerides, LDL, HDL, and total cholesterol, underlining its pleiotropic effects.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: This SNP showed strong associations with obesity and weak associations with type 2 diabetes and hypertension, indicating its influence on metabolic traits.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The missense variant Val452Leu (rs147998249) in GPT, encoding ALT, was strongly associated with ALT (p < 10^-300), illustrating its impact as a protein quantitative trait locus (pQTL).
title: GWAS of serum ALT and AST reveals an association of SLC30A10 Thr95Ile with hypermanganesemia symptoms

finding: The SNP rs13276086 displayed significant associations with 17 phenotypic traits in a PheWAS analysis, surpassing the established threshold of -log10[p-value] > 8. This finding suggests that variations at this SNP could be linked to diverse phenotypic expressions relevant to the traits studied, with implications for understanding health and adaptation in the Kuwaiti population.
title: Genome-wide selection scan in the Kuwaiti population identifies a TNKS haplotype linked to metabolic traits and hypertension

finding: The lead variant rs28531929 in COL22A1 was identified as genome-wide significant in association with retinal detachment, with strong evidence for its contribution to the condition.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: The variant rs11992725, an intronic variant in COL22A1, was refined from earlier signals and was genome-wide significant in association with retinal detachment.
title: Insight into the genetic aetiology of retinal detachment by combining small clinical and large population-based datasets

finding: This SNP was located in the intronic region of the PKHD1L1 gene and presented a genome-wide significant association (p=4.82×10^-12) with the relative abundance of the genus Acinetobacter, which was negatively correlated. It was also noted for its associations with various metabolic traits including the tumor marker carbohydrate antigen 199 and other metabolites, and showed strong correlations with gender and testosterone levels.
title: Unraveling the impact of host genetics and factors on the urinary microbiome in a young population

finding: The SNP rs7010179 was associated with the activity of cyclin-dependent kinases (CDKs) in human cancers, as highlighted in the work of Peyressatre et al. (2015). The finding emphasized its significant role in cancer biology, specifically in CDK inhibition strategies.
title: Mechanistic insights into the phosphoryl transfer reaction in cyclin-dependent kinase 2: a QM/MM study

finding: The SNP rs2279590 was identified as a risk variant associated with pseudoexfoliation and Alzheimer's disease. It was located within an enhancer element that regulated the expression of several genes, specifically clu, ephx2, and ptk2b, providing insights into its mechanistic role in these conditions.
title: CoMM-S2: a collaborative mixed model using summary statistics in transcriptome-wide association studies

finding: The risk allele of rs28560301, located in the AD-associated NDUFAF6 locus, showed a significantly decreased activity following IL-6 exposure. The expression of PAX5, a transcriptional activator associated with neurodevelopment, was increased after IL-6 exposure, indicating that the variant influences regulatory activity in response to inflammatory cues.
title: Dynamic stress- and inflammatory-based regulation of psychiatric risk loci in human neurons

finding: This SNP was associated with TG/HDL phenotype with an extremely high significance level (p < 10^{-200}) and was linked to the TRIB1 gene, previously connected to lipid metabolism. G2PT identified leukocyte differentiation as an unexpected function for this gene.
title: Mechanistic genotype-phenotype translation using hierarchical transformers

finding: The SNP rs10100391 was associated with the regulation of choline kinase alpha, which was linked to macrophage RELMα induction and its related metabolic programming in the context of helminth infections. The findings were relevant to the immune response, illustrating that choline metabolism played a crucial role in maintaining peritoneal immune homeostasis and optimal immunity against helminth infections.
title: Choline metabolism underpins macrophage IL-4 polarization and RELMα up-regulation in helminth infection

finding: This locus was implicated in coronary artery disease and ischemic stroke through previous associations. In particular, variants in the XKR6 region were recognized for their involvement in these conditions, suggesting relevant cardiovascular implications.
title: Medical data and machine learning improve power of stroke genome-wide association studies

finding: The intronic SNP rs6993770 in the ZFPM2 gene was characterized as a sentinel variant associated with platelet granularity (PLT-SSC). This variant was linked to increased concentration of 24 plasma proteins, with 11 of them being specifically localized to platelet alpha-granules. The association was validated through fine mapping, and its epigenetic context suggested a causal role in gene regulation relevant to platelet functions.
title: Genetic Analyses of Blood Cell Structure for Biological and Pharmacological Inference

finding: For the variant rs10866912 associated with MROH6, two substitutions were predicted to yield opposite effects on expression. Substituting the reference T allele with a C allele was predicted to decrease expression, whereas substituting with a G allele was predicted to increase it. This variant was identified as part of a binding site for the transcription factor INSM1, suggesting its involvement in the modulation of gene expression.
title: Predicting cell population-specific gene expression from genomic sequence

finding: The SNP rs10110411 was identified as a promising novel biomarker for colorectal cancer, as reported in the study by Chabanais et al. (2018). This finding related to gene expression patterns and the potential implications for prognosis in colorectal cancer patients.
title: Molecular pathway analysis indicates a distinct metabolic and immune phenotype in women with right-sided colon cancer

finding: The SNP rs1160267 mapped within a 6.7 kb downstream enhancer of NKX3-1 and was the most significant GWAS SNP in the region. It correlated with NKX3-1 enhancer H3K27ac activity (ρ = 0.35; p = 1 × 10^-3) but not with NKX3-1 expression, indicating its association with chromatin regulatory mechanisms.
title: Genetic determinants of chromatin reveal prostate cancer risk mediated by context-dependent gene regulation

finding: The variant rs11986220 was tied to an androgen receptor binding site (ARBS) approximately 220 kb centromeric to MYC. Disruption of this ARBS was shown to impair MYC expression, proliferation, and tumorigenesis in a cell line-dependent manner, supporting its contribution to prostate cancer risk.
title: Genetic determinants of chromatin reveal prostate cancer risk mediated by context-dependent gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs2553658 showed alterations in the motif for transcription factor TCF4 between reference and alternative alleles, indicating a potential role in neurological disorders. It was part of the cluster that showcased high regulatory significance.
title: Post-GWAS functional analyses of CNTNAP5 suggests its role in glaucomatous neurodegeneration

finding: The rs548251181 SNP, categorized as a GA to G indel, was reported as a known polymorphism aligned to multiple genomic features. It was visualized as a plot in studies and showcased significant alignment discrepancies concerning the hg38 reference sequence, thus indicating variations that could impact gene associations.
title: Flap-enabled next-generation capture (FENGC): precision targeted single-molecule profiling of epigenetic heterogeneity, chromatin dynamics, and genetic variation

finding: This SNP was the strongest association with liver volume (p=2.1e-34, beta=-0.15), located 175kb from the protein-coding gene PPP1R3B, which promotes hepatic glycogen biosynthesis.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP, located near TRIB1, colocalised with hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis, indicating its relevance in lipid metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Associated with cardiovascular issues, this SNP was relevant for metabolic health indicators.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP was associated with risks related to coronary artery diseases and NAFLD in specific populations.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP was designated as an islet signal at the ANK1 locus, with a high overlap with a strong islet enhancer, PPA=0.97.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4737010 was implicated as a fine-mapped SNP for lymphocyte count and was associated with the gene IKBKB. This SNP was analyzed under the PPI-enhancer × ABC annotation, emphasizing its relevance in immune system regulation and connection to autoimmune disease susceptibility.
title: SNP-to-gene linking strategies reveal contributions of enhancer-related and candidate master-regulator genes to autoimmune disease

finding: This variant was noted for its overlap with GWAS variants associated with macrophage migration and connections to NAPRT expression.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: This SNP, overlapping with GWAS variants related to macrophage activity, indicated significant effects on NAPRT expression and possibly on inflammation modulation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs10090802 in EPHX2 was identified as a significant variant linked to increased hemolytic propensity related to osmotic stress on RBCs.
title: Ferroptosis regulates hemolysis in stored murine and human red blood cells

finding: The SNP rs1047643 was identified as a novel functional risk variant associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). It displayed dynamic allelic imbalance (AI) of chromatin accessibility and allelic expression on the FDFT1 gene specifically in B cells from SLE patients. The T allele of rs1047643 exhibited preferential chromatin accessibility in activated B cells. Functional studies revealed that STAT3 directly regulated both the allelic expression of rs1047643 and the activity of a B-cell restricted super-enhancer. This SNP was also found to interact with the super-enhancer region, indicating its critical role in B cell development and deregulation in SLE.
title: STAT3-mediated allelic imbalance of novel genetic variant rs1047643 and B cell specific super-enhancer in association with systemic lupus erythematosus

finding: The SNP rs13270586 near C8orf4 was significant in secondary GxS analyses (p=1.55×10^-7) and highlighted its role in Wnt signaling pathways with potential implications for neuron development.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: Located in the SLC39A4 gene, this SNP was associated with zinc deficiency and identified as being under positive selection in Sub-Saharan Africa.
title: Ohana: detecting selection in multiple populations by modelling ancestral admixture components

finding: The SNP rs10111787 was associated with the analysis of sea surface temperature's role in determining the range limits and expansion of mangroves, specifically highlighting significant correlations with environmental variables such as temperature patterns. This SNP's finding contributed to understanding genetic variation in the black mangrove species <italic>Avicennia schaueriana</italic> along the South American coast.
title: Geographic and environmental contributions to genomic divergence in mangrove forests

finding: Though not directly genotyped, rs1532277 was identified as a causal variant validated through MPRA (p = 1.5 × 10⁻⁶) and CRISPR in neurons (p = 6.4 × 10⁻⁵) at the CLU locus. While rs1532277 was not included in the analysis, its linked neighbor, rs1532278, identified by both SuSiE and CIT-Lasso, suggested its potential role.
title: Beyond guilty by association at scale: searching for causal variants on the basis of genome-wide summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs4240624 was associated with liver volume (p=9.10e-27, beta=-0.13) and is located on chromosome 8 near the gene PPP1R3B, which is expressed in liver and skeletal muscle and promotes hepatic glycogen biosynthesis.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs112875651 showed an association with liver fat (p=8.1e-11, beta=-0.05) that colocalizes with hyperlipidemia and is known to be involved in NAFLD development.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs73221948 was located 150kb from a coding gene and was linked to VAT volume (p=1.6e-10, beta=-0.04) indicating potential metabolic relevance.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs17321515 was associated with coronary heart disease and NAFLD, supporting its role in cardiometabolic diseases.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The rs28834970 SNP was associated with increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This variant was located in an intronic enhancer of the PTK2B gene and was found to cause significant changes in chromatin accessibility and transcription factor binding, specifically increasing the binding of CEBPB. The C allele was linked to decreased expression of PTK2B in hiPSC-derived macrophages, although this effect was modest. Additionally, it altered the global transcriptome leading to changes in the expression of interferon gamma-responsive genes, including chemokines, thereby affecting chemotaxis of microglia. These results suggested a functional role of rs28834970 in modulating microglia reactivity, which could impact the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease-associated common regulatory variant in a PTK2B intron alters microglial function

finding: The analysis demonstrated that SNP rs10481349 was associated with the expression levels of the STMN4 gene in oligodendrocytes. It showed that the proportion of oligodendrocytes, as estimated by the DSA method, correlated with the expression levels of the STMN4 gene, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in the context of cell-type specific expression quantitative trait loci (eQTLs). This finding contributed to the understanding of cellular heterogeneity in brain tissue.
title: Deconvolving the contributions of cell-type heterogeneity on cortical gene expression

finding: This SNP at the BMP1 locus was identified as a significant caQTL in smooth muscle cells, implicating it in regulation related to CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: The minor allele T of SNP rs1453213 at OXR1 positively correlated with Prevotella (β = 2.23; P = 1.3 × 10-7) and negatively correlated with Bacteroides (β = -0.049; P = 3.4 × 10-4). This SNP was also part of the top two loci explaining variance in the Bacteroides-Prevotella enterotype.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: The missense variant rs73263258 was identified in the ESPR1 gene, located near the TP53INP/NDUFAF6 region, previously linked to AD. This variant caused a p.Ala159Thr change and emphasized the need to investigate deeper genetic mechanisms in this genomic region.
title: Autosomal Recessive Alzheimer’s disease (arAD): homozygosity mapping of genomic regions containing arAD loci

finding: The SNP rs11780978 (G>A) was associated with the expression and methylation of the PLEC gene, influencing OA susceptibility. Specifically, the A allele correlated with reduced PLEC expression and altered methylation levels at specific CpG sites (cg19405177 and cg14598846), with stronger effects observed in cartilage than in blood.
title: Multi-tissue epigenetic analysis of the osteoarthritis susceptibility locus mapping to the plectin gene PLEC

finding: The SNP rs10808812 was associated with orofacial clefts (OFCs) as it is located at a suggestive GWAS locus. The context of this finding relates to ZFHX4, a gene that had multiple loss-of-function de novo mutations (DNMs) identified in the study. The gene ZFHX4 was highly expressed in human neural crest cells and was determined to be a marker gene for the olfactory epithelium, thereby linking it to the etiology of OFCs.
title: Coding de novo mutations identified by WGS reveal novel orofacial cleft genes

finding: The rs35006907 locus was associated with the MTSS1 gene and linked to a variety of cardiac structural and functional phenotypes. It demonstrated a strong annotation in a region of open chromatin relevant to cardiac tissues, highlighting its significant role in the regulation of cardiovascular traits.
title: Genomic analysis reveals a functional role for myocardial trabeculae in adults

finding: The SNP rs7010112 was associated with the chromatinization of the KSHV genome during the KSHV life cycle. This finding indicated that variations at this locus could influence the interaction of KSHV with host cellular mechanisms, particularly in response to hypoxic conditions, thereby impacting the oncogenic phenotype of KSHV infected cells.
title: KSHV-encoded vCyclin can modulate HIF1α levels to promote DNA replication in hypoxia

finding: The variant rs60298754 in the MMP16 gene was identified as significant in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) related to Parkinson's Disease (PD). MMP16, which is downregulated (log2 Fold Change = -1.95, padj = .02) in PD cases, is involved in the breakdown of the extracellular matrix and has been linked to processes related to inflammation and tissue remodeling. This suggests a potential role of MMP16, and its variants like rs60298754, in PD pathology.
title: The role of ADAR editing and nonsense-mediated decay in Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The CAD risk variant rs1800590 localized to a CRE in the LPL gene locus, with a positive association (β=0.091) in European populations, thereby linking it to the gene's regulatory mechanism in lipid handling.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was found in an intronic CRE of the LPL gene and had a risk association (β=0.126) in European populations, suggesting it plays a role in lipid handling and CAD risk.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The variant rs11204085 was located in a distal intergenic CRE at the LPL locus, with a positive association (β=0.028) indicating its involvement in CAD through its regulatory role on LPL expression.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: Associated with a disruption of NR1H3 binding motif, the protective G allele of rs11204086 was linked to higher blood LPL expression, highlighting its significance in lipid handling and CAD risk.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: Similar to its counterparts at the LPL locus, rs11204087 was involved in regulatory mechanisms that affect LPL expression and subsequently CAD risk, reinforcing the role of these variants in lipid metabolism.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was also part of the regulatory landscape at the LPL locus, reinforcing the combined effect of multiple CAD risk variants found in that location.
title: Partitioning heritability using single-cell multi-omics identifies a novel macrophage subpopulation conveying genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The study indicated that mice lacking a Myc enhancer containing the human SNP rs6983267 exhibited resistance to intestinal tumors. This finding suggested a significant role of rs6983267 in tumor susceptibility, linking the SNP directly to a phenotypic outcome related to cancer biology.
title: Genomic context sensitivity of insulator function

finding: The SNP rs10110433 was associated with the presence of CA125, a clinical marker for high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) progression. This finding suggests that rs10110433 could play a role in the molecular pathways related to ovarian cancer, particularly in the context of the WNT7A-FZD5 signaling axis involved in the self-renewal of Fallopian tube stem cells. The research highlighted the significance of this SNP in the context of HGSOC as it relates to the enrichment of stem-like cells in the epithelia of the distal Fallopian tube.
title: Single Cell Transcriptomics identifies a WNT7A-FZD5 Signaling Axis that maintains Fallopian Tube Stem Cells in Patient-derived Organoids

finding: Linked to cognitive traits, with significant implications observed in ASM contexts via strong LD with GWAS peaks.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The study found that the derived allele 'C' at rs930557 in the MCPH1 locus exhibited a longer Extended Haplotype Homozygosity (EHH) range than the ancestral allele 'G'. This finding indicated a selective sweep affecting the derived allele 'C', with a specific bifurcation pattern in genealogies showing dominance of the derived allele, suggesting a novel mutation and resulting selective pressure.
title: Focusing on human haplotype diversity in numerous individual genomes demonstrates an evolutional feature of each locus

finding: The variant rs13277113 was associated with systemic lupus erythematosus and significantly affected the expression of the BLK gene, which is involved in B cell development. This finding was part of the nine variants that showed a signature of strong selection, indicating its impact on autoimmune diseases.
title: Ancient DNA reveals that few GWAS loci have been strongly selected during recent human history

finding: The SNP rs10955960, located near COL14A1 on human chromosome 8, was supported by synteny analysis with mouse genomic data, reaffirming its relevance as a previously reported causal gene in adipose tissue phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The SNP rs17482753 was reliably replicated in HDL analysis with a PIP of 1.00, consistent with previous findings.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The study reported that Lamin A/C expression latently influenced by Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) infection was linked to the presence of specific malignancies. The SNP rs10090286 was associated with distinct expressions of Lamin A/C in Hodgkin and Reed-Sternberg cells, which are linked to EBVassociated malignancies. This indicated the role of the genetic variant in the context of viral latency and oncogenesis.
title: Nuclear Lamina binds the EBV genome during latency and regulates viral gene expression

finding: The SNP rs4871180 at chr8:122,259,074 was suggested to be associated with Diverticular disease in British individuals, with high risk allele (T) frequency in Native American source populations.
title: Continental-scale genomic analysis suggests shared post-admixture adaptation in Americas

finding: An association was found between rs34591516 in GPR20 and diastolic blood pressure (p=1.8×10⁻⁶, β=0.028, 95% CI: 0.017-0.04), confirming relationships with blood pressure regulation.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: The study focused on the mutation -344T/C (rs1799998) in the CYP11B2 gene, which had been previously reported for disease association studies. This SNP was identified as crucial due to its potential linkage with diseases like hypertension and cardiac disorders. Although many SNPs were analyzed, this specific mutation received primary attention in relation to its pathogenicity, emphasizing its relevance in the context of aldosterone regulation and associated diseases.
title: In-Silico Analysis of nsSNPs Associated with CYP11B2 Gene

finding: The SNP rs1962104 predicted expression of a splice junction and specific exons of the gene PTK2, with significant associations (LIBD dataset minimum p=6.02 × 10^-7; CMC dataset p=0.0007). Such findings emphasized its potential involvement in MI and broader mood disorder contexts.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: The SNP rs2729940 was associated with the expression of RP11-481A20.10 and RP11-481A20.11, both highly expressed in the brain. The associations were significant with LIBD dataset minimum p=0.01 and CMC dataset p=0.0008, linking it to traits of MI and mental health.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: The SNP rs7818437 predicted the expression of RP11-981G7.1, which is uniquely expressed in the brain. Its significance was evidenced by LIBD dataset minimum p=2.38 × 10^-7 and CMC dataset p=0.004, suggesting its relevance in the neurological aspect of mood instability.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: The SNP rs4398922 was linked to the expression of FAM86B3P, FAM85B, and ALG1L13P, which exhibited consistent, albeit low, expression across human tissues. This association, with LIBD dataset minimum p=6.79 × 10^-11 and CMC dataset p=8.02 × 10^-7, emphasizes its potential significance in MI and mood disorders.
title: The genomic basis of mood instability: identification of 46 loci in 363,705 UK Biobank participants, genetic correlation with psychiatric disorders, and association with gene expression and function

finding: An intronic variant in NRG1 associated with EHR-OSA specifically in VUMC (beta=0.20, p=2.30x10^-3).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The rs41505344 SNP was identified in a large cohort study of 1,483 NAFLD patients compared to 17,781 controls, showing a significant association with NAFLD susceptibility (p=1.64E-04). It correlated with serum triglyceride and AST levels in 430,101 participants from the UK Biobank, suggesting its potential role in lipid homeostasis in obesity-related diseases.
title: Macrophage Scavenger Receptor 1 mediates lipid-induced inflammation in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The SNP rs13266634 was originally identified as a significant variant associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk. It was found to be overexpressed in carriers of the T2D risk allele (C), suggesting its preferential transcription under these conditions.
title: Multiple genetic variants at the SLC30A8 locus affect a local super-enhancer cluster to influence pancreatic β-cell survival and function

finding: Rs11558471 was confirmed to have the most significantly imbalanced expression in islet samples, with a significant association to T2D risk (p=4.64 x 10^-14), indicating it is an important regulatory variant.
title: Multiple genetic variants at the SLC30A8 locus affect a local super-enhancer cluster to influence pancreatic β-cell survival and function

finding: The finding related to SNP rs6983267 showed that mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which included this specific SNP, were resistant to intestinal tumors. This indicated a connection between the Myc enhancer and tumorigenesis in relation to the specific SNP, emphasizing its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Myc-dependent cell competition and proliferative response requires induction of the ribosome biogenesis regulator Peter Pan

finding: The rs548251181, a known GA to G indel, was detected in the context of analyzing reads aligning to the CCN4 gene. It was verified by MAPit-FENGC genotyping with standard PCR amplification, indicating its presence in both treated human NSC and GBM Nx18-25 cell types.
title: Flap-enabled next-generation capture (FENGC): precision targeted single-molecule profiling of epigenetic heterogeneity, chromatin dynamics, and genetic variation

finding: SNP rs10090154 exhibited a very strong association with prostate cancer (p-value of 1.4e-188) and was located in the enhancer binding motif of the FOXA1 transcription factor within the MYC EPIN.
title: The PENGUIN approach to reconstruct protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions and its application to prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs10503253, located within the CSMD1 gene, was associated with increased risk of schizophrenia. This finding was significant at the genome-wide level and indicated that the variant affects general cognitive ability and executive function in healthy males, suggesting a broader impact on cognitive functions outside of schizophrenia.
title: CUB and Sushi Multiple Domains 1 (CSMD1) opposes the complement cascade in neural tissues

finding: Associated with GRINA expression, highlighting its involvement in T cell biology.
title: Linking candidate causal autoimmune variants to T cell networks using genetic and epigenetic screens in primary human T cells

finding: The SNP rs2948300 on chromosome 8 was associated with essential hypertension, highlighting its importance in the context of obesity-related health issues.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: This variant was represented in GWAS findings related to macrophage migration inhibitory factor levels and was an eQTL for NAPRT, indicating its role in inflammation regulation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: This variant associated with macrophage-related traits and levels of NAPRT, overlapping with GWAS variants, pointing to genetic influences on immune responses.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs10955960, associated with the gene COL14A1, was confirmed through synteny analysis to be involved in a cluster of distal interactions, strengthening previous GWAS findings related to adiposity.
title: Genome-wide analysis of promoter contacts identifies novel regulators of late-stage adipogenesis

finding: The study led by Kim et al. (2018) demonstrated that SNP rs10110433 was associated with the origins of high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC), revealing its relevance in understanding the pathogenesis of this malignancy. Specifically, the research emphasized the critical role of the fallopian tube (FT) as the tissue of origin, linking this SNP to cellular processes involved in stem cell maintenance and differentiation within the FT.
title: Single Cell Transcriptomics identifies a WNT7A-FZD5 Signaling Axis that maintains Fallopian Tube Stem Cells in Patient-derived Organoids

finding: Although rs1532277 was not directly genotyped, it was validated as a causal variant at the CLU locus through MPRA (p = 1.5 × 10^-6) and CRISPR in neurons (p = 6.4 × 10^-5). Its neighboring variant, rs1532278, was identified instead but still indicated the original causal relationship.
title: In silico identification of putative causal genetic variants

finding: rs2061831 was identified as the top SNP associated with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) across diverse ancestries and showed a ΔMGW of 1.63 Å, which was 2 standard deviations above the mean across dbSNP150 indicating its potential functional relevance.
title: Intrinsic DNA topology as a prioritization metric in genomic fine-mapping studies

finding: The SNP rs4872174 was related to prostate cancer, where the risk allele was associated with decreased expression of the NKX3-1 gene. This correlation provided insights into the role of NKX3-1 in tumor progression, suggesting it may have critical implications in the biology of prostate cancer.
title: Large scale genome-wide association study in a Japanese population identified 45 novel susceptibility loci for 22 diseases

finding: The SNP rs804271 in the GATA4/NEIL2 locus was significant in the genetic association analysis focusing on regulatory elements, thereby indicating its role in PCOS-related gene expression.
title: Gene regulatory activity associated with PCOS revealed DENND1A-dependent testosterone production

finding: The SNP rs10111287 colocalized significantly with a VIRMA eQTL in thyroid tissue (PPH4=0.906) and hinted at a potential role in regulating VIRMA gene expression, thereby influencing telomere length.
title: Validation of human telomere length trans-ancestry meta-analysis association signals identifies POP5 and KBTBD6 as novel human telomere length regulation genes

finding: At the ANK1 locus, the SNP rs13262861 was associated with the gene NKX6-3, demonstrating a PPAg of 0.97. Prior islet eQTL data supported NKX6-3 as an important islet target gene for this locus, showcasing its potential involvement in type 2 diabetes.
title: Single cell ATAC-seq in human pancreatic islets and deep learning upscaling of rare cells reveals cell-specific type 2 diabetes regulatory signatures

finding: The SNP rs2280104 was highlighted as an index variant for a PD risk locus near BIN3, showing associations with the eQTL for the gene CCAR2 in dopaminergic neurons. This finding emerged from analyses incorporating various modalities of data generated through the FOUNDIN-PD initiative, emphasizing the potential impact of rs2280104 on the regulatory mechanisms influencing dopaminergic neuron biology in the context of PD.
title: The Foundational data initiative for Parkinson’s disease (FOUNDIN-PD): enabling efficient translation from genetic maps to mechanism

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified in a study where mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which included the human SNP rs6983267, were found to be resistant to intestinal tumors. This finding suggested a potential protective role of the SNP in the context of cancer development, highlighting the significance of chromatin regulation and enhancer function in carcinogenesis.
title: Steroid receptor-assisted loading modulates transcriptional responses in prostate cancer cells

finding: The study identified that the CC genotype at rs187974 had significantly higher gray matter density (GMD) in the right insula compared to T-allele carriers (TX group), indicating that the T allele could be linked to lower GMD and higher pain sensitivity.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: Data indicated that participants with the C-allele of rs10504722 had lower GMD in the dorsal anterior insula (dAI) when compared to A-allele carriers, suggesting a significant association with pain sensitivity.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: The analysis revealed that carriers of the T allele at rs16907751 exhibited lower GMD in the dAI than those with the C-allele, supporting a link between this SNP and pain sensitivity phenotypes.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: The presence of the A-allele in rs396760 was correlated with lower GMD in the dAI among individuals with high pain sensitivity, indicating its influence on pain perception.
title: A Brain-Wide Genome-Wide Association Study of Candidate Quantitative Trait Loci Associated with Structural and Functional Phenotypes of Pain Sensitivity

finding: The SNP rs6983267, located in the super-enhancer region on 8q24, was found to be associated with a greater than 20% increased risk for colorectal and prostate cancers. This G-allele was observed in over 50% of individuals with European ancestry and over 85% in those with African ancestry. Furthermore, experiments demonstrated that deletion of regulatory sequences syntenic to this region in mice resulted in reduced MYC expression but conferred resistance to intestinal and mammary tumors, suggesting a dual role in promoting cancer risk while having a protective effect against tumorigenesis.
title: Shared requirement for MYC upstream super-enhancer region in tissue regeneration and cancer

finding: This SNP showed coding changes affecting ANK1 expression, supporting its role in hematological traits.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Identified as a variant impacting ANK1, connecting it to the regulation of reticulocyte count.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Confirmed as an eQTL impacting ANK1 expression levels in blood, implicating it in reticulocyte volume.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Related to ATU in the ANK1 gene, involved in red cell development.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: Similar to rs39451, SNP rs39499 was also found significant in the promoter region of KCS4, implying its potential role in regulating the expression of KCS4 under carbon starvation. Its involvement in linkage with other SNPs in the promoter further emphasizes its regulatory importance.
title: Hello darkness, my old friend: 3-Ketoacyl-Coenzyme A Synthase4 is a branch point in the regulation of triacylglycerol synthesis in Arabidopsis by re-channeling fatty acids under carbon starvation

finding: The rs6981405 variant, an A-to-C transversion within the DDHD2 gene, was found to disrupt the QKI binding motif ACUAAC and was associated with an increased risk for schizophrenia. The analysis demonstrated that in silico mutagenesis predicted a lower target signal amplitude for the alternative allele compared to the reference allele. This variation was quantified using the Kullback–Leibler divergence, which indicated a significant impact of the variant on the binding mechanism, particularly at the last position of the binding motif. RBPNet's feature attribution maps confirmed that the mutation shifted the predicted signal from high-positive to high-negative, highlighting the detrimental effect of this transversion on protein-RNA interaction.
title: Towards In-Silico CLIP-seq: Predicting Protein-RNA Interaction via Sequence-to-Signal Learning

finding: The SNP rs8192327 was associated with the SFTPC gene concerning FEV/FVC ratio. This provided evidence of its relevance to pulmonary function traits due to its introduction in modern populations.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: It was successfully prioritized by WEVar with the highest score among all LD-linked variants related to Systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: It scored higher than GWAS SNP rs2859998, which is related to narcolepsy with cataplexy, indicating its potential role in gene regulation.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with two traits in opposite directions, further supporting evidence of its pleiotropic nature.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: The SNP rs6981405 was identified as a key variant in the DDHD2 gene's 3' UTR, which disrupts binding by the RNA-binding protein QKI. This disruption was shown to impact the regulation of DDHD2 mRNA, contributing to schizophrenia risk. The association with schizophrenia was validated across different populations, indicating a significant role for this SNP in the genetic heritability of the disorder.
title: Genome-wide landscape of RNA-binding protein dysregulation reveals a major impact on psychiatric disorder risk

finding: The RUNX1T1 rs34269950 SNP was found to be associated with obesity and metabolic syndrome, conditions that are significant contributors to heart failure risk.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The rs111248619 SNP was implicated in the KCNQ3 locus, showing significant association with T2D (p=2.71 × 10^-8) during the analysis.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The rs7982 variant in CLU showed a beneficial association, indicating lower AD risk in carriers, a novel finding that was not established in previous studies.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10109434, associated with SA1, was previously linked to academic attainment and cognitive ability.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: SNP rs620513 was linked with the gene FGF20, which also showed specific and significant expression in DA neurons, marking it as an important candidate for further investigation.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The SNP rs6651252 was associated with Crohn's disease and was found to impact MYC gene expression specifically in human colonic epithelial cells. This finding highlighted the relevance of MYC in the context of Crohn's disease, linking genetic variation to changes in gene expression that could contribute to disease pathology.
title: Single-cell sequencing of developing human gut reveals transcriptional links to childhood Crohn’s disease

finding: The SNP rs74942016 represented a missense mutation in the NRG1 gene, resulting in a Valine to Leucine substitution at position 321 (V321L) in the TYPEIII NRG1 protein. This mutation was associated with schizophrenia, and more strongly with psychosis, observed in a Costa Rican population. The mutation impaired gamma secretase cleavage between cysteine 320 and valine 321, thereby reducing nuclear translocation of the intracellular domain (ICD). This impairment suggested a potential contribution of disrupted NRG1 signaling to neurodevelopmental disorders such as schizophrenia.
title: Neuregulin1 nuclear signaling influences adult hippocampal neurogenesis and regulates a schizophrenia susceptibility gene network within the mouse dentate gyrus

finding: The SNP rs10956415, located 432 kb downstream of MYC, showed a moderate effect on cell growth in MCF7 cells. Prime editing of this locus converting the A allele to the reference C allele led to a significant increase in MYC expression, which positively correlated with cell growth.
title: High throughput PRIME editing screens identify functional DNA variants in the human genome

finding: The CLU gene variant rs11136000 was associated with mild cognitive impairment in patients with type 2 diabetes, indicating potential neurocognitive effects linked to diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs9331896 SNP at the CLU locus associated with increased APOE levels in the TBS fraction and had connections with AD-related risk phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The rs73223431 SNP in PTK2B was linked to increased levels of p-Tau in the TX and FA fractions.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The SNP rs10110458 was identified as being associated with aberrant RNA splicing in neuroblastoma. This mutated variant showed a strong correlation with elevated expression of splicing factors, which was linked to a poor clinical outcome. Its connection to altered gene products suggested that it plays a role in neuroblastoma's splicing-dependent mechanisms, ultimately supporting the notion that targeting the spliceosome could offer new therapeutic avenues.
title: Alternative splicing in neuroblastoma generates RNA-fusion transcripts and is associated with vulnerability to spliceosome inhibitors

finding: The study indicated that mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which included the human SNP rs6983267, demonstrated resistance to intestinal tumors. This finding contextualized the role of this SNP in potentially regulating proto-oncogene expression, emphasizing its association with tumorigenesis.
title: Oncogenic Notch promotes long-range regulatory interactions within hyperconnected 3D cliques

finding: Identified in research using machine learning to detect tree-related microhabitats in TLS point clouds, this SNP played a role in enhancing the understanding of forest habitat profiling.
title: Spatial distribution of Tree-related Microhabitats in a primeval mountain forest: from natural patterns to landscape planning and forest management recommendations

finding: Near the CLU and PTK2B genes, rs28834970 was identified as an outlier in multiple immune cell models, particularly showing reduced regulatory activity in macrophages due to an alteration in a CEBP binding site affecting PTK2B expression. Its predicted effects across various immune cells highlight its importance in immunity-related processes.
title: Regression convolutional neural network models implicate peripheral immune regulatory variants in the predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The study reported that the germline SNP rs4295627 was associated with a 1.3-fold increased risk of glioma development. This SNP was located next to a recurrent structural variation in the lncRNA CCDC26, which was implicated in Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) cases, highlighting its potential role in pediatric brain cancer.
title: Recurrent structural variations of lncRNA gene CCDC26 in diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma

finding: The SNP rs10090337 was associated with a study that highlighted the role of oxidative phosphorylation in ovarian cancer therapy. The findings suggested that variants in this locus could influence the response to oxidative stress, thereby affecting the efficacy of drugs like plumbagin, which induce oxidative stress to compromise Na+/K+-ATPase (NKA) activity.
title: Plumbagin-induced oxidative stress leads to inhibition of Na+/K+-ATPase (NKA) in canine cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs1947178 was located 159,430 bp downstream of the TOX transcription start site (TSS). It was observed to increase chromatin accessibility and gene expression of TOX in fruit bats, with further relevance to diabetic nephropathy.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of frugivory adaptations in the bat kidney and pancreas

finding: The study found that the SNP rs6983267 is associated with the Myc enhancer, which plays a critical role in tumorigenesis. In mouse models, it was reported that mice lacking this enhancer, which includes the human SNP rs6983267, exhibited resistance to the development of intestinal tumors. This finding provided insight into the link between genetic variations at this locus and the susceptibility to intestinal cancer, further highlighting the impact of Apc mutations in controlling cell proliferation and maintaining epithelial homeostasis.
title: Mutational inactivation of Apc in the intestinal epithelia compromises cellular organisation

finding: SNP rs4921913 located closely to the NAT2 gene showed a strong association with AAMU, a metabolite derived from coffee, indicating that levels of AAMU were significantly influenced by this genetic variant. This association remained significant even after controlling for coffee intake.
title: The faecal metabolome and its determinants in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: SNP rs35246381 was reported to be linked with the ratio between 1,3-dimethylurate and AAMU, in linkage disequilibrium with SNP rs4921913. This finding was replicated in further analyses.
title: The faecal metabolome and its determinants in inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The variant rs35241117 reached the highest frequency globally in Arabia and was associated with multiple traits including glomerular filtration rate, bone mineral density, BMI, standing height, and hypertension. While specific selection findings were not mentioned, the high local frequency suggests a potential positive selection.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The variant rs1208, which is associated with the NAT2 gene, was shown to have high allele frequencies (near 100%) in various provinces in China. This finding suggested that testing for the NAT2 genotype before administering isoniazid, a drug for tuberculosis, might not be necessary for the Chinese population due to the low risk of adverse reactions from drug accumulation.
title: NyuWa Genome Resource: Deep Whole Genome Sequencing Based Chinese Population Variation Profile and Reference Panel

finding: The SNP rs10110444 was found to be positively associated with the response to chemotherapy in epithelial ovarian cancers (EOCs) characterized by high Centrosome-Nucleus Index (CNI). This was corroborated by findings in patient-derived xenografts (PDXs) and cellular models, suggesting that the presence of this SNP may correlate with better patient survival and a favorable response to chemotherapy, linking genetic variations to treatment outcomes.
title: Centrosome amplification favours survival and impairs ovarian cancer progression

finding: This SNP was identified as a sub-threshold locus for the PR interval, located intronic to KLHL38, yet looping to the gene FBXO32, an E3 ubiquitin ligase implicated in muscle atrophy.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The rs1804182 variant associated with the PLAT gene was found to be an allelic variant that could affect protein coding and exhibited significant allelic activity in SLE risk contexts.
title: Genome-wide discovery of SLE genetic risk variant allelic enhancer activity

finding: The CLU gene rs11136000 variant was associated with mild cognitive impairment in patients suffering from type 2 diabetes, suggesting a link between genetic variants and cognitive health in diabetic patients.
title: Analysis of key genes and pathways associated with the pathogenesis of Type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: RUNX1T1 gene rs34269950 was associated with obesity and metabolic syndrome, underscoring its potential significance in the development of type 2 diabetes.
title: Analysis of key genes and pathways associated with the pathogenesis of Type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: This SNP was replicated as a positive finding related to T2E breast cancer, showing an Odds Ratio (OR) of 0.50 with a p-value of 3.90 x 10^-2.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: This SNP was replicated with a strong association to gain of NCOA2 in pancreatic cancer, evidencing its relevance across cancer types.
title: Germline determinants of the prostate tumor genome

finding: The SNP rs11777976 was identified as having a significant change in its effect size across different ancestry populations when predicting the BMI phenotype. In White and Black ancestry groups, the major allele A was associated with a weak positive correlation to BMI, whereas in the Chinese population, DendroPRS assigned it a strong negative effect size of -0.07. This SNP is located in an intron of the MSRA gene, which has previously been linked to adiposity and BMI in various European populations. Furthermore, the minor allele frequency for this SNP was reported to be very high in Europeans (close to 0.5) but very low in Asians (MAF=0.04). This highlights the importance of ancestry-specific approaches in genetic research, particularly regarding fat distribution and metabolic outcomes.
title: Multi-ancestry polygenic risk scores using phylogenetic regularization

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified in a study where mice lacking a Myc enhancer that included this SNP demonstrated resistance to intestinal tumors. This finding underscored the importance of the Myc enhancer and its associated SNP in tumor susceptibility, confirming its role in regulating MYC and influencing cancer outcomes.
title: Controlling gene activation by enhancers through a drug-inducible topological insulator

finding: The SNP rs10110433 was associated with high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) through its role in the WNT7A-FZD5 signaling axis, which was critical for the self-renewal of fallopian tube stem cells. The context of this finding indicated that this axis was enriched in cells that expressed HGSOC markers, particularly CA125, relevant for understanding HGSOC progression and therapy response.
title: Single Cell Transcriptomics identifies a WNT7A-FZD5 Signaling Axis that maintains Fallopian Tube Stem Cells in Patient-derived Organoids

finding: Found to be significantly associated with alanine aminotransferase (ALT) at the GPT gene locus in African ancestry participants, indicating its relevance in liver enzyme regulation.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: This variant had a significant effect on RASAL3 expression, linking it to lymphocyte behavior.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP was implicated in the regulation of RASAL3 and subsequent blood cell responses.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: This variant served as an eQTL, showing consistency in its regulatory role across multiple genes.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The variant influenced the expression of ANK1, further demonstrating its role in erythropoiesis.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs56372821 was identified as the single genome-wide significant SNP for cannabis use disorder (CUD). It showed strong evidence of increased risk for ADHD, with an odds ratio (IVW OR) of 1.47 and a significance level of p = 0.001. This finding indicated a bidirectional causal relationship, suggesting that liability to CUD could increase ADHD risk.
title: Investigating causal pathways between liability to ADHD and substance use, and liability to substance use and ADHD risk, using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs10090292 was identified as a positive original finding in the context of breast cancer metastasis to bone. This finding was derived from the work conducted by Bray et al. (2018), which emphasized the role of mechanical stimuli on tumor spheroid growth and the interplay between bone cell signaling and matrix stiffness in driving osteolysis.
title: A novel mechanobiological model of bone metastasis reveals that mechanical stimulation inhibits the pro-osteoclastogenic effects of breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs10090330 was associated with proliferative and invasive colorectal tumors in pet dogs, providing a unique perspective on human colorectal cancer. This connection highlighted the potential for comparative oncology to inform cancer research.
title: A Multi-Tissue Comparison and Molecular Characterization of Canine Organoids

finding: The SNP rs6983267, located at chromosome 8q24, was identified as a significant risk variant for colorectal cancer. Its role in cancer was linked to enhanced Wnt signaling, which provides mechanisms similar to those used in tissue regeneration. In studies involving mice, those lacking a Myc enhancer that includes the human SNP rs6983267 exhibited resistance to intestinal tumors, highlighting the SNP's functional implications in both tumorigenesis and the regenerative processes of intestinal tissue.
title: Shared requirement for MYC upstream super-enhancer in tissue regeneration and cancer

finding: The SNP rs41505344 was significantly associated with serum triglycerides and aspartate transaminase (AST) levels in a cohort of over 400,000 patients. Specifically, quantitative trait analysis indicated a strong correlation even after adjustments for confounding factors such as age, gender, BMI, and center. Additionally, it was noted that rs41505344 influenced the expression of MSR1, particularly during the differentiation of monocytes to macrophages, which may affect metabolic features relevant to obesity-related diseases.
title: Macrophage Scavenger Receptor 1 mediates lipid-induced inflammation in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease

finding: The variant rs60298754 in the MMP16 gene was identified as significant in a GWAS study related to Parkinson's Disease (PD). This finding indicates a potential link between the genetic variant and the pathology of PD, supporting the hypothesis that genetic factors contribute to the disease.
title: The role of ADAR editing and nonsense-mediated decay in Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The variant rs7982 in CLU was characterized by its beneficial association with lower risk of AD, with minor allele carriers showing decreased hazards consistently across age ranges.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs4129585 (TSNARE1) deletions were also achieved with efficiencies of approximately 50-100%. Similar to rs47766428, the deletion was verified in bulk transfected cells and individual clones.
title: CRISPR Del/Rei: A simple, flexible and efficient pipeline for scarless genome editing

finding: This SNP was noted for its proximal gene being specifically enriched and expressed, aligning with findings relevant to Parkinson's disease genetic susceptibility.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, ageing and disease

finding: The rs1293298 SNP, located in the CTSB locus, exhibited an effect size opposite to the general PD trends, with recent findings suggesting it as a potential genetic modifier for GBA-associated PD, thereby linking it with PD pathology in the context of carriers.
title: Penetrance of Parkinson’s disease in LRRK2 p.G2019S carriers is modified by a polygenic risk score

finding: The SNP rs6651252 was found to impact MYC gene expression in human colonic epithelial cells, which is significant in the context of Crohn's disease. This finding suggested a link between this SNP and the dysregulation of the MYC proto-oncogene, which is known to alter various cellular functions, consequently supporting tumor induction and maintenance.
title: Premature Aging and Reduced Cancer Incidence Associated with Body-Wide Loss of Myc

finding: The SNP rs10090286 was associated with distinct 3D structural patterns of Lamin A/C expression in Hodgkin and Reed-Sternberg cells. This finding related to the epigenetic regulation of the EBV genome during latency and its impact on viral gene expression, suggesting a critical role of lamin A/C in the context of EBV-linked malignancies.
title: The Nuclear Lamina Binds the EBV Genome During Latency and Regulates Viral Gene Expression

finding: The SNP rs7830986 was identified as the most significantly associated TWAS SNP in induced monocytes. It was a synonymous variant in the LACTB2 gene and also situated within the lncRNA LACTB2-AS1 and an enhancer region. This indicated that rs7830986 might influence LACTB2 expression via the lncRNA or by modulating transcription-factor binding within the enhancer.
title: Monocyte-specific changes in gene expression implicate LACTB2 and PLIN2 in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Association with prostate cancer was confirmed for rs6983267 at 8q24.21, evidenced by a higher frequency of the risk-increasing G allele in MADCaP cases (98.2%) compared to controls (97.9%). However, no significant allele frequency differences between African populations were observed.
title: A custom genotyping array reveals population-level heterogeneity for the genetic risks of prostate cancer and other cancers in Africa

finding: Located at 8q24.3, rs2294008 was associated with bladder and gastric cancer. It exhibited considerable allele frequency variations: 28.7% in Senegal, 35.7% in Ghana, 28.8% in Nigeria, and 54.8% in South Africa, with p-values < 0.0001 for comparisons between South Africa and other countries.
title: A custom genotyping array reveals population-level heterogeneity for the genetic risks of prostate cancer and other cancers in Africa

finding: The SNP rs80207740, a promoter SNP, had a PIP of 0.97 for red blood cell count, far surpassing the PIP of 0.28 reported by SuSiE, indicating PolyFun's strength in identifying significant variants.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: This variant was associated with both luminal-like and HER2-enriched-like subtypes.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The rs12056334 variant was associated with fasting insulin (FI) in African American individuals. It is located near the LOC100128993 gene, which is an uncharacterized RNA gene. The discovery was significant in this ancestry group but not in others.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The rs35006907 locus on chromosome 8 was associated with a variety of cardiac structure and function phenotypes. It was strongly annotated as an expression QTL for the MTSS1 gene, indicating its relevance to cardiac function and emphasizing its role in cytoskeletal signaling in trabecular morphology.
title: Genomic analysis reveals a functional role for myocardial trabeculae in adults

finding: The SNP rs2732317 was found to be associated with effects in gene expression and was linked to a regulatory effect impacting the binding of three transcription factor (TF) motifs: EHF/ELF2, ETV4/ELK1/ETS1/FLI1/ELK4/ETS2/FEV/GABP1, and ELK3/ELF1/ERG/GABPA. This finding was corroborated by TF binding data from the ENCODE project.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: The SNP rs2732318 was part of a haplotype composed of the minor alleles of two SNPs (including rs2732317), which exhibited potential regulatory effects. This association with the binding of motifs similar to those influenced by rs2732317 highlights its relevance in transcriptional regulation.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: The SNP rs6983267 in the CCAT2 gene was associated with a lower risk of colorectal cancer (CRC), where carriers of the T-allele had about a 30% reduced risk compared to GG homozygotes. This finding replicated earlier results and highlighted the importance of the 8q24.21 locus in CRC carcinogenesis.
title: Intake of red and processed meat, use of non-steroid anti inflammatory drugs, genetic variants and risk of colorectal cancer; a prospective study of the Danish “Diet, Cancer and Health” cohort

finding: This SNP was part of the fine-mapping studies connected to the MYC region (8q24, 127.6–129.0Mb) that had previously been mapped. It contributed to understanding prostate cancer risk and was highlighted as a SNP of interest in relation to its involvement in tumor resistance in studies involving mice lacking a Myc enhancer.
title: H3k27ac-HiChIP in prostate cell lines identifies risk genes for prostate cancer susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs73348588 was identified within a region related to a strong signal linked to breast cancer, particularly related to a deletion analysis near ADCY8. It was the lead SNP in this region, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.13, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors associated with breast cancer.
title: Rare copy number variants (CNVs) and breast cancer risk

finding: Variant rs13262861 within the ANK1 locus was connected to NKX6-3 in beta cells. Previous islet expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) data supported this linkage, emphasizing its importance in the genetic basis of T2D.
title: Single cell ATAC-seq in human pancreatic islets and deep learning upscaling of rare cells reveals cell-specific type 2 diabetes regulatory signatures

finding: The SNP rs1495741 in the NAT2 gene was highlighted for its correlation with self-reported facial aging, particularly relating to skin fluorescence and glycation.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The rs11136000 variant in the CLU gene demonstrated a significant association with mild cognitive impairment in type 2 diabetes patients, underscoring potential interactions between cognitive health and metabolic disorders.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and signaling pathways in gestational diabetes mellitus by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The variant rs7824905 (P522R) in the PLCG2 gene was identified as a rare protective missense variant that decreased the risk of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD). This protective effect was associated with preservation of synaptic integrity and reduced peri-plaque microglial engulfment of synapses, indicating its central role in mediating synaptic loss in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: Uncoupling of synaptic loss from amyloid burden by an Alzheimer’s disease protective variant of PLCγ2

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified as a significant risk variant associated with colorectal cancer due to its long-range interaction with the MYC gene. This finding highlighted its role in cancer risk and its importance in the field of genetic research.
title: Using three-dimensional regulatory chromatin interactions from adult and fetal cortex to interpret genetic results for psychiatric disorders and cognitive traits

finding: This SNP located in AGPAT5 (8p23.1) showed similar strengths of associations to triglycerides, LDL, HDL, and total cholesterol.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: Near the RPL35AP19 gene (8q24.12), rs2891902 showed the strongest association to obesity and weak associations with type 2 diabetes and hypertension.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The rs1390938 SNP, corresponding to the Thr136Ile polymorphism, was confirmed to be unique to the human lineage among 236 vertebrate species, with all other species retaining asparagine (Asn) at this locus. This finding suggested that the mutation contributed to distinct aspects of human behavior modulated by monoaminergic transmission, particularly in emotional and cognitive functioning. Additionally, the humanized mouse model carrying this polymorphism displayed reduced anxiety-related traits and altered gene expression in the amygdala, linking the SNP to human socio-emotional behaviors.
title: Humanized substitutions of Vmat1 in mice induce changes in amygdala-dependent behaviors associated with the evolution of anxiety in humans

finding: The SNP rs7010143 related to the modification of macrophage recruitment in the mammary tumor microenvironment was highlighted in the context of obesity and inflammation in breast adipose tissue. This finding was based on the study by Santander et al. (2015), suggesting that this SNP might play a role in influencing metabolic interactions between adipocytes and tumor cells.
title: In vivo optical metabolic imaging of long-chain fatty acid uptake in orthotopic models of triple negative breast cancer

finding: The rs6981405 SNP, which involved an A-to-C transversion within the DDHD2 gene, was associated with disruption of QKI binding and was linked to risk for schizophrenia. RBPNet's analysis revealed that this variant led to a significantly lower predicted target signal for the alternative allele compared to the reference allele. This finding was quantified using Kullback–Leibler divergence, demonstrating that the A-to-C transversion adversely affected the QKI binding motif ACUAAC, resulting in a negative change in signal attribution at the mutation site. Additionally, systematic in silico mutagenesis highlighted that mutations within the QKI motif had larger impact scores compared to those outside the motif, confirming RBPNet's capacity to assess the variant's impact.
title: Towards In-Silico CLIP-seq: Predicting Protein-RNA Interaction via Sequence-to-Signal Learning

finding: The finding indicated that SNP rs55705857 was introduced during the editing of the human astrocyte cell line AA7 at the Mayo Clinic. This SNP was incorporated into the genome as part of a designed template sequence that replaced a DNA fragment on chromosome 8. The presence of the SNP was confirmed through Sanger sequencing, and it served as a genetic marker in the study to track the success of the DNA editing, demonstrating its relevance in the context of genome editing experiments.
title: Clonally selected lines after CRISPR/Cas editing are not isogenic

finding: SNP rs34557926 was determined to be a lead SNP at a novel locus on Chromosome 8 associated with cIMT, marking a new discovery in genetic research related to vascular remodeling and atherosclerosis.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs2912062, located on Chromosome 8, showed high linkage disequilibrium with another previously identified SNP, indicating its relevance in the same genetic signal affecting cIMT.
