title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs2912063, located on Chromosome 8, was validated as contributing to the same genetic signal as linked SNPs related to cIMT, thus reinforcing its relevance.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: This high effect SNP associated with myopia was located in an intron of CLU. It was predicted to regulate CLU, being broadly accessible across retinal cell types but notably impacting accessibility in Müller glia due to disruption of a homeodomain transcription factor motif.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The variant rs112892337 was found to be associated with the phenotype 'Comparative height size at age 10' (UK Biobank Field ID: 1697). It had a minor allele frequency of 0.4% and a p-value of 3.0E-15, linked with the gene ZFAT.
title: Efficient mixed model approach for large-scale genome-wide association studies of ordinal categorical phenotypes

finding: The CRISPLD1 rs12115090 polymorphism was linked to altered antiplatelet potency of clopidogrel in coronary artery disease patients, indicating its importance in pharmacogenomics.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The interaction between SNP rs987525 and surrounding CpGs in the enhancer region was significant in both the isolated CL/P and control analyses, although the significance was lost when stratifying into more groups.
title: Gene-methylation interactions: Discovering region-wise DNA methylation levels that modify SNP-associated disease risk

finding: The SNP rs4129585 was found to be a functional common variant associated with schizophrenia risk. It was shown to function as a regulatory element in specific pathways related to synaptic proteins and neurodevelopmental processes. Functional assays demonstrated that the variant induced differential expression of 109 genes at FDR <0.05 and 259 genes at FDR <0.1 in neural precursor cells derived from isogenic clones. Notably, the variant did not regulate TSNARE1 transcripts, as initially thought, but rather demonstrated a suggestive regulatory effect on ADGRB1, implicated in synaptogenesis.
title: A Functional Schizophrenia-associated genetic variant near the TSNARE1 and ADGRB1 genes

finding: The SNP rs4976977 was involved in intelligence measurement and psychiatric conditions, providing significant insights into its role in cognitive phenotypes.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs4976976 was associated with further neuropsychiatric disorders, confirming its relevance in mental health mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs10808812 was linked to the risk of orofacial clefts (OFCs) as it resided in proximity to the gene ZFHX4, which was highlighted due to its multiple loss-of-function (LoF) de novo mutations (DNMs). The evidence supporting this SNP's relevance comprised a strong pLI score of 1, suggesting a high likelihood of gene intolerance to variation, indicating its critical role in craniofacial development.
title: Coding de novo mutations identified by WGS reveal novel orofacial cleft genes

finding: rs2620666 was found to overlap a RAMPAGE-verified unannotated TSS of PPP1R16A, which is 11,915 bp upstream of its nearest GENCODE-annotated TSS. It was also identified as an eQTL for several genes, notably PPP1R16A in whole blood samples, indicating its potential influence on gene expression.
title: A catalog of transcription start sites across 115 human tissue and cell types

finding: The variant rs35241117, located near the TNKS gene, was noted for its association with multiple traits, including glomerular filtration rate and bone mineral density. Although specific details regarding the strength of selection were not provided, the variant was highlighted for its high frequency in Arabian populations.
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with a Myc enhancer, and it was found that mice lacking this enhancer, which contains the rs6983267 variant, exhibited resistance to intestinal tumors. This finding had implications for understanding the role of enhancers in cancer development.
title: Uncovering Hidden Enhancers Through Unbiased In Vivo Testing

finding: The SNP rs7017386 was identified as a risk variant for colorectal cancer. It was shown to modulate the expression of two oncogenic long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) through the mediation of a long-range chromatin loop involving the transcription factor ATF1. This finding highlighted the importance of chromatin structure in regulating gene expression associated with cancer phenotypes.
title: Computational Enhanced Hi-C data reveals the function of structural geometry in genomic regulation

finding: At the PLAG1-CHCHD7 locus for birth weight, the PIP for rs72656010 improved from 0.80 to 0.97 when incorporating the cV2F score. This variant was implicated by various features including ABC, cCRE, Enformer, and Zoonomia. It was linked to the PLAG1 and CHCHD7 genes, with PLAG1 previously implicated in growth-related traits in animals, suggesting it as a likely causal gene.
title: A consensus variant-to-function score to functionally prioritize variants for disease

finding: At the GATA4/NEIL2 locus for Apolipoprotein A, the PIP for rs17810889 improved from 0.78 to 0.98 when incorporating the Liver-cV2F score. The variant was related to Liver-ABC, Liver-ChromBPNet, and Liver-Enformer features and was linked to the NEIL2 gene, which encodes DNA glycosylase enzymes. This suggested its involvement in APOBEC3-mediated mutagenesis.
title: A consensus variant-to-function score to functionally prioritize variants for disease

finding: The SNP rs1478898 served as an eQTL for the FAM66A gene, which was disrupted by the inversion distal breakpoint. This disruption indicated a potential role of the SNP in influencing gene expression related to obesity-related traits.
title: Polymorphic inversions underlie the shared genetic susceptibility to prevalent common diseases

finding: The SNP rs140730217 was linked to the FAM66D gene, whose gene body was split by the inversion. This separation suggested that the SNP was likely causal in terms of affecting the expression and potential contribution to the obesity phenotype.
title: Polymorphic inversions underlie the shared genetic susceptibility to prevalent common diseases

finding: The SNP rs78875955 was found to be a genome-wide significant locus for smoking initiation, specifically associated with the gene EPHX2, which was among the previously reported loci.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs11557049 was identified as a locus lead variant in the PDE7A gene and consisted of a single protein-altering variant. It showed consistent association with eGFRcys/BUN, marking it as a likely candidate for kidney function.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs10111787 was associated with the role of sea surface temperature in delineating the range limits and potential expansion of mangrove species in Eastern South America, particularly in Brazil. This finding highlighted the ecological and genetic implications of climatic factors on the distribution of mangrove trees, linking genetic variation to environmental stresses such as temperature. The study confirmed that genetic differentiation in mangroves could be influenced significantly by oceanic conditions.
title: Geographic and environmental contributions to genomic divergence in mangrove forests

finding: The SNP rs5313, located in the exon region of CYP11B2, was found to have a significantly higher frequency in African American (AA) men with prostate cancer (PrCa) compared to European American (EA) men. This finding suggested that the presence of this SNP could potentially affect the function of CYP11B2, facilitating the conversion of corticosterone to aldosterone, which is relevant for altered androgen biosynthesis in AA men.
title: Racial differences in androgen metabolism and receptor signaling in prostate cancer

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs4544 was identified in the exon region of CYP11B2 and was also significantly more frequent in AA men with PrCa than in EA men. This SNP, like rs5313, has the potential to modify CYP11B2 function and contribute to increased aldosterone synthesis among AA men, which relates to altered androgen pathway dynamics in localized PrCa.
title: Racial differences in androgen metabolism and receptor signaling in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs10717382 was significantly associated with increased chromatin accessibility at the SLC26A7 promoter and its expression in progenitors. It also colocalized with an index SNP associated to variations in cortical surface area, suggesting a genetic pathway affecting brain structure.
title: Inferring cell-type-specific causal gene regulatory networks during human neurogenesis

finding: A low-frequency coding variant in DOK2 was identified as associated with lymphocyte count, in addition to monocytes, neutrophils, and platelets, in a large trans-ethnic analysis of 750K individuals.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The SNP rs72725879 was significant in both the African American and Japanese American cohorts, representing one of the independent loci identified in the studies. It was found in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1456315 in the Japanese American population.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: In the Japanese American GWAS, rs1456315 was the most significantly associated SNP, with a p-value of 1.40 × 10^-13. It was also shared with rs72725879, indicating its relevance in prostate cancer susceptibility among diverse ancestries.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs76595456 was highlighted as the most significantly associated SNP in the study, with a p-value of 1.01 × 10^-15. Its presence was limited to populations of recent African ancestry, confirming its role as a potential novel risk SNP for prostate cancer.
title: Multi-ethnic transcriptome-wide association study of prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs11557049 mapped to the gene PDE7A. This variant was identified as the locus lead variant and was part of a 99% credible set consisting of a single protein-altering variant, linking it strongly to kidney function.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: This SNP was linked to liver volume, showing a significant association (p=2.1e-34, beta=-0.15). It was located 175kb from the gene PPP1R3B, which is involved in hepatic glycogen biosynthesis.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: This SNP was associated with hyperlipidemia and atherosclerosis, and its linkage to liver disorders showed relevance in previous studies.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Showed strong evidence of association with a P-value of 8.65 × 10^-8, residing in the intron of the gene PSD3, which is related to schizophrenia and treatment response studies.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The rs6983267 SNP, known as a functionally validated GWAS colon and prostate cancer susceptibility SNP, demonstrated increased chromatin accessibility in COAD samples when compared to KIRC. This finding was particularly associated with MYC gene expression and localized to the MYC promoter, suggesting that the accessibility patterns observed in COAD may also be relevant to other cancer types with extensive chromatin accessibility.
title: The UCSC Xena platform for public and private cancer genomics data visualization and interpretation

finding: The SNP rs10100359 was associated with a cooperative relationship between STAT5 and reactive oxygen species (ROS) in the context of leukemia. This finding suggested that the alleles at this SNP could influence the response of leukemia cells to ROS levels, potentially affecting the progression and treatment response in B-ALL.
title: N-Acetylcysteine alters disease progression and increases Janus Kinase mutation frequency in a mouse model of precursor B cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: A low-frequency coding variant rs56094005 in DOK2 was identified as associated with lymphocyte count, as well as monocytes, neutrophils, and platelets, in a large trans-ethnic analysis of 750K individuals, which included subjects from the UK Biobank.
title: An allelic series rare variant association test for candidate gene discovery

finding: The rs9693089 SNP located at the FAM167A locus was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) and was found to be within an active enhancer state in islet tissue, which is considered relevant for T2D pathogenesis. It was linked to low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) synthesis and exhibited activated chromatin marks such as H3K4me3, H3K4me1, and H3K27ac.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The rs896854 SNP located at the TP53INP1 locus was identified as functionally significant by LOGO-3357. This SNP was linked to lipid levels within the Chinese population, achieving genome-wide significance in a later study, indicating a consistent association with metabolic traits.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The rs516946 SNP, associated with the ANK1 locus, was recognized for its correlation with reduced insulin levels and pancreatic islet dysfunction. LOGO-3357 identified it as a functionally significant variant with an activated chromatogram feature.
title: Integrating convolution and self-attention improves language model of human genome for interpreting non-coding regions at base-resolution

finding: The variant rs2046338 was prioritized in a multiple sclerosis GWAS region due to its association with IL7 expression, an immune-related gene. This SNP was identified as having high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with the sentinel GWAS variant (R2 = 0.99 in Europeans and R2 = 0.95 in Africans). The C allele of rs2046338 was predicted to increase chromatin accessibility, with significant allele-specific accessibility observed in 44 out of 48 heterozygous samples. Additionally, it created a binding motif for OCT family transcription factors, implicating its role in the transcriptional regulation of IL7 and the increased risk for multiple sclerosis.
title: Transcriptomics and chromatin accessibility in multiple African population samples

finding: The variant rs582283 was implicated in Alzheimer's disease, disrupting the binding site of the RNA Binding Protein YBX3 in the gene MS4A3, leading to exon skipping. This disruption was characterized by a significant spliceAI delta score and validated through antisense oligonucleotide experiments.
title: A Deep Dive into Statistical Modeling of RNA Splicing QTLs Reveals New Variants that Explain Neurodegenerative Disease

finding: The variant rs6410 was associated with skeletal aging by promoting retention of intron 3 of CYP11B1. This finding highlighted the importance of considering various types of splicing events in elucidating disease mechanisms.
title: A Deep Dive into Statistical Modeling of RNA Splicing QTLs Reveals New Variants that Explain Neurodegenerative Disease

finding: The SNP rs28601761 in lincRNA RP11-136O12.2 was pleiotropic for cardiovascular disease, HbA1c, and blood triglyceride levels, linking these traits through shared genetic factors.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: Regarded as significant for its predictive capability regarding endogenous serum serine concentrations, this SNP was postulated to relate to MacTel risk through its involvement in serine metabolism.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The rs6983267 SNP was associated with prostate cancer risk and was found to interact with regulatory elements that modulate POU5F1B expression, highlighting its role in disease-related gene regulation.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was identified as a significant genetic variant related to intestinal tumors. Mice lacking a Myc enhancer that includes this human SNP were shown to be resistant to the development of such tumors. This finding suggested a potential role for rs6983267 in the regulation of tumorigenesis.
title: Oncogenic Notch promotes long-range regulatory interactions within hyperconnected 3D cliques

finding: The SNP rs10110456 was identified in a study exploring human glioma migration and infiltration properties, which were proposed as targets for personalized radiation medicine. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic aspects influencing glioma behaviors, particularly in the context of treatment strategies for patients.
title: Advanced image generation for cancer using diffusion models

finding: The report confirmed that rs13266634, located within the SLC30A8 gene, was significantly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D), exhibiting preferential expression of the T2D risk allele, leading to higher levels of SLC30A8 expression in human islets.
title: Multiple genetic variants at the SLC30A8 locus affect local super-enhancer activity and influence pancreatic β-cell survival and function

finding: The SNP rs11558471 was identified as exhibiting highly imbalanced allelic expression, significantly influencing SLC30A8 expression in human islets, with a strong association to T2D risk.
title: Multiple genetic variants at the SLC30A8 locus affect local super-enhancer activity and influence pancreatic β-cell survival and function

finding: The SNP rs16879552 was significant in this cohort, with an association with HSCR (5% vs. 3%, OR=1.9, P=2.7×10^-6), marking it as a new finding in European ancestry subjects.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs16879576 demonstrated an association with HSCR (5% vs. 2%, OR=2.3, P=7.2×10^-9), making it a new observation in the European ancestry context.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The SNP rs75463553 was associated with the variance of FV plasma levels (p = 8.4 x 10^-9) but not with mean FV levels (p = 0.49). It interacted with the loci GRIN2A and POM121L12, both involved in smoking biology, highlighting its complex role in FV variability.
title: A genome wide search for non-additive allele effects identifies PSKH2 as involved in the variability of Factor V activity

finding: The A allele of the rs10505025 polymorphism was associated with a significantly higher mean cross-sectional area (CSA) of fast-twitch muscle fibers in physically active men (AA: 5796 ± 1526 µm²; GA: 5260 ± 1350 µm²; GG: 4011 ± 983 µm²), indicating its role in muscle hypertrophy. Furthermore, this allele was significantly over-represented in strength athletes (OR = 2.13, P = 0.05) and sprinters (OR = 2.93, P = 0.03) compared to endurance athletes.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The A allele of rs4734621 was strongly associated with increased expression of the UBR5 gene (P = 0.000013). The AA genotype was linked to high competition results in elite weightlifters (P = 0.016) and the A allele was over-represented in elite strength athletes compared to controls (OR = 1.94, P = 0.04) and in elite power athletes compared to endurance athletes (OR = 2.2, P = 0.04).
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: This SNP was analyzed in the context of parentally-imprinted methylation. It demonstrated that the unmethylated fragments corresponded exclusively to the paternal allele in tongue epithelial cells, supporting evidence of maternal-specific methylation effects observed in families studied.
title: Atlas of imprinted and allele-specific DNA methylation in the human body

finding: For the variant rs10866912, it was shown that substituting the reference T allele with C resulted in a predicted decrease in expression of the gene MROH-6, whereas substituting it with G was predicted to increase expression. This variant was identified as part of a binding site for the transcription factor INSM1, a transcriptional repressor, which points to its regulatory significance.
title: Predicting cell population-specific gene expression from genomic sequence

finding: Zhang et al. in 2018 applied CNN techniques using Landsat 8 datasets to map paddy rice, demonstrating the versatility of deep learning in agricultural and ecological mapping.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs2294008 was associated with the C-C-A and C-A-G haplotypes at the prostate stem cell antigen (PSCA) gene, which showed an association with low risk of gastric cancer in specific populations. The C allele at this SNP was targeted in ongoing positive selection, particularly in Asian populations.
title: Spatial and temporal diversity of positive selection on shared haplotypes at the PSCA locus among worldwide human populations

finding: The SNP rs2976391 is part of the haplotypes C-C-A and C-A-G at the PSCA gene. The C/A allele at this locus contributed to the genetic differentiation observed in populations and was included in the assessment of ongoing positive selection related to gastric cancer risk.
title: Spatial and temporal diversity of positive selection on shared haplotypes at the PSCA locus among worldwide human populations

finding: Similar to rs2976391, rs2978983 was identified as contributing to the C-C-A and C-A-G haplotypes. This SNP played a role in the genetic variation related to the prostate stem cell antigen (PSCA) gene and was involved in the positive selection dynamics observed in the studied populations.
title: Spatial and temporal diversity of positive selection on shared haplotypes at the PSCA locus among worldwide human populations

finding: The SNP rs10105357 located on chr.8p23.2 was associated with stronger connectivity in the medial amygdala network and was linked to greater prosocial behaviors in individuals carrying two copies of the minor allele. The study demonstrated that these individuals had higher CSMD1 expression in the temporal cortex.
title: Genetic variation in CSMD1 affects amygdala connectivity and prosocial behavior

finding: The SNP rs74402157 was directly associated with an age at onset of MS, showing an effect size related to the complement regulatory protein CSMD1.
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs138693040, located in the KCNQ3 gene, was found to be significantly associated with variation in the electrocardiographic QT interval. This finding had important implications as QT interval variations can be influenced by the activity of the sympathetic nervous system.
title: Novel target identification using single cell sequencing and electrophysiology of cardiac sympathetic neurons in disease

finding: The rs74942016 SNP resulted in a missense mutation in NRG1, leading to a Valine to Leucine amino acid change at position 321 in Type III Nrg1, which was associated with schizophrenia and psychosis in a Costa Rican population. This mutation was shown to cause impaired cleavage by gamma-secretase, leading to reduced nuclear translocation of the Nrg1 intracellular domain. The dysfunction in Nrg1 signaling was linked to disruptions in neurogenesis, cell cycle regulation, and neuronal maturation in the adult mouse dentate gyrus, indicating a significant role in the underlying cellular pathology related to schizophrenia.
title: Psychosis-associated Valine to Leucine mutation in Neuregulin1 disrupts expression of a schizophrenia susceptibility gene network within the hippocampus and alters adult hippocampal neurogenesis

finding: This SNP was identified as being associated with PUD in relation to the PSCA gene. It was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs2294008, previously linked with duodenal ulcer in a Japanese cohort, suggesting its importance in the genetic risk for PUD after H. pylori infection.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: This SNP was connected to a significant interaction in the region between IDO2 and C8orf4 (p=1.09×10−7) and implicated in differing effects on SCZ risk between males and females.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: Found near C8orf4, this SNP had a significant GxS interaction (p=1.55×10−7) in BIP and SCZ, suggesting its involvement in neuronal processes.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The SNP rs12549167 was identified as a candidate causal variant in the chr8:80998464-81093464 locus associated with fasting glucose (FG) levels and colocalized with a fetal-like iPSC-PPC-unique singleton eQTL for TPD52. This association had an effect size of -0.99 and a posterior probability of 33.9%, indicating that decreased expression of TPD52 during development was hypothesized to influence glucose metabolism and fasting glucose levels in adulthood.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The missense mutation rs74942016 in NRG1 resulted in a Valine to Leucine amino acid change at position 321 in Type III Nrg1. This mutation was associated with schizophrenia and psychosis specifically in a Costa Rican population. The mutation was found to impair the cleavage of Nrg1 by gamma-secretase, leading to reduced nuclear translocation of the intracellular domain (ICD) of Nrg1. As a consequence, this impaired nuclear signaling was shown to disrupt several developmental processes, including cell cycle regulation, neurogenesis, differentiation, and dendritic growth in the dentate gyrus (DG). Abnormalities in neuronal specification and dendrite morphology were also noted. Additionally, known schizophrenia susceptibility genes were dysregulated and interacted within a broader network of disrupted genes involved in schizophrenia pathology.
title: Psychosis-associated Valine to Leucine mutation in Neuregulin1 disrupts expression of a schizophrenia susceptibility gene network within the hippocampus and alters adult hippocampal neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs892844 was associated with three potential CTCF binding occurrences in the genomic region chr8:142,782,661-142,782,680. This finding was retrieved by the GRAFIMO tool and highlighted its ability to discover motif occurrences that overlap with known variants, indicating potential individual-specific binding events influenced by genetic variation.
title: GRAFIMO: variant and haplotype aware motif scanning on pangenome graphs

finding: This SNP was linked with higher risk of metabolic dysfunction in individuals associated with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Its significant replication across multiple cohorts suggested a robust association with the disease.
title: Brain-specific Gata4 downregulation in Greywick female mice models the metabolic subtype of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: This SNP had been associated with both lean and overweight/obese subgroups of bodyweight-stratified cases of PCOS, indicating its relevance in different phenotypes of the disorder.
title: Brain-specific Gata4 downregulation in Greywick female mice models the metabolic subtype of polycystic ovary syndrome

finding: rs7982 was associated with the ASE of CLU specifically in the TC region, indicating a strong expression relationship that was not significant in other brain regions.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with CLU specifically in the TC region, supporting its role in regulatory mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: Associated with CLU in the context of splicing QTLs, indicating complex regulatory interactions.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The study uncovered a significant role for the lncRNA UCA1, which is associated with the SNP rs10110440, in regulating stem cell properties in colorectal cancer (CRC). Specifically, it was found that depletion of UCA1 led to an increased stem-cell phenotype in HT29 cells, highlighting the importance of UCA1 in maintaining cellular differentiation and possibly influencing cancer progression.
title: Long non-coding RNA UCA1 affects chromatin remodeling via SMARCA2-containing SWI/SNF complex in human colorectal cancer

finding: The finding related to rs118031911 is significant as it was associated with hereditary retinal degenerations (HRDs) despite its relatively high frequency (0.6%) in the general population. It exhibited a 3.5-fold enrichment in HRD patients (2.1% in patients compared to 0.6% in controls, p-value = 9.2×10^-5). Although this variant does not cause disease alone, its presence in patients alongside other alleles in genes such as EYS supports a quasi-Mendelian inheritance model, indicating its complex role in auto recessive HRD conditions.
title: A frequent variant in the Japanese population determines quasi-Mendelian inheritance of rare retinal ciliopathy

finding: SNP rs13265509, located in an intergenic region between IDO2 and C8orf4, showed significant interaction (p=1.09×10^-7) and was implicated in immune regulatory functions associated with schizophrenia and other mood disorders.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: SNP rs13270586 was found near C8orf4 and indicated a significant GxS interaction (p=1.55×10^-7), relating it to immune regulatory functions across schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The deepSNP rs7839671 was identified as a key regulator for major depressive disorder (MDD), affecting the expression of genes such as SPIDR and showing connectivity in a QTL network, demonstrating significant associations in MDD contexts.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The rs6983267 SNP was associated with prostate cancer and interacted with chromatin fragments containing transcription factor binding sites, including AR, thus influencing the expression of POU5F1B.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The A allele of rs10505025 was strongly associated with greater cross-sectional area (CSA) of fast-twitch muscle fibres in physically active men, specifically showing a mean CSA of 5796 μm² for AA genotype compared to 5260 μm² for GA and 4011 μm² for GG. Furthermore, the A allele was significantly over-represented in strength athletes (OR = 2.13) and sprinters (OR = 2.93) compared to endurance athletes.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The A allele of rs4734621 was associated with increased UBR5 gene expression (P = 0.000013) and was linked to better performance outcomes, showing that the AA genotype correlated with high competition results in elite weightlifters (P = 0.016). The A allele was over-represented in elite strength athletes (OR = 1.94) compared to controls, and in elite power athletes against endurance athletes (OR = 2.2).
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The SNP rs58169119, located in an intergenic region on chromosome 8, was associated with an average increase of 28 points in DSST scores among carriers of the rare allele, indicating its protective role in cognitive performance.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs10100360 was identified in the context of research discussing the potential of ionophores as anticancer drugs and chemosensitizers. This SNP was found to be associated with mechanisms involving ion transport and membrane potential regulation, especially in the context of its role in altering potassium concentration gradients which can influence cellular metabolic states.
title: Towards optical measurements of membrane potential values in Bacillus subtilis using fluorescence lifetime

finding: The analysis included findings related to the polymorphism rs12898 of the CTSB gene, which was reported to be associated with primary hepatic cancer; however, its specific implications in UCEC were not explicitly detailed within the provided context. Further research could explore its potential relevance in UCEC.
title: Pattern Recognition Receptor based Prognostic Biomarkers for predicting Survival of Uterine Corpus Endometrial Cancer Patients

finding: In a study focusing on prostate cancer, rs11986220 was identified as a novel eQTL for the MYC oncogene. It was shown that higher levels of DNA methylation at a nearby CpG site prevented CTCF binding, which inhibited the formation of a chromatin loop necessary for long-range interaction between this rSNP and the MYC gene.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: In high linkage disequilibrium with rs77216612, this SNP was also associated with gene expression, particularly for C6orf136. The relationship was mediated by a specific eCpG site, showcasing its role in transcriptional regulation, although it was not categorized as an eQTL or meQTL.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: The SNP rs1078141 was identified as genome-wide significant for pure happiness, with a beta coefficient of 0.102 and a p-value of 1.03×10⁻⁸. The study found that this SNP had previously been associated with general cognitive ability, which highlighted its role in the genetic architecture of happiness.
title: Distinguishing Happiness and Meaning in Life from Depressive Symptoms: a GWAS-by-subtraction study in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1400506 was identified as part of a caQTL that colocalized with another eQTL for the lincRNA gene AC023095.1, with significant evidence for causal involvement.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The SNP rs7006037 was highlighted as an independent signal colocalizing with a caQTL for the lincRNA gene AC023095.1, denoting its active role in mediating gene regulation.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: The finding indicated that rs12549167 (chr8:81078464:C>T) was the most likely candidate causal variant underlying both TPD52 expression in fetal-like iPSC-PPC and fasting glucose association, suggesting its role in glucose metabolism and fasting glucose levels.
title: Disease-associated regulatory variation often displays plasticity or temporal-specificity in fetal pancreas

finding: SNP rs9987289 was a liver-specific eQTL for TNKS, exhibiting allele-specific binding for transcription factor HNF4A, which was linked to reduced expression of TNKS and associated with various lipid traits.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs6605578 was noted to interact with the gene DEFA3, which is heavily expressed in neutrophils. It also displayed a high 3DFunc score, indicating its potential role in transcriptional regulation related to Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS).
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: For SNP rs7814783, a similar interaction with the DEFA3 gene was reported, linking it to elevated 3DFunc scores. This connection suggested a significant role in the pathogenesis of MDS.
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: The SNP rs2738144 was also found to interact with DEFA3, showing high 3DFunc scores, reinforcing its potential involvement in transcriptional regulation in the context of MDS.
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: rs9331896 was associated with CLU gene's histone modifications, underscoring its involvement in Alzheimer's disease risk factors.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs1532278 showed association with the CLU gene, linked with histone modifications and TF-binding sites, emphasizing its importance in Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs2279590 was connected to open chromatin regulation near the CLU gene, indicating its role in modulating Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: rs9331888 was found within the promoter flanking region of the CLU gene, highlighting its potential impact on Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs4841132-A allele at chr8p23.1 was significantly associated with an insulin resistance phenotype in non-diabetic individuals, characterized by elevated fasting glucose and insulin levels, increased triglycerides, and higher waist-hip ratio. This variant was located within the second exon of the long non-coding RNA gene LOC157273, a negative regulator of PPP1R3B expression. Knockdown of LOC157273 in human hepatocytes led to increased PPP1R3B mRNA levels and glycogen deposition, linking the rs4841132-A allele to increased expression of PPP1R3B and improved glycogen storage, which is crucial for understanding type 2 diabetes risk.
title: A long noncoding RNA, LOC157273, is the effector transcript at the chromosome 8p23.1-PPP1R3B metabolic traits and type 2 diabetes risk locus

finding: The rs587776650 SNP was associated with the NBN gene, responsible for Nijmegen breakage syndrome (NBS). The allele frequency was reported at 0.27% in the Polish population, which was nearly sevenfold higher than the global MAF of 0.04%, indicating a significant prevalence in this demographic.
title: ‘The Thousand Polish Genomes Project’ - a national database of Polish variant allele frequencies

finding: This SNP disrupted a stop codon in MSR1, leading to an elongated transcript with an additional arginine amino acid, which could influence the protein's activity.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: For the SNP rs56372821, which was identified as the single genome-wide significant SNP for cannabis use disorder (CUD), the analysis revealed a strong causal effect that reflected an increased risk of ADHD. The odds ratio (OR) for the one-SNP instrument was reported as 1.47 with a p-value of 0.001, indicating strong statistical significance. This finding suggested that liability to CUD increased the risk of developing ADHD, corroborating the bidirectional relationship established in the broader study context.
title: Investigating causal pathways between liability to ADHD and substance use, and liability to substance use and ADHD risk, using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs3849810 was identified as an intergenic variant on chromosome 8 linked to distressing psychotic experiences. It had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.22 and a p-value of 4.55 x 10^-8, suggesting an increased risk for distressing psychotic experiences in individuals with this variant.
title: Genetic association study of psychotic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: The rs35447033 SNP in the <italic>NRG1</italic> region showed a significant association with the Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) in individuals of European ancestry, with a combined p-value of 3.02 × 10<sup>−9</sup>. This association was linked to lung development and inflammatory response.
title: Whole-Genome Association Analyses of Sleep-disordered Breathing Phenotypes in the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: This SNP was located in the FOXA1 binding motif, and it had a striking association with PrCa (p-value of 1.4e-188), highlighting its potential importance in cancer biology.
title: Reconstructing protein interactions at enhancer-promoter regions in prostate cancer

finding: The SNP rs7827317 at the TRAPPC9 locus showed a significant association with ADHD risk during the analyses of both discovery and replication datasets, establishing TRAPPC9 as another novel ADHD candidate gene linked to the disorder.
title: Intellectual Disability-related genes increase ADHD risk and locomotor activity in Drosophila

finding: The rs620513 variant correlated to <italic>FGF20</italic> was reported to have a significant association, as the proximal gene showed enriched and specific expression in dopaminergic neurons, suggesting its potential role in Parkinson's disease.
title: Single cell spatial transcriptomic and translatomic profiling of dopaminergic neurons in health, aging and disease

finding: The SNP rs1030431 was found to be significantly associated with gall bladder diseases and lipid metabolism traits. It was positioned 12,126 bp upstream of the UBXN2B gene.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs1805874 of the Calbindin1 gene was associated with Parkinson's Disease in a study focused on the Han Chinese population. This finding was significant as it linked a specific genetic variant to a neurodegenerative condition, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in Parkinson's Disease.
title: Synaptic dysfunction and dysregulation of extracellular matrix-related genes in dopaminergic neurons derived from Parkinson’s disease sporadic patients and with GBA1 mutations

finding: The SNP rs2565064 was identified as SCZ-associated and interacted with the promoter of the gene PNOC in neurons. PNOC was highly expressed in neurons, indicating that it was the putative target gene for this SNP in the context of schizophrenia.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: The SNP rs28541694 was also identified as SCZ-associated and linked to the promoter of the gene ZNF395 in astrocytes. ZNF395 showed specific expression in astrocytes, suggesting its role as a potential target gene related to both schizophrenia and Alzheimer's disease.
title: SnapHiC-G: identifying long-range enhancer-promoter interactions from single-cell Hi-C data via a global background model

finding: The SNP rs596038 was significantly associated with tuber flesh color (FC) variation, explaining 9.51% of the phenotypic variance in the panel at Godet. Homozygous accessions (AA) at this locus exhibited a significantly higher proportion of genotypes with white FC compared to heterozygous accessions (AG). This SNP was annotated as intergenic, located between the genes Dioal.07G046300 (upstream) and Dioal.07G046200 (downstream), which encode calcium-binding protein 39 and auxin binding protein respectively.
title: Genome-wide association studies reveal novel loci controlling tuber flesh color and oxidative browning in Dioscorea alata

finding: The rs17321515 A>G polymorphism in the TRIB1 gene was associated with serum lipid levels in populations studied, which could imply its involvement in cardiovascular disease risk factors.
title: HEPG2 EXPRESSION OF MIR-202 & TRIB-1 UNDER METABOLIC AND INFLAMMATORY STRESS

finding: The SNP rs10098778 in the NDUFAF6 locus was confirmed as a suggestive genetic signal associated with late-onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). Its association was reported with an OR of 1.06 and a p-value of 2.54 x 10^-8, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in AD.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of dementia and its clinical endophenotypes reveal novel loci associated with Alzheimer’s disease and three causality networks of AD: the GR@ACE project

finding: The SNP rs6988698 was identified as having the strongest evidence for selection in the STC1 candidate region, showing a high allele frequency of 75% in the Turkana population while being near invariant outside of Africa, indicating a significant association with adaptation to dehydration stress in this group.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The SNP rs10107949 was significantly correlated with serum urea levels in the Turkana people, with a beta of 0.030 and p-value of 1.96×10-2, suggesting its relevance to kidney function and adaptation to a high-protein diet.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The SNP rs75070347 also showed a significant correlation with serum urea levels, with a beta of 0.040 and p-value of 9.23×10-3, reinforcing its association with kidney function and adaptation among the Turkana.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The SNP rs7012892, similar to rs6988698, presented high frequency (84%) in the Turkana and had suggestive selection signals, highlighting its role in the adaptation related to pastoralism and water stress.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The SNP rs6994711 was found at 84% frequency in the Turkana population, exhibiting strong evidence for selection, which correlated with the population's renal function optimization under dehydration stress and dietary adaptations.
title: Adaptations to water stress and pastoralism in the Turkana of northwest Kenya

finding: The missense mutation rs74942016 in <italic>NRG1</italic>, resulting in a V321L change, was associated with schizophrenia and psychosis in a Costa Rican population. The mutation impaired gamma-secretase cleavage of Nrg1, leading to reduced nuclear translocation of the intracellular domain (ICD). This disruption was linked to dysregulated neurogenesis, cell cycle dynamics, and neuronal maturation within the mutant dentate gyrus in a transgenic mouse model. Additionally, the mutation affected a network of schizophrenia susceptibility genes, highlighting its role in the underlying cellular pathology associated with the disorder.
title: Psychosis-associated Valine to Leucine mutation in Neuregulin1 disrupts expression of a schizophrenia susceptibility gene network within the hippocampus and alters adult hippocampal neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs34173062, located in the SHARPIN gene, was identified as a significant modifier of a newly defined MRI feature of brain atrophy related to Alzheimer's disease (AD) in a study of 1,100 subjects from the AD Neuroimaging Initiative dataset. This association was found to be genome-wide significant with a p-value of 2.1×10^-10. Further replication in the UK Biobank cohort (n=8,428) revealed that the risk allele rs34173062-A correlated with reduced cortical thickness in the left (p=0.002) and right entorhinal cortex (p=8.6×10^-4). Additionally, a significant correlation was noted between the risk allele and parental history of AD, with a meta-analysis p-value of 2.3×10^-6. These findings underscore the potential role of SHARPIN genetic variability in the neurodegenerative process associated with AD.
title: A Non-Synonymous SHARPIN Variant is Associated with Limbic Degeneration and Family History of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs11781321 was identified as an intronic variant within ATP6V0D2 and is associated with lower LDL levels in Ldlr knockout mice, indicating a potential regulatory role in lipid metabolism.
title: Genetically regulated gene expression underlies lipid traits in Hispanic cohorts

finding: The SNP rs72728755 achieved genome-wide significance in the Combined sample with a p-value of 9.35E-14 and an odds ratio of 2.13 (95% CI = [1.74–2.62]), indicating a strong association with orofacial clefts (OFCs).
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: In the European sample, rs55658222 was found to be the lead SNP in the 8q24.21 region, which has been consistently implicated in OFC studies. It was in strong linkage disequilibrium with another SNP, rs987525, previously identified in other studies.
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: The SNP rs987525 also showed strong associations with OFC phenotypes, having been the lead SNP in several previous GWAS studies for OFCs. It displayed modest evidence of association in the Colombian trios with a p-value of 8.609e-06 and an odds ratio of 1.984 (CI = [1.46–2.69]).
title: Whole genome sequencing of orofacial cleft trios from the Gabriella Miller Kids First Pediatric Research Consortium identifies a new locus on chromosome 21

finding: The finding related to SNP rs10090316 indicated that it played a role in the relationship between the extracellular matrix and pancreatic cancer. Specifically, it was linked with the expression of certain biomarkers relevant in the context of tumor-associated fibroblast behavior within pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), providing important insights into the microenvironment and potential progression of the disease.
title: 3D in vitro modeling of the exocrine pancreatic unit using tomographic volumetric bioprinting

finding: The rs6983267 SNP was identified as a functionally validated GWAS susceptibility SNP for colon and prostate cancer. It demonstrated increased chromatin accessibility in colorectal cancer (COAD) samples compared to kidney cancer (KIRC) samples. This accessibility was linked to MYC gene expression and specifically associated with the MYC promoter, suggesting its role in cancer-type specific chromatin modification.
title: The UCSC Xena platform for public and private cancer genomics data visualization and interpretation

finding: This SNP was previously linked with age of smoking initiation and suggested various interactions with lung function, underscoring the complex genetics underlying smoking behaviors.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: In the study mentioned, the SNP rs10100342 was associated with the mechanisms underlying the action and synergism of trastuzumab and pertuzumab in targeting HER2-positive breast cancer. The findings indicated a potential link between this SNP and the variability in patient responses to therapies that target the HER2 pathway.
title: Mammalian orthoreovirus infection in human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive (HER2+) breast cancer cells

finding: This eQTL was found to increase transcript levels of DDHD2 in both fetal and adult cortices, indicating its regulatory role across developmental stages.
title: Autism spectrum disorder: understanding the impact of SNPs on biological pathways in the fetal and adult cortex

finding: This sentinel variant was located in an intron of DEPTOR and showed multiple associations, including decreased expression of DEPTOR in lung and colon tissues, as well as various regulatory effects on nearby genes.
title: Genome-wide association study of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The variant rs3808619, which is strongly correlated with rs4739134, produced a strong emVar effect with the alternate C allele leading to an AE of FC=2.11 (FDR q=0.0008). It likely has regulatory action on interleukin 7 (IL7), a cytokine associated with SLE nephritis.
title: Massively Parallel Reporter Assay Confirms Regulatory Potential of hQTLs and Reveals Important Variants in Lupus and Other Autoimmune Diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with Barrett's oesophagus and predicted to impair the activity of its regulatory element by disrupting the binding site for the transcription factor TEAD, indicating its potential role in the pathology of BO.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The rs6983267 SNP, located in a TCF binding site of the c-Myc upstream enhancer (c-Myc-335), was associated with increased risks of colorectal and prostate cancer. This SNP enhanced the affinity of TCF7L2 for the binding site, thereby promoting Wnt signaling, which is implicated in cancer pathogenesis. Through experimentation in LS174T colorectal cancer cells with active Wnt signaling, the knockdown of TCF7L2, CDX1, and CDX2 resulted in reduced activity of a luciferase reporter for c-Myc-335, indicating the critical role of this SNP in Wnt-regulated transcriptional activation.
title: Wnt target enhancer regulation by a CDX/TCF transcription factor collective and a novel DNA motif

finding: The noncoding common variant rs2441850, located near the RIMS2 gene, reached genome-wide significance for its association with increased bitterness perception of sucralose, as indicated by a p-value of 2.6e-8.
title: Worldwide study of the taste of bitter medicines and their modifiers

finding: The SNP rs147998249 was found to be associated with alanine aminotransferase (ALT) levels in the gene GPT with a very strong association (P=2.35×10^-60). This indicated a significant genetic influence on liver function related to ALT levels.
title: Loss-of-function genomic variants with impact on liver-related blood traits highlight potential therapeutic targets for cardiovascular disease

finding: The variant rs8192327 in SFTPC was linked to FEV/FVC ratio with a PIP of 0.875, demonstrating its association with respiratory traits.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs10503253, a genome-wide associated variant linked to schizophrenia risk through the gene <italic>CSMD1</italic>, was reported in the literature by Donohoe et al. (2013). This finding indicates a relevant connection to neurodevelopmental disorders, specifically schizophrenia, and supports the notion that DNVs affecting the <italic>CSMD1</italic> enhancer may have implications in intellectual disability as well.
title: De novo variants in population constrained fetal brain enhancers and intellectual disability

finding: The SNP rs892844 was associated with three potential CTCF binding occurrences identified within the region chr8:142,782,661-142,782,680 when analyzed using GRAFIMO. This finding indicated that the presence of rs892844 could influence the binding landscape of transcription factors, specifically CTCF, which is critical for regulating gene expression.
title: GRAFIMO: variant and haplotype aware motif scanning on pangenome graphs

finding: The research identified that the rs2280838-T haplotype was associated with increased transcript levels of the SLC39A4 gene specifically in liver tissue. Targeted DAF-seq analysis indicated that this haplotype contributed to a chromatin configuration that favored promoter activation, contrasting with the lower expression seen in the C allele.
title: Deaminase-assisted single-molecule and single-cell chromatin fiber sequencing

finding: SNP rs2071518 was found to be associated with two traits in opposing directions, illustrating its contribution to diverse blood pressure outcomes.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis with IHT

finding: At the TOX locus, rs1947178 was identified as the lead variant and was predicted to increase chromatin accessibility, implicating it as a causal variant mediating T1D genetic risk through islet cell types.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs1839333, located in 8q21.11, was associated with urate levels, showing significant links to body mass traits and pancreatic cancer. It had strong associations in European and Asian populations with P-values less than 2.0E-18, suggesting its importance in metabolic studies.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs1913638, also on 8q21.13, was significantly associated with uric acid levels (P < 2.0E-18) across various GWAS, highlighting its relevance in uric acid metabolism and potential links to body mass traits and pancreatic cancer.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The rs2293855 polymorphism in the MTMR9 gene was associated with glucose tolerance, insulin secretion, insulin sensitivity, and an increased risk of prediabetes. This finding highlighted an important genetic factor contributing to metabolic traits, which are relevant when considering the metabolic efficiency often seen in cave-adapted species, including the cave forms of Asellus aquaticus.
title: Developmental transcriptomic analysis of the cave-dwelling crustacean, Asellus aquaticus

finding: The rs60298754 polymorphism in MMP16 was associated with clinical phenotypes of Parkinson's disease.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The SNP rs10090297 was linked to the expression of stem cell markers like SOX-2 and OCT-4 in glioblastoma cells. This effect was determined when analyzing the combined treatment of cyclopamine and temozolomide, which enhanced stemness properties in glioma cells, offering insights into the underlying mechanisms of glioblastoma and potential new therapeutic strategies.
title: Cyclopamine sensitizes Glioblastoma cells to Temozolomide treatment through Sonic Hedgehog pathway

finding: The rare variant rs76094283 was identified as the most likely candidate causal variant in the GFRA2 locus, with associations to increased fat intake and changes in carbohydrate and protein intake. This variant played a significant role in neuron differentiation and survival mechanisms, which directly related it to dietary behavior.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association meta-analysis of dietary intake identifies new loci and genetic and functional links with metabolic traits

finding: Significant allelic differences were noted for SNP rs13250438 in both K562 and SH-SY5Y cell lines, and it served as an eQTL for one or more genes in the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, linking it to gene regulation associated with schizophrenia.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: The rs201412253 variant, a missense variant in the IL7 gene, was associated with increased lymphocyte count in South Asians (SAS) with a P-value of 4.4×10^-10. The variant was found to increase IL7 protein secretion significantly in a heterologous cellular system by 83% (P=2.7×10^-5) and was noted for its role in B- and T-cell lymphopoiesis.
title: Trans-ethnic and ancestry-specific blood-cell genetics in 746,667 individuals from 5 global populations

finding: The rs1293298 variant, located in the intron 1 of the CTSB gene, was identified as the top variant significantly associated with Parkinson’s disease (PD) risk with a p-value of 3.41E-16. It was shown to exhibit a protective effect against PD while being associated with elevated expression levels of CTSB in brain tissues relevant to the disease, particularly in regions like the basal ganglia, cortex, and nucleus accumbens. The fine mapping analysis indicated that this variant had the highest posterior probability of being causal among the nominated variants, and it was in linkage disequilibrium with multiple other variants associated with CTSB expression.
title: The Parkinson’s disease risk gene cathepsin B promotes fibrillar alpha-synuclein clearance, lysosomal function and glucocerebrosidase activity in dopaminergic neurons

finding: Located near the ZBTB10 gene on chromosome 8, SNP rs148563140 showed significant association (OR: 3.42, p=3.28×10^-8) in patients with TGA, indicating its role in this specific type of congenital heart anomaly.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: SNP rs143638934, also located near the ZBTB10 gene on chromosome 8, reached genome-wide significance (OR: 3.42, p=3.51×10^-8) in the TGA subgroup, highlighting its significance in the development of CHD.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs41475248 was identified as a significant target locus in type II diabetes. The study examined the concordance between different methods used to determine other SNPs that exhibited synergistic interactions with rs41475248. These interactions were quantified using Kendall's tau, which provided a measure of the association strength between rs41475248 and other SNPs in the context of type II diabetes.
title: Novel methods for epistasis detection in genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs80207740 was identified as a promoter SNP, having a PIP of 0.97 for red blood cell count with PolyFun + SuSiE, whereas it had a PIP of 0.28 with SuSiE alone. This finding underscored the utility of functional annotations in resolving genetic contributions to this trait.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: The SNP rs907183 was necessary in disrupting KLF5 binding, thus resulting in reduced transcriptional promoter activity linked to the development of Barrett's oesophagus.
title: The metaplastic precursor state to oesophageal adenocarcinoma represents reversion to a transient epithelial cell state in the developing oesophagus

finding: The variant rs1208 (NAT2*12) demonstrated nearly 100% allele frequency in various Chinese provinces, indicating that genetic testing for this variant before isoniazid use may be less critical in Chinese populations compared to others.
title: NyuWa Genome Resource: Deep Whole Genome Sequencing Based Chinese Population Variation Profile and Reference Panel

finding: At the TOX locus, rs1947178 was prioritized as the lead variant, showing co-accessibility with the TOX promoter region and was predicted to increase chromatin accessibility, implicating it as a candidate for mediating T1D genetic risk in pancreatic islet endocrine cells.
title: Single-cell gene expression and chromatin accessibility profiling of human pancreatic islets at basal and stimulatory conditions nominates mechanisms of type 1 diabetes genetic risk

finding: The SNP rs2954658 (T to C) within the RPL8 locus was associated with increased expression based on prior B cell eQTL studies. Editing of this SNP in Daudi cells demonstrated a significant effect of the T allele on RPL8 expression, with a p-value less than 10^-6 indicating a strong association, and no other genotype effects on individual genes were observed.
title: Defining the function of disease variants with CRISPR editing and multimodal single cell sequencing

finding: The SNP rs298619 exhibited a strong association with the schizophrenia cluster, with a p-value of 4.7 x 10^-10 in the GWAS analysis. This SNP was not detected in earlier univariate MRI analyses, which had a minimum p-value of 3.3 x 10^-7, highlighting its potential significance in the genetic understanding of schizophrenia.
title: Linking the genetic structure of neuroanatomical phenotypes with psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs4476990 in the lncRNA MIR2052HG was associated with lower MIR2052HG and ERα expression in the presence of aromatase inhibitors (AIs). This SNP was identified in a GWAS as related to breast cancer free interval, demonstrating an HR of 0.37 and a significance level of P=2.15E-07. In the presence of androstenedione, lymphoblastoid cell lines (LCLs) with this variant genotype exhibited dose-dependent increases in LMTK3 expression.
title: MIR2052HG regulates ERα levels and aromatase inhibitor resistance through LMTK3 by recruiting EGR1

finding: Similar to rs4476990, the SNP rs3802201 in MIR2052HG was linked to lower expression levels of MIR2052HG and ERα when AIs were present. Identified through the same GWAS, it also displayed the correlation between its variant genotype and increased LMTK3 expression in the context of androstenedione treatment, reinforcing its role in regulating breast cancer biology.
title: MIR2052HG regulates ERα levels and aromatase inhibitor resistance through LMTK3 by recruiting EGR1

finding: The study reported that mice lacking a Myc enhancer that included the human SNP rs6983267 demonstrated resistance to intestinal tumors. This finding highlighted the significance of this SNP in cancer susceptibility and suggested a protective effect against tumor development.
title: Preventing cancer by long-term partial Myc suppression

finding: The SNP rs10090316 was found to have a significant association with the extracellular matrix dynamics in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). This SNP's expression was assessed in relation to the activation of fibroblasts within the tumor microenvironment. The study indicated that the variants associated with this SNP could influence fibroblast behavior in relation to cancer progression, thus contributing to the understanding of the intricate relationship between the extracellular matrix and pancreatic cancer.
title: Tomographic volumetric bioprinting of 3D pancreatic cancer models

finding: The PD risk allele rs2740595-C was validated to decrease the expression of cathepsin B (CTSB) in monocytes, revealing another mechanism through which this SNP may contribute to PD.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: The PD risk allele rs2306528-T was associated with an exon skipping event in FAM49B, a novel regulator of mitochondrial function, linking splicing variation to PD risk.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: The SNP rs10090341 had a documented link to gut inflammation and colorectal cancer as described in the work by Leon-Cabrera et al. (2018). This study established that deficiency in STAT1 signaling, related to this SNP, predisposed individuals to inflammation in the gut, which in turn could lead to the development of colorectal cancer.
title: MetaFunc: Taxonomic and Functional Analyses of High Throughput Sequencing for Microbiomes

finding: The SNP rs28396985 was identified in the intron of TSNARE1 and impacted a strong REST motif. Analysis showed that the G allele significantly increased expression of TSNARE1 compared to the A allele. This finding aligned with the predicted REST delta-binding scores, which were 34.1 for the A-allele and 30.4 for the G-allele. Additionally, eQTL results from GTEx indicated that the G allele enhanced TSNARE1 expression in various tissues, such as the cerebellum and spleen, supporting the conclusions drawn from both MPRAduo assays and the eQTL data.
title: Whole genome functional characterization of RE1 silencers using a modified massively parallel reporter assay

finding: rs1296028 affected the expression of the lysosomal protease Cathepsin B (CTSB) in cis and influenced the expression of 16 genes in trans, indicating its association with Parkinson's disease susceptibility.
title: Tensor Decomposition of Stimulated Monocyte and Macrophage Gene Expression Profiles Identifies Neurodegenerative Disease-specific Trans-eQTLs

finding: rs9331896 was identified as a trans-eQTL associated with a significant number of genes, and its effects were consistent with Alzheimer's disease risk mechanisms.
title: Tensor Decomposition of Stimulated Monocyte and Macrophage Gene Expression Profiles Identifies Neurodegenerative Disease-specific Trans-eQTLs

finding: The rs7014968 SNP was identified as a significant factor that increased serum total cholesterol levels and posed a higher risk for conditions such as coronary heart disease and ischemic stroke. This finding linked the genetic variation to alterations in cholesterol metabolism, suggesting that individuals with this SNP variant may have a predisposition to higher cholesterol levels and related cardiovascular diseases.
title: A small H2O-soluble ingredient of royal jelly lower cholesterol levels in liver cells by suppressing squalene epoxidase

finding: Rs3008282 was identified as a significant splicing quantitative trait locus (svQTL) associated with the RPL23AP53 pseudogene isoforms, influencing the balance of alternative splicing. The minor allele was linked with increased expression of the larger isoform, suggesting a role in breast cancer risk.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: Rs2906324 was identified as a significant splicing quantitative trait locus (svQTL) related to RPL23AP53 alternative splicing, with the minor allele associated with higher expression of the predominant RPL23AP53 isoform, which has been linked to breast cancer susceptibility.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: Rs66823261 was identified as a significant svQTL for the expression of RPL23AP53 isoforms, particularly linked to increased expression of the larger isoform RPL23AP53-203, which has associations with breast cancer risk.
title: Alternative splicing regulation by GWAS risk loci for breast cancer

finding: The analysis revealed that while <italic>OSGIN2</italic> was nearest to the IBD lead SNP rs7015630, it showed no functional link to IBD, indicated by a low network score of 43%. In contrast, the gene <italic>RIPK2</italic>, located 108 kb distal to the SNP, exhibited a robust network score of 99%. This gene encodes a mediator of inflammatory signaling through its interaction with the bacterial sensor <italic>NOD2</italic>, suggesting its critical role in IBD pathogenesis.
title: Network expansion of genetic associations defines a pleiotropy map of human cell biology

finding: The SNP rs10090316 was identified in the context of its association with the extracellular matrix's role in cancer, specifically in pancreatic cancer. The study highlighted a complex relationship between the extracellular matrix and tumor behavior, indicating that genetic variations at this locus could influence the interaction between cancer cells and their microenvironment, potentially impacting metastatic progression.
title: Small extracellular vesicles promote stiffness-mediated metastasis

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with increased risk for colorectal and prostate cancer. It resided in a TCF binding site, enhancing the affinity to TCF7L2. The associated WRE (c-Myc-335) was tested in LS174T colorectal cancer cells with RNAi against TCF7L2, CDX1, and CDX2, showing decreased reporter activity, highlighting the role of this SNP in Wnt signaling and tumorigenesis.
title: Wnt-responsive enhancer regulation in mammals by a CDX/TCF transcription factor collective and a novel DNA sequence motif

finding: The SNP rs6984305 on chromosome 8 was identified as having a genome-wide significant GxE effect on HDL. This was noted in the context of previous findings where it demonstrated an effect of GxE interaction on HDL with sleep duration as the environmental factor. It was also associated with liver enzyme levels and serum alkaline phosphatase levels, indicating its potential impact on lipid metabolism.
title: A two-step approach to testing overall effect of gene-environment interaction for multiple phenotypes

finding: Similar to rs1800775, rs17482753 was also replicated in the HDL analysis, showing a PIP of 1.00, confirming its association with HDL cholesterol levels.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: SNP rs3748136 was shown to dramatically increase regulatory activity in K562 cells, with the A allele being approximately 18-fold more active than the G allele. Its role was further supported by proteomic analyses that indicated G allele disrupts binding motifs critical for transcription factor activity.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The SNP rs4129585 was found to be associated with methylation changes at the DMP cg00622907, which is located approximately 2500 base pairs near the gene TSNARE1. This association was significant in individuals with psychosis risk syndrome (PRS) and first-episode schizophrenia (FES). The DMP cg00622907, located within a CpG island in the body region of TSNARE1, was identified as part of the methylomic changes associated with schizophrenia, particularly highlighting hypomethylation in gene bodies.
title: Methylomic alteration in peripheral blood lymphocytes of prodromal stage and first-episode Chinese Han schizophrenia patients

finding: The SNP rs2954021, associated with the TRIB1 gene, predicted alanine transaminase (ALT) and alkaline phosphatase (ALP). It was mentioned in the context of its associations with potential confounders, indicating a significant role in liver function and its impact on body composition.
title: The effect of liver enzymes on body composition: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: rs189005747 was associated with the strength of the 1-day circadian periodicity with a p-value of 9.9×10^-9, located at gene XKR4, which was previously connected to thyroid stimulating hormone and coronary artery disease.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The Thr136Ile polymorphism (rs1390938) was identified as a unique mutation in the human VMAT1 gene, affecting monoamine uptake and associated with various psychopathological conditions including bipolar disorder, autism spectrum disorder, schizophrenia-related cognitive functions, and anxiety. Studies indicated this polymorphism resulted in reduced monoamine uptake, contributing to its association with psychopathological symptoms. It was also noted that this variant emerged just prior to the Out-of-Africa migration event and was under positive selection, marking its evolutionary significance in shaping human socio-emotional behaviors.
title: Humanized substitutions of Vmat1 in mice alter amygdala-dependent behaviors associated with the evolution of anxiety

finding: The SNP rs11780978 was associated with osteoarthritis (OA) through its correlation with DNA methylation at several CpGs within the PLEC gene. The A allele of rs11780978 was found to correlate with reduced PLEC expression. Additionally, it exhibited a stronger genotype-methylation effect in cartilage compared to synovium and peripheral blood. The study highlighted that the gene expression regulation via mQTLs was predominantly active in joint tissues.
title: Multi-tissue epigenetic analysis of the osteoarthritis susceptibility locus mapping to the plectin gene PLEC

finding: The SNP rs10283100 was found to be associated with cortical volume (CV) of the insula, with its position in the exonic region of the ENPP2 gene at 8q24.12, thus contributing to the understanding of genetic factors influencing brain structure.
title: Genetic Determinants of Cortical Structure (Thickness, Surface Area and Volumes) among Disease Free Adults in the CHARGE Consortium

finding: The rs28834970 variant, located in an intronic enhancer of the PTK2B gene, was validated as a causal variant associated with increased risk of Alzheimer's disease (AD). This variant introduced a novel binding site for the transcription factor CEBPB, leading to increased chromatin accessibility and global transcriptomic changes in hiPSC-derived macrophages and microglia. Specifically, the C allele resulted in a subtle downregulation of PTK2B expression, alterations in the expression of interferon gamma-responsive genes, and significant effects on chemotaxis and chemokine release in microglial cells, indicating its role in modifying microglial reactivity related to AD progression.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease-associated common regulatory variant in PTK2B has causal effects on microglial function

finding: The finding related to SNP rs6983267 indicated that mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which included this specific human SNP, showed resistance to intestinal tumors. This was significant as it tied the enhancer's function directly to oncogenic processes, particularly in the context of colorectal cancer.
title: Discovery and Functional Characterization of Pro-growth Enhancers in Human Cancer Cells
