finding: The ADRB3 rs4994 polymorphism was identified as increasing the risk of childhood and adolescent overweight/obesity in a meta-analysis performed by Xie et al. in 2020.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: This SNP was noted for a higher MAF presence in the pool of analyzed genetic markers.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The SNP rs2279590 was identified as being associated with pseudoexfoliation and Alzheimer's disease. It was reported to lie within an enhancer element, which regulates the expression of the genes clu, ephx2, and ptk2b, indicating its role in influencing gene expression related to these phenotypes.
title: CoMM-S2: a collaborative mixed model using summary statistics in transcriptome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs3808619 was found to alter the PU.1 binding motif, resulting in a higher binding affinity at the ZC2HC1A promoter. It was associated with lower lymphocyte counts and had been validated through reporter assays showing increased regulatory activity, as well as significant associations with chromatin accessibility and histone marks at the associated locus.
title: Colocalization of blood cell traits GWAS associations and variation in PU.1 genomic occupancy prioritizes causal noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The SNP rs142010226 was found to be strongly associated with HbA1c levels in the EXTEND human cohort, which included both diabetic and non-diabetic individuals of European ancestry. The association was statistically significant with a P-value of less than 10^-15, suggesting a critical role for this SNP in influencing glucose homeostasis.
title: Pancreatic islet α cell function and proliferation requires the arginine transporter SLC7A2

finding: Similar to rs142010226, the SNP rs2517232 showed a strong association with HbA1c levels in the EXTEND human cohort with a P-value of less than 10^-15. This finding reinforced the evidence for the contribution of SLC7A2 genetic variants in the regulation of glucose homeostasis in humans.
title: Pancreatic islet α cell function and proliferation requires the arginine transporter SLC7A2

finding: The SNP rs6651252 was associated with Crohn's disease and was shown to impact MYC gene expression in human colonic epithelial cells, indicating its relevance in inflammation processes.
title: Alternative paths to immune activation: the role of costimulatory risk genes for polygenic inflammatory disease in T helper cells

finding: The rs13702 variant in LPL was associated with HDL-cholesterol levels and suggested to underlie associations for triglyceride levels and type 2 diabetes. This was established via GWAS and subsequent metabolic and luciferase analyses.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: The SNP rs34034296 was identified as the most significant associated variant with mathematical reasoning ability in a study involving 1146 Chinese elementary school students. It reached a genome-wide significance level with a p-value of 2.01×10^-8 and was located near the gene CSMD3. This finding provided new insights into the genetic factors influencing mathematical reasoning.
title: A genome-wide association study identified new variants associated with mathematical abilities in Chinese children

finding: The AG allele of CLU rs9331896 was associated with lower risk of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) in most populations studied, except in African Americans where the OR was close to 1.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The meta-analysis of 14 cohorts indicated that rs11136000 in CLU was statistically significant in non-Hispanic Whites (NHWs) (OR=0.91) but showed no association in African American, Arab, or Caribbean Hispanic populations.
title: How understudied populations have contributed to our understanding of Alzheimer’s disease genetics

finding: The SNP rs10090301 was associated with the HIV-1 envelope protein gp120, which has been noted for promoting proliferation and activation of glycolysis in glioma cells. This finding highlighted a novel function of the gp120 protein, which was validated by literature indicating the impact of this protein on cellular functions in the context of HIV.
title: New Functions Identified for HIV gp120 with the New ProtSub Sequence Matching

finding: The SNP rs10090282 was associated with mini-chromosome maintenance protein 10 (MCM10) expression, which was found to be upregulated in cancer stem-like cells (CSCs). This upregulation was linked to the mediation of c-Myc, leading to DNA replication stress more pronounced in CSCs than in differentiated cancer cells. The finding suggested that MCM10 could serve as a novel prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target in breast cancer, thus providing a preclinical rationale to target the c-Myc-MCM10 axis.
title: MCM10 compensates for Myc-induced DNA replication stress in breast cancer stem-like cells

finding: The SNP rs6605578 was identified to interact with DEFA3, which is notably highly expressed in neutrophils. This interaction was recorded alongside high 3DFunc scores in the context of Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS), positioning it as a significant factor in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: The SNP rs7814783 also showed interaction with DEFA3 and was associated with high 3DFunc scores, contributing to the understanding of its role in Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS).
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: Similar to the other SNPs, rs2738144 was observed to interact with DEFA3 and to have high 3DFunc scores, further evidencing its potential involvement in the pathogenesis of Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS).
title: A 3D genome atlas of genetic variants and their pathological effects

finding: The SNP rs6651252 was implicated in Crohn's disease, where it was shown to impact MYC gene expression in human colonic epithelial cells. This connection provided insights into how genetic variations could influence gene expression in relation to inflammatory bowel diseases, linking genetic susceptibility to specific pathways.
title: Alternative paths to immune activation: the role of costimulatory risk genes for polygenic inflammatory disease in T helper cells

finding: The SNP rs138693040 in the KCNQ3 gene was significantly associated with variation in the electrocardiographic QT interval. This finding was based on human genome-wide association studies and highlighted the role of M-current modulators in cardiac function, particularly in relation to sympathetic nervous system modulation.
title: Novel target identification using single cell sequencing and electrophysiology of cardiac sympathetic neurons in disease

finding: The SNP rs3033002 was identified in the study discussing the evolution of tumor metabolism, suggesting its relevance in the context of carcinogenesis. The findings indicated that this SNP might influence metabolic pathways, particularly the energy transformation processes involved in cancer cell survival and proliferation, linked to the proposed mechanisms involving adenine and uric acid in the metabolism of tumors.
title: The role of Vitamin C in the energy supply of cells Hypothetical structure for energy transformation

finding: The SNP rs7834398 was found to be significant for HFpEF among African American women, with a p-value of less than 5x10^-8.
title: Biological Pathways and Gene Networks Link Inflammation and Vascular Remodeling to Both Heart Failure with Preserved and Reduced Ejection Fraction in Women across Ethnicities

finding: The SNP rs6993770 had a meta-P-value of 4.73 × 10^-8 and was identified at the ZFPM2 locus. This locus was associated with diverse platelet traits and colocalized with signals related to platelet activity.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs4736367 was shown to significantly affect gene expression in SH-SY5Y cells (FDR < 0.05), pointing towards its involvement in mechanisms associated with alcohol consumption and related traits.
title: Functional 3’-UTR Variants Identify Regulatory Mechanisms Impacting Alcohol Use Disorder and Related Traits

finding: The PPP1R3B rs4240624 polymorphism was associated with metabolic dysregulation in the context of obesity, identifying its relevance in weight management.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs3808607 showed associations driven by both urban status and ancestry, indicating its relevance in studies of LDL-cholesterol.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: Similar to rs39451, the SNP rs39499 was identified in high LD with other significant SNPs, suggesting its involvement in the regulatory network governing KCS4 expression and subsequently fatty acid synthesis in response to carbon starvation.
title: Hello darkness, my old friend: 3-Ketoacyl-Coenzyme A Synthase4 is a branch point in the regulation of triacylglycerol synthesis in Arabidopsis thaliana

finding: The SNP rs11778951 was shown to have an eQTL effect on the expression of <italic>ENPP2</italic> in pDCs, with the G allele linked to increased expression; it coincided with ATAC-seq peaks indicating regulatory significance, particularly related to interferon signaling.
title: Autotaxin may play a Critical Role between the Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of SLE in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: rs16897517 showed a significant association (p = 1.39 × 10−11) with the nose and its adjacent regions. It was reported that T alleles were connected to shorter nostrils, suggesting a broader influence on the nose shape. The candidate gene, VPS13B, was highly expressed in cranial neural crest cells.
title: Genome-wide Association study of facial morphology identifies novel genetic loci in Han Chinese

finding: Was associated with various cognitive traits, reinforcing its role in intelligence and related behaviors.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: Identified alongside rs4976977 for its influence on cognitive-related traits.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs900776, located in the intronic region of DMTN, showed a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.99 when analyzed with XMAP, indicating it is likely a causal variant associated with traits leading to increased LDL levels. This finding was substantiated by lower correlation with nearby SNPs in the African population compared to the European population, leading to an improved statistical power in detecting it as a causal variant due to reduced linkage disequilibrium (LD).
title: XMAP: Cross-population fine-mapping by leveraging genetic diversity and accounting for confounding bias

finding: At <italic>NBN</italic>, the rare stop-gained variant rs756831345 was identified on 8q and was strongly associated with 8q CNN-LOH events (OR=91, p=9.8×10⁻²³). This variant consistently duplicated the <italic>NBN</italic> risk allele, highlighting its significance in clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The genomic landscape of clonal hematopoiesis in Japan

finding: The SNP rs11778951 impacted the expression of ENPP2 in pDCs, with the G allele associated with increased expression. It coincided with ATAC-seq peaks specific to pDCs and altered STAT-binding motifs, linking increased interferon signaling in SLE patients to ENPP2 expression.
title: Autotaxin is a Potential Link between Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of Systematic Lupus Erythematosus in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: The C allele in rs78898975, located in the TATA-box binding protein associated factor 2 (TAF2), was associated with an increased risk of t-MDS, having an odds ratio of 5.87 (95% CI = 3.20, 10.76, P<sub>meta</sub>=9.9×10<sup>-9</sup>), while not being significantly associated with de novo MDS (OR=1.8, 95% CI=0.81-1.45, P<sub>meta</sub>=0.20).
title: Genome-wide association analyses identify variants in IRF4 associated with acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with increased colorectal cancer (CRC) risk in humans and was identified as a crucial element of the c-Myc-335 enhancer, which is known to regulate Wnt target MYC. This enhancer demonstrated binding by SOX9 in HT-29 CRC cells, supporting the role of SOX9 in Wnt-driven CRC by demonstrating how it activates MYC through enhancer regulation.
title: SOX9 binds TCFs to mediate Wnt/β-catenin target gene activation

finding: The Methionine sulfoxide reductase A rs10903323 G/A polymorphism was associated with an increased risk of coronary artery disease, which can influence kidney function.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The association of the rs11780592 polymorphism with oxidized LDL and mortality in diabetic chronic kidney disease patients highlighted its potential impact on renal outcomes.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The EPHX2 polymorphism rs751141 was studied in relation to diabetic nephropathy, affirming its role in kidney disease in diabetic populations.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The DEF1B variant rs11362 was associated with periodontitis risk and, given periodontitis relation to systemic inflammation, could reflect on kidney health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Associated with NKX6-3 as well, rs12549902 was linked to T2D risk and demonstrated strong allelic association with NKX6-3 expression in pancreatic islets.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: At the ANK1 locus, rs62508166 had a high linkage disequilibrium with the lead cis-eQTL variant for ANK1, showing a strong association with increased ANK1 expression in both subcutaneous adipose tissue and skeletal muscle.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: This variant was also part of the ANK1 locus, showing a significant association with increased expression of ANK1 in subcutaneous adipose and skeletal muscle, indicating its contribution to T2D risk through the regulation of insulin sensitivity.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: RS144239281 was noted as one of the T2D association signals in the study, although specific details regarding its association strength were not provided.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: This variant acted in high LD with rs62508166 and was mentioned in the context of its association with ANK1 expression and T2D risk.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: Associations were too weak to indicate significance (P>0.05).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was found to exhibit long-range interaction with the MYC gene, which was linked to an increased risk of colorectal cancer.
title: Predicting the effects of SNPs on transcription factor binding affinity

finding: An association was found between rs10957311 and increased expression of LRP10 in CD14+ monocytes, indicating divergent effects compared to expressions in other cell types.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs11778951 was found to influence the expression of the ENPP2 gene in pDCs, with the G allele increasing ENPP2 expression. This SNP coincided with a peak specific to pDCs and altered a STAT-binding motif, suggesting a mechanism whereby increased interferon signaling in SLE patients may enhance STAT3 complex binding, leading to upregulated ENPP2 expression.
title: Autotaxin is a Potential Link between Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of Systematic Lupus Erythematosus in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: The SULF1 gene rs6990375 polymorphism was found to be significantly associated with fetus failure during IVF procedures.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The EPHX2 rs751141 variant was implicated in the risk of diabetic nephropathy, emphasizing its role in metabolic complications within a type 2 diabetes context.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs4840568 overlapped with a chromatin peak primarily in B/plasma cells near the gene BLK, with a strong association observed (Wilcoxon p=1.49e-05). This finding highlighted the relevance of B cell involvement in RA.
title: The Chromatin Landscape of Pathogenic Transcriptional Cell States in Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: In the African American population, the SNP rs146535276 was found to correlate with non-response to phenylephrine, where carriers displayed an average ΔSBP of -2 mmHg, contrasting with a ΔSBP of 15 mmHg seen in non-carriers.
title: Rapid response to the Alpha-1 Adrenergic Agent Phenylephrine in the Perioperative Period is Impacted by Genomics and Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with cancer risk, particularly in colorectal cancer, where it showed long-range interaction with the MYC gene. This finding highlighted its regulatory significance in tumorigenesis and underscored the importance of non-coding genetic variants in cancer susceptibility.
title: Quantifying the impact of genetically regulated expression on complex traits and diseases

finding: The CLU gene polymorphism rs11136000 was linked to mild cognitive impairment in T2DM patients, suggesting its involvement in both neurodegeneration and diabetes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The rs62512616 variant met genome-wide significance for both CompGaming (p=3.01x10^-8) and SCZ (p=2.30x10^-9). It was found to be located in the intronic region of the TSNARE1 gene and exhibited opposite effects, showing a log10(odds ratio) of 0.025 (SE=0.011) in SCZ and a beta of -0.007 (SE=0.001) in CompGaming.
title: DRD2 and FOXP2 are implicated in the associations between computerized device use and psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs4872393 was identified as a lead variant associated with visceral adipose tissue adjusted for body mass index (VATadjBMI) and waist-to-hip ratio. In a large cohort of 40,032 individuals from the UK Biobank who underwent MRI imaging, association analysis indicated that the minor allele 'A' of rs4872393 was linked to variations in VATadj, as well as associations with ASAT and GFAT, demonstrating its relevance in metabolic phenotypes.
title: A single cell atlas of human and mouse white adipose tissue

finding: The rs11786030 SNP in AGO2 was noted for its association with breast cancer patient survival.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: Another SNP in AGO2, rs2292779, also showed association with breast cancer patient survival.
title: A pan-cancer atlas of somatic mutations in miRNA biogenesis genes

finding: The SNP rs10105828 was found to be associated with HbA1c, confirming its role along with rs1050828 in G6PD, thus reinforcing the influence of G6PD variants on HbA1c diagnostics.
title: Impact of rare and common genetic variants on diabetes diagnosis by hemoglobin A1c in multi-ancestry cohorts: The Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine Program

finding: The SNP rs56800165 was associated with SNAI2 and extended to the gene PTPN6 with a q-value FDR ≤ 0.17, revealing its role in regulatory mechanisms involving cell migration and glucose homeostasis, particularly in inflammatory contexts.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The SNP rs1313432491 was identified by Bayestrat within a high LD region flanked by eQTLs rs11986182 and rs74549553, providing evidence of its significance.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: Previous studies reported a significant association between SNP rs17410962 and HDL-C, and it was detected by Bayestrat.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: SNP rs1400899529 was associated with two nearby eQTLs, rs113988682 and rs17091891, within a high LD region, suggesting it is a true positive finding.
title: Bayestrat: Population Stratification Correction Using Bayesian Shrinkage Prior for Genetic Association Studies

finding: The variant rs10283362 was linked to enhancer activity for the NDRG1 gene. The alternative allele of this variant increased enhancer activity in vitro, suggesting that it plays a significant role in regulating NDRG1 expression, which is connected to kidney function.
title: Variants in tubule epithelial regulatory elements mediate most heritable differences in human kidney function

finding: The rs2572431 polymorphism on chromosome 8 was investigated in relation to individual differences in anxiety-related coping modes. This finding highlighted the association of the SNP with anxiety, indicating a potential genetic influence on how individuals cope with anxiety.
title: Similarities and dissimilarities between psychiatric cluster disorders

finding: The study reported that the SNP rs531564 was identified as influencing transcriptional regulation and processing mechanisms associated with miR-124, which correlated with cervical cancer occurrence, particularly in the context of persistent high-risk HPV infection.
title: Exosomal miRNA-124 is involved in the immune regulation of cervical cancer by regulating CD45 alternative splicing

finding: It was found that rs73662598 also played a role in the transcriptional regulation and processing mechanisms of miR-124, impacting the expression levels in relation to cervical cancer and persistent HPV infection.
title: Exosomal miRNA-124 is involved in the immune regulation of cervical cancer by regulating CD45 alternative splicing

finding: Similar to the other SNPs, rs73246163 was reported to affect the transcriptional regulation of miR-124, contributing to insights regarding its association with cervical cancer susceptibility and high-risk HPV persistence.
title: Exosomal miRNA-124 is involved in the immune regulation of cervical cancer by regulating CD45 alternative splicing

finding: The rs6983267 variant was associated with prostate cancer and regulated the expression of POU5F1B by facilitating chromatin interactions with important transcription factors.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs6998061 was associated with colorectal cancer, demonstrating an exome-wide significance with a p-value of 1.4E-07. This finding was part of a study using the PWAS methodology, which identified functional variants related to protein-coding genes associated with the disease. Among the total of 6 significant associations discovered for colorectal cancer, this SNP was the only one meeting the criteria for exome-wide significance, establishing its relevance in the genetic landscape of colorectal cancer.
title: PWAS: Proteome-Wide Association Study

finding: The A allele of rs10505025 was associated with a greater cross-sectional area (CSA) of fast-twitch muscle fibers in physically active men. Specifically, AA carriers had significantly larger mean CSA (5796 ± 1526 μm²) compared to carriers of G alleles. The A allele was also over-represented in strength athletes (OR = 2.13, P = 0.05) and sprinters (OR = 2.93, P = 0.03) compared to endurance athletes, indicating its association with strength and power performance.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The A allele of rs4734621 was significantly associated with increased UBR5 gene expression (P = 0.000013) and linked to improved competition results in elite weightlifters (P = 0.016). The rs4734621 AA genotype was over-represented in elite strength athletes compared to controls (OR = 1.94, P = 0.04) and in elite power athletes compared to endurance athletes (OR = 2.2, P = 0.04), highlighting a genetic predisposition favoring strength/power characteristics.
title: UBR5 is a Novel E3 Ubiquitin Ligase involved in Skeletal Muscle Hypertrophy and Recovery from Atrophy

finding: The SNP rs13262681 at the ANK1 locus was noted for colocalization with an eQTL for NKX6.3 expression in pancreatic islets, classified as an islet signal (PPA=0.97).
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs13262861 was characterized as an islet signal at the ANK1 locus, showing correspondence with strong islet enhancer features.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The rs192456638 variant mapped to a non-coding region with a MAF of 0.0045 and an OR of 1.80, contributing to type 1 diabetes risk.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: This variant was associated with luminal-like and HER2-positive/non-luminal subtypes; however, it did not show an association with TN disease.
title: Common variants in breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The variant rs143649318 significantly decreased the expression of MRPL15 in the brain-amygdala, brain-hypothalamus, and brain-frontal cortex, indicating its role in gene regulation relevant to neurological phenotypes.
title: Unveiling the role of Tdark genes in genetic diseases and phenotypes through bioinformatics-based functional enrichment and network analyses

finding: The study reported that SNP rs6983267 was associated with the allelic-specific upregulation of MYC through chromatin looping with a distant enhancer element. This SNP was found to be present in colon cancer cells and was linked to a higher preferential binding of the transcription factor TCF4 to the enhancer element, thereby playing a role in the dysregulation of MYC expression in the context of cancer. This finding highlighted the significant impact of this SNP on MYC regulation and its potential implications for understanding colon cancer pathology.
title: A novel tool for monitoring endogenous human MYC transcription and translation by EGFP tag insertion at the 3’ end using CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing

finding: The rs28834970 variant, located in an intronic enhancer of the PTK2B gene, was identified as a causal SNP associated with increased risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD). It was shown that the C allele of this SNP decreased PTK2B expression in hiPSC-derived macrophages and microglia. This decrease in expression correlated with altered chromatin accessibility and the introduction of a novel binding site for CEBPB transcription factors, leading to significant effects on the transcriptome. Specifically, there were reductions in the expression of various chemokines and impaired chemotaxis of microglial cells towards chemoattractants, which are relevant to the pathophysiology of Alzheimer's disease.
title: An Alzheimer’s disease-associated common regulatory variant in PTK2B has causal effects on microglial function

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with altered function in enhancer activity, specifically in the context of intestinal tumors. It was highlighted that mice lacking a Myc enhancer, which includes this SNP, exhibited resistance to the development of these tumors. This finding indicated a potential driving role of this SNP in tumorigenesis through its influence on gene regulation.
title: Methylation-mediated retuning on the enhancer-to-silencer activity scale of networked regulatory elements guides driver-gene misregulation

finding: The SNP rs7844298, corresponding to the missense variant P746S in EDEM3, was associated with a 5% decrease in plasma triglyceride (TG) levels in over 300,000 individuals, with a statistically significant p-value of 1.2x10^-5. This finding suggested a novel role for EDEM3 in regulating lipoprotein metabolism without significant correlations to HDL-C and LDL-C levels.
title: EDEM3 modulates plasma triglyceride level through its regulation of LRP1 expression

finding: The ANGPT-2 gene variant rs2442598 was associated with an increased risk for diabetic retinopathy in type 1 diabetes patients in Brazil.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The HAS2 gene SNP rs2046571 exhibited marginal association with Parkinson's disease in Chinese females, contributing to genetic studies of the disease.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs10096097 in the GOAT gene was associated with type 2 diabetes mellitus in Egyptian populations.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs6983267 was associated with increased risk of colorectal cancer due to its long-range interaction with the MYC gene. This finding was significant within the context of cancer risk, emphasizing the importance of this SNP in tumorigenesis.
title: IGREX for quantifying the impact of genetically regulated expression on phenotypes

finding: Similar to rs1800775, this SNP also showed a PIP of 1.00 for HDL, confirming its association across independent study datasets.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The SNP rs138693040 in the KCNQ3 gene was found to be significantly associated with variation in the electrocardiographic QT interval. This finding highlighted the potential role of M-current modulation in the cardiac function, particularly as it relates to sympathetic nervous system activity.
title: M-current downregulation leads to stellate ganglia sympathetic hyperactivity associated with hypertension

finding: The SNP rs7001 was linked to ancestral mutations in the gene Khdc3, which caused hepatic metabolic defects in wild type female mice descended from these mutants. The findings indicated that these metabolic issues were a result of transcriptional dysregulation in hepatic metabolic genes and were observed to persist over multiple generations, affecting both female and male lineages.
title: Khdc3 Regulates Metabolism Across Generations in a DNA-Independent Manner

finding: The SNP rs2061831 was consistently prioritized as a top SNP in both European Ancestry (EA) and African Ancestry (AA) analyses, due to its significant change in Minor Groove Width (MGW), with a value of 1.63 Å that was 2 standard deviations above the mean. It exhibited strong evidence of association with Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) in both ancestry groups, corroborated by external functional data.
title: Intrinsic DNA topology as a prioritization metric in genomic fine-mapping studies

finding: The SNP rs4841132, located within the long non-coding RNA LOC157273 on chromosome 8p23.1, was identified as a risk variant for type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM). This genetic variant was associated with altered expression of PPP1R3B, which encodes a regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 1 (PP1). The study discussed the potential link between PP1 and traits related to T2DM, suggesting that genetic factors influencing insulin signaling and phosphorylation of Akt may be integral to the disease mechanism.
title: A genetic strategy to measure insulin signaling regulation and physiology in Drosophila

finding: The SNP rs6651252 was identified as having a significant impact on MYC gene expression in human colonic epithelial cells. This finding related specifically to its association with Crohn's disease, highlighting the potential role of MYC dysregulation in the disease's pathology.
title: Premature Aging and Reduced Cancer Incidence Associated with Near-Complete Body-Wide Myc Inactivation
